Stormchaser 20/02/2020 18:40
18:41
18:45
It is a time of adventure. Heroes and villains alike seek their fortunes across the galaxy. Nowhere is this more apparent than in Mos Eisley spaceport, a wretched hive of scum and villainy situated on the desert planet of Tatooine. The Hutts command a strong presence in Mos Eisley, but they are not the only criminals. Rival syndicates and cabals prowl the dusty streets, making profits at the expense of one another and society at large. Inevitably these disparate groups collide, their conflicting interests leading to open strife. As unrest grips Mos Eisley's underworld, Prello the Hutt contacts a group of mysterious heroes, requesting their aid in locating one of her valued retainers. Can they find him before his enemies do?
toddmoonbounce 20/02/2020 18:47
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EjMNNpIksaI
JManFilms
Star Wars Theme Song By John Williams
Stormchaser 20/02/2020 19:03
Mos Eisley is a large starport with a long history of criminal activity. Even when under the firm control of the Galactic Empire, the criminal elements of Mos Eisley thrive, seemingly unhindered by the might of the galactic superpower. In fact, the war of the Rebellion does more to expand the black market on Tatooine than any efforts made by the Hutts in the centuries before or since. Mos Eisley is primarily controlled by the Desilijic Hutts, but other contenders work on the sidelines. One such contender is Prello the Hutt, a self-described small-timer from the Anjiliac kajidic. Prello's areas of expertise include burglary, stolen art, and obscure artifacts. Though she keeps none of these items for herself, Prello takes a personal interest in their acquisition and dispersal to interested parties. She is a fence - someone who can find a buyer for nearly anything of value that crosses her path.
19:04
In her line of work, Prello maintains a group of employees to perform specific duties on her behalf. Her retinue contains everything from con-artists to spies to thugs for times when violence is the only alternative. However, one of her most valued employees is a Balosar rogue by the name of Barin Trevina. Trevina left the polluted filth of his homeworld and came to Tatooine in search of a better life. His cousin Olev secured legitimate employment, but Barin preferred to utilise his skills as a burglar for hire. He claims to be skilled enough to gain access to any building in Mos Eisley, and he has gone so far as to accept challenges from anyone willing to risk a wager. That was how he came to the attention of Prello, and he has proven a valuable asset to her ever since. Recently, Barin has gone missing, and Prello is at a loss without her favourite thief at her beck and call. She had sent him out in search of information on a strange artifact known only as the Fell Star. Barin's last communication with Prello indicated that he had ascertained the location of the Fell Star, but he was not specific about where it was. He mentioned that he had attracted unwanted attention, but he assured her that he could take care of himself. That was over a week ago, and Prello has grown increasingly agitated as the time has passed.
19:09
Prello calls you all to her townhouse in an upscale part of Mos Eisley. Unlike the typical Hutt, Prello meets her guests at the door and makes a point of fussing over them in person, offering aperitifs and drinks to ease their appetites and thirst. The behaviour is strange and, for a Hutt, perhaps insane. Such might be the case, but Prello is nonetheless charming and accommodating.
19:10
The townhouse is comfortably opulent, without being excessive. The walls are hung with tasteful pieces of art. Exotic palms in hand-crafted pots are placed throughout her home, giving it a sense of life. Fountains, too, play an important role, with nearly every room containing at least one.
RisenZed 20/02/2020 23:03
As Prello leads the group through the townhouse, Zed walks near the rear of the party. He listens attentively to Prello's charming ramblings, but he hangs back. He's not avoiding Prello, but he's obviously uncomfortable working for a Hutt. He had voiced his concerns to the squad, but he had been overruled. Which is fine with him. He's not in command anymore -- not since the war ended. Zed's blaster rifle, slung across his back, clicks against his worn, matte-grey armor. Or at least, the parts of it that still fit around his slightly-expanded mid-section. His right hand rests on the hold-out blaster holstered at his thigh, the other hand mopping the sweat off his bald head. Damn this planet, he thinks. What I wouldnâ€™t give for a good olâ€™ Kaminoan monsoon. (edited)
Drake | Emperor 21/02/2020 04:05
As he follows next to his brothers, being lead around by Prello the Hutt, Gauss thinks to himself; This sure is a change of scenery, a rather hot and terrible one. I wish I was back on a starship, or even Kamino and its endless storms. At least this Hutt seems to be a good host, most Hutts I have had contact with seem to be rather bloated with self-worth. (edited)
Drake | Emperor 21/02/2020 05:33
Gauss still wears his helmet, even though all its functionalities no longer work and is battered to hell and back, he never feels right without it. He also kept few plates from the Katarn armor he used to wear during the war, attaching them to a less obtrusive combat suit. He carries a simple Carbine Blaster, its all that is let of his DC-17m IWS, having lost all the attachments while escaping the Empire. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 21/02/2020 13:44
Kite waves off the offer of food and drink. As Prello prattles on he is listening somewhat but mostly keeping his eyes peeled. He doesn't like to be out in the open like this but his brothers insisted that Prello would take offense if he found Kite skulking outside or in a snipers perch. As if the Slug or his half trained goons could ever do so. Though he doesn't share some of his brothers distaste with working for a Hutt, without the army they needed work and the means to prove that the Kamino bred clones were without equals After deserting the Empire he sold his Katarn armor and bought a cheap imitation of Mandalorian armor. The armor is black with gold highlights, while its not of the finest quality you can tell it has been meticulously maintained. He wears this with his helmet on and a carbine rifle slung across his back. The only thing he misses from his old kit is the IWS sniper rifle but it was lost when he deserted. (edited)
toddmoonbounce 21/02/2020 17:09
A fit and slender female Togruta steps into the entryway of Prello's townhouse. Her bright blue skin pops against a dark grey tactical jumpsuit, tailored in all the right places to show herself off. Even more eye catching are the darker blue stripes wildly adorning her montrals and lekku. She smiles brightly and shares a hug with Prello as she welcomes her. "You always know how to quench this girls palette," Adorhi says as she takes the Alderaanian wine, her favorite, that Prello had waiting. As they move into the townhome, Adorhi eyes the few paintings Prello does keep along their way. Probably from one of her errands for Barin, ugh... she thinks to herself. "So, love, what are we after today? Perhaps a piece for yourself for a change? Something you'd like me to aquire for you?" Adorhi tried not to emphasize "me" too much but to her, it felt like the only word in the question. No response. It's odd for Prello to be so reserved, especially when it was just the two of them. They continue to Prello's main chamber and Adorhi takes a seat on one of the chaise lounges she's accustomed to assuming. Just then, there is a notice of more guests and Prello excuses herself. Wonderful, up against that frizz Barin again. Oh lord, maybe she's putting us on a job together? I'd rather die, Adorhi thinks to herself. After a short moment, Prello returns accompanied by the footsteps of more than one individual. Four to be exact. Adorhi looks over the other guests and can't help but roll her eyes. Bucketheads? What the hell could they be doing here? (edited)
Rick Fisto 21/02/2020 17:28
Thumpthump. Thumpthump. Heart pumping audibly in his ears, Testy walks in next to Zed at the back of the group--always at the back of the group, always where he can see them--and takes in Prello's townhouse. As they are led back to the reception room, he mentally notes the back door, seen through a hallway, and all the windows: their sizes, location, and height from the ground outside. His precautions--not paranoia, he thinks to himself--aren't because Prello is a hutt. Hutts are people just like anyone else. Kind of. And they also aren't because Prello is a criminal. He'd worked with enough of those over the last year. They aren't even because this is all new--new location, new associate, new problem. He is just as nervous around the most familiar thing in the world to him: his brothers. It is just...the way things are now. Ever since the last order he'd ever obeyed. As he enters the reception room, Testy's heart, pounding away in his chest, suddenly skips a beat as he sees the blue Togruta reclining on the strange couch. For just a second, he's back in the war. Entering a planning room before a mission to see Haspin, their Jedi, waiting to brief them. But this Togruta isn't Haspin. Aside from the similar coloring, this slender girl looks nothing like the powerfully built Haspin, and certainly doesn't carry herself in the same way. And she's still breathing. Shaking off the initial shock of the unexpected and unnerving guest, he takes up a position right next to the entrance of the room, leaning up against the wall, half facing the group and half facing the door, trying to look relaxed. After checking the strap fixing his old thigh-plate to his left forearm as a make-shift shield, he places his right hand atop the saber at his belt--his saber, not mine--and waits for Prello to get to the point. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 21/02/2020 18:30
Kite sees the Togruta roll her eyes and Testy rest his hand on Haspin's saber. Kite sighs and hopes his brothers hold it together Kite looks at the Hutt and says what work do you have for us Prello? (edited)
Stormchaser 21/02/2020 18:54
Prello leads the clones into her study, where Adorhi is waiting, and slithers up onto a raised and padded platform, indicating to everyone else to take a seat on one of the comfortable divans in the room. "I've been in the business of sales and acquisitions for decades," she begins, "centuries, if truth be told. In that time, I've seen all kinds of objects cross my proverbial desk. These precious things never come easily, and I've always needed individuals to get them for me. I pay handsome finder's fees for unique things." "Barin Trevina was a Balosar of humble means when he came to Tatooine. He made himself available to me, and in an instant I saw someone who truly enjoyed his work. He was an artist as much as any painter or weaver is. He intrigued me, and I decided to hire him on full-time." "It's been nearly three years since I brought him on board, and he's made me a lot of credits with the items he's acquired. I always knew that there was risk in sending him on my little errands, but I suppose that I'd deluded myself into thinking that he was too good to get caught. He contacted me over a week ago, and told me that he'd found what I was looking for. He was still here, on Tatooine, at the time. He said he'd attracted some unwanted attention, but that he'd take care of it. I haven't heard from him since." "What I require is a group of canny individuals,such as yourselves, to find Barin and bring him back to me. Preferably alive and unharmed. I can provide you with a lead, and perhaps you can discover more through active investigation. Can I count on you?" (edited)
toddmoonbounce 21/02/2020 19:02
Adorhi audibly huffs. "Come now, Prello. Surely Barin's skills have gone cold if he's found himself in trouble. You can't be having a liability like that tracing back to you. Cut him off your payroll. I," she makes a quick unimpressed glance at the others, " will recover the item."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 21/02/2020 19:06
Kite nods and thinks I hate dealing with civvies ignoring the Togruta and says my brothers and I are highly trained professionals we can find and retrieve Barin, if we take the contact. What's the contract paying and did he mention where the trouble was coming from?
RisenZed 21/02/2020 19:08
Zed flatly ignores the offer of a seat and remains standing, subtly shifting his weight back and forth. "And just to be perfectly clear," he says, carefully regarding the Togruta, "Our objective wouldn't be to steal the thing Trevina was after, correct? We find him, and get him out alive. That's it." (edited)
Drake | Emperor 21/02/2020 19:13
So as not to insult the Hutt to much, Gauss takes a seat, but keeps a watchful eye on the seemingly confident, and possibly unpredictable, Togruta. (edited)
19:18

toddmoonbounce 21/02/2020 19:20
Adorhi stands, and walks towards the other group, thinking she gets a sense of slight unease. She slaps a hand on (Zed's) shoulder. "Boys, this isn't one of those gun and run missions. Prello's privacy and involvement in these dealings must be maintained and I can't help but think a bunch of muscles like yourselves, blasting anything that walks by would help that cause."
RisenZed 21/02/2020 19:24
Zed slowly turns his head to lock eyes with the togruta, raises a greying eyebrow, then turns back to Prello. (edited)
Stormchaser 21/02/2020 19:29
"Each of you will receive one thousand five hundred credits if you can find and return Barin to me," Prello assures Kite. "Twice that if you also return with the artifact that he was looking for." The Hutt glances at Zed, expecting this to answer his question. Her gaze scans the room, looking for reactions amongst the clones, until it comes to rest on Adorhi. The message is clear. If you want the job, bring me what I want. "Unfortunately, Barin wasn't specific about the problems he'd encountered, but I suggest you start by talking to his cousin Olev. The two shared an apartment until just recently." (edited)
Drake | Emperor 21/02/2020 19:36
Gauss stands up from his seat, ready to move out as soon as possible. As he check through his supplies, he asks Prello, Is there any chance of getting a small amount of the pay up front, for procurement of supplies and equipment? We should be fine without it, but every little bit can help assure our success.
Stormchaser 21/02/2020 19:40
Prello lets out a little laugh, as though almost embarrassed for Gauss. "Oh, my dear, payment on delivery, of course," she replies, bringing one stubby hand up to cover her mouth. (edited)
Drake | Emperor 21/02/2020 19:41
"Hey, a man can try." Gauss says before finishing up his inventory. (edited)
RisenZed 21/02/2020 19:43
Zed watches Gauss reassemble his pack and looks to the rest of Hammer Squad. He's not moving until they've all agreed to do this job. This isn't going to go well, he thinks. The money's too good, the intel's too shoddy. I've got a bad feeling about this.
toddmoonbounce 21/02/2020 19:49
Adorhi gives a heavy glare to Prello expressing her extreme distaste for this job, something she knows many others would lose a limb, or worse, for doing themselves. She then softens it to show her admiration and allegiance to the Hutt. She swiftly pushes through the others and heads towards the exit. "Do try and keep up, boys."
Drake | Emperor 21/02/2020 19:53
"Huh, she left before asking where Olev is located." Gauss thinks to himself (edited)
RisenZed 21/02/2020 19:54

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 21/02/2020 19:58

Rick Fisto 21/02/2020 20:13
As Adorhi walks by him, Testy gets another flash of Haspin, the Jedi passing him after some good-natured teasing of Zed about a successful mission that almost went to poodoo. "Oh and Test? Make sure you get those bombs prepped before first light," the Jedi says, looking back over his shoulder. Test. That's what his brothers used to call him, before... "Do you have an address for their apartment?" Zed's question snaps him back to reality. Kite chimes in, asking about the item they should find. But Testy is here to save this Barin. That's what Haspin would have done. Although the credits for the missing item would be nice. They could use some better equipment. A way to help out the villages being raided down by the Dune Sea. (edited)
Stormchaser 21/02/2020 20:28
Prello nods and flicks a finger across a datapad on a nearby side-table, transmitting the information to the group's own devices. "Olev is a terminal operator at the spaceport. He lives on the lower working-class side of town. You'll find him here." When Kite mentions the artifact Prello shrugs. "It's something than an anonymous client of mine has expressed interest in. A charm in the shape of a seven-pointed star, studded with blue stones. They call it the 'Fell Star'. Supposedly, the item is an artifact of some power, insofar as the Force is concerned. Of course, I'm none too impressed with Jedi parlour tricks, but my clients' superstition is quite often a compelling selling point!" (edited)
RisenZed 21/02/2020 20:34
At the mention of the Force, Zed looks to Test. Testy. He took Haspin's death -- murder -- hardest of all. He already has enough trouble, Zed thinks. I hope this doesn't make it worse for him.
Rick Fisto 21/02/2020 20:34
Testy barks out a laugh at Prello's last statement. Parlour tricks. I've seen Jedi bring back a man half from death and pull speeders right out of the sky, Testy thinks to himself. This Prello knows much less about the galaxy than she thinks. And I get the feeling she knows more about this Fell Star than she's letting on. But she's the client. She can keep her secrets if she wants. "Let's go Zed. We've got to catch up with our new...partner." (edited)
RisenZed 21/02/2020 20:35
Zed nods. He looks to Kite and Prello as well. "Looks like we're moving out, Kite," he says. "All good?" (edited)

Stormchaser 21/02/2020 21:16
The heat of the suns has yet to fade completely as the group ventures out into Mos Eisley's seedy apartment blocks. A few people move quickly along the winding streets, sticking to the scant shade offered by the squat, round structures that serve as homes in this part of town. The apartments are individual units, inset slightly into the ground in an attempt to deal with the heat of Tatooine's twin suns. The units are densely packed and narrow alleys and meandering avenues have formed between them. The beings that live here stick to themselves, being suspicious of both outsiders and residents alike.
RisenZed 21/02/2020 21:24
As the group steps out into the light of the suns, Zed immediately begins to sweat. I miss the armor cooling system more than the Republic, most days, he thinks. "I've got that proverbial bad feeling. Anyone feel like checking to see how much medpacs cost?" he asks the group.
Drake | Emperor 21/02/2020 21:26
"Last I checked they were 300 credits a piece, however they might not be of the best quality, this is Tatooine after all."
RisenZed 21/02/2020 21:29
At the mention of 300 credits, Zed coughs in surprise. He turns to Gauss. "I miss the days where we could head to the quartermaster and requisition supplies."
toddmoonbounce 21/02/2020 21:36
"Sorry to break it to you, but no handouts while working for Prello." Adorhi reflects on her culture's structure of equal contribution by every member of the pack. "Shouldn't you know this. You've worked for her previously, right umm.....?" Adorhi indirectly reaches for the clones name.
RisenZed 21/02/2020 21:41
"I'm Zed. This is Testy, Kite, and Gauss," he says. "We've mostly done guard duty for her before. Not really any reason to ask for an advance for that. This is a bit different. Zed looks in a few of his belt pouches. Only three cells left. "I would like to see if we can find a place to buy some ammo, if we've got the time." (edited)
toddmoonbounce 21/02/2020 21:59
"If you've got the coin, then we should be able to stock up on the way. But again, these don't tend to be shoot 'em ups unless the dwang hits the fan. IF Barin has been captured, I would assume that those who did so want to keep a low profile as well. I've come to notice this of most of Prello's clients and enemies over the past couple of years." Adorhi internally starts, realizing it's been that long since coming to Tatooine. She reaches up and pats the Akul tooth on her headpiece and thinks of home, of her family. She quickly jerks her hand away when she realizes what she's doing. "My name is Adorhi, by the way, Adorhi Ven." (edited)
RisenZed 21/02/2020 22:07
"We're not looking for a fight, or at least, I'm not," Zed says. "But we always want to be prepared for one."
Drake | Emperor 21/02/2020 22:08
"Agreed, unless this "trouble" is Imperial, we should be fine"

"I'm sure we'd all prefer not to fight, but the best way of that happening, is making sure the other guy knows we're ready to end him."

Stormchaser 21/02/2020 22:46
Ziza's shop can be found just off the main market place, set into a wall of white stone. It's low-ceilinged, dimly lit, and crammed full of junk - most of it deadly. The shop's tubby little keeper comes hurrying forwards as the customers arrive. "Welcome, welcome, friends! What can I be getting you? You need new gun, yes? I have gun! Fresh armour? Explosives! Yes, yes, all the things Ziza has. Come inside, take a look. For you, this one perhaps..." The Sullustan grabs the front-most clone by the arm pulling, them inside as he rambles on. (edited)
RisenZed 21/02/2020 23:01
Zed takes a deep breath and raises his voice to be heard above the Ziza's rambling. "I can't speak for all of us, but I'm just looking for some ammo," he says.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 22/02/2020 00:00
Kite gruffly says "Need a headcom set and 5 power packs, we are in a hurry Ziza"
00:06
"Also a set of binders if you have some"
Stormchaser 22/02/2020 00:51
Ziza is dashing about the cluttered shop whipping items from shelves before Kite has even finished talking. "Headcomm? That's expensive alright. I can do you a deal on the power packs though - buy five, get one free!" The Sullustan sets a basket of items down in front of the clone witha clatter. "Two hundred for the lot." (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 22/02/2020 00:53

Rick Fisto 22/02/2020 01:05

RisenZed 22/02/2020 01:16
"Hold up there, Kite," Zed says. He leans on the counter across from the Sullustan. "Ziza, you rely on repeat patrons for your business, right? Look at us. We've been in here a couple times before. We've come back. But we can take our business elsewhere if you want to give us bad deals like that. 110 credits for the lot, and we continue to come back and do business with you."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 22/02/2020 01:18
Kite gives Zed an appreciative nod he was never one for haggling and misses having a quartermaster and the resources of an army behind him
Stormchaser 22/02/2020 15:44
Ziza shifts nervously from foot to foot as Zed talks, looking anywhere but directly at the grizzled old clone. "I throw in a couple of those grenades," he counters, nodding to Testy, "and we call it 300? A sniper rifle is bigger money than you gentlemen have though. A blaster carbine is only worth so much credit."
RisenZed 22/02/2020 15:49
"Grenades," Zed says, scratching his chin. Secondhand ordinance is always a good way to lose limbs. "Let's have a look at them, first."
Stormchaser 22/02/2020 15:55
Ziza shrugs, gesturing to a precariously balanced case on one end of a shelf. "Take your pick."
RisenZed 22/02/2020 15:59
Zed carefully selects two working grenades from the basket and sets the case back on the shelf, adjusting it so that it isn't so precarious anymore. "Alright Ziza. 280 creds and you've got yourself a deal."
Rick Fisto 22/02/2020 16:04
Testy adds 80 credits to the pile. "Deal?" He says with just a touch of menace.
Stormchaser 22/02/2020 16:17
Ziza looks like he's about to complain, but thinks better of it when Testy steps in to tower over him. "280 credits!" The Sullustan hastily agrees, quickly gathering up his profits. "I hope to see you again soon!"
RisenZed 22/02/2020 16:21
As the clones file to the back of the shop to let Adorhi do her shopping, Zed turns back to Ziza, locks eyes with the sullustan, and slaps his hand on Testy's shoulder. "Oh, we'll be back. You can count on it."
toddmoonbounce 22/02/2020 16:28
Adorhi steps up to Ziza and scans around at the mess that is his shop. "Hey, Ziza, it's been a while. Can you help a gal out with a commlink? My last one fell victim to a grumpy Trandoshan."

toddmoonbounce 22/02/2020 17:05

Stormchaser 22/02/2020 17:39
"Yes, absolutely... to you, 60 credits, my azure delight." The bin of commlinks is marked 70 credits a piece.
toddmoonbounce 22/02/2020 18:06
Adorhi hands over the credits and then pats Ziza on the hand while looking him in the eye. "Thank you so much, darling. Hanging out with these boys will likely bring us back for more supplies again soon...I'm looking forward to it." She winks, takes her comm and cell, and then turns to leave.
Rick Fisto 23/02/2020 16:07
Testy hands Kite a grenade as they walk to Barin's.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 23/02/2020 16:14
Kite integrates his head set into his helmet and tells the party "we should sinc our comms, this should be a milk run but it pays to be prepared"
Stormchaser 23/02/2020 16:33
The apartment specified by Prello the Hutt is a low-lying adobe dome, the colour of terra-cotta. The front door is closed, as are most of the other doors in the area. Nothing moves, and the air feels tense. Zed and Kite are the first to notice a parked speeder idling near a street corner. The tinted glass conceals the occupants, but it is obvious after a moment's observation that the speeder has a perfect view of Olev's front door. (edited)
RisenZed 23/02/2020 16:34
Before the group reaches the door, Zed turns to the rest of the group. "Don't look now, but we've got watchers."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 23/02/2020 17:10
Kite tenses up after he notices the idling speeder he sees Zed has seen it as well and watches him tell the group. Kite turns and faces the group as well with his back to the speeder Kite then makes a series of hand signals pointing out the speeder, indicating that he plans to sneak up to the speeder and cut the lines. He points to Testy and Adorhi and to the apartment indicating that they go up after the lines cut. And then he signals to Zed and Gauss to keep their eyes on both situations and be prepared to move if there is trouble. (edited)
RisenZed 23/02/2020 17:16
Zed touches a knuckle to his temple in the military signal for acknowledged. He moves across the street and leans against a building, making a show of wiping the sweat from his brow and fanning himself, all the while keeping an eye on both the speeder and the door to the apartment.
Drake | Emperor 23/02/2020 17:51
Before Kite moves off, Gauss gives him his Tinker's kit and pats him on the back saying, "You got this brother, just don't cut the red wire, we have you covered." He then hangs back with Zed, keeping a watchful eye on the surrounding streets. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 23/02/2020 17:58
Kite takes the kit and gives Gauss a thumbs up and moves towards the speeder. He remembers his training and tries to move both quickly and silently through the street without drawing attention. He gets near the speeder and in his haste steps on a empty can the street that escaped his notice. Making a noticeable crunch as he does so. Kit quickly moves into position afterwards, admonishing himself for his clumsiness, thinking that he has blown his cover but after a few moments noticing that nothing has changed and thinks to himself that whoever is keeping watch in the speeder is thankfully sloppier than him today. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 23/02/2020 18:31

Stormchaser 23/02/2020 18:50
The speeder's repulsors whine and shudder as Kite loosens a compensator with his hydrospanner, and the vehicle sets down with a muffled thud. A shout can be heard from inside the cockpit, and then a string of words in an alien language.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 23/02/2020 19:12

He pats his carbine that is slung on his back "Fortunately for you I'm in a good mood but you better get the kriffing piece of junk fixed before someone less tolerant than myself come along"
Stormchaser 23/02/2020 19:25
The driver is a non-descript rodian male dressed in an earth-tone suit. His expression is serene, betraying no emotion whatsoever, and he is armed with a blaster pistol at his hip. (edited)
19:32

Rick Fisto 23/02/2020 20:16

Stormchaser 23/02/2020 20:20
There's a flash of sparks as the saber slices through the lock and the door swishes open. Testy sees a sparsely furnished living area in complete disarray. Furniture has been overturned in the centre of the room, and a viewscreen along the eastern wall buzzes with static. Three men occupy the room: two are dressed in the same non-descript earth-tone suits as the Rodian in the speeder. The third is on his knees, nursing a bruised jaw, as if he's just been struck.
Rick Fisto 23/02/2020 20:45
Testy takes a step into the doorway, filling it with his large frame while bringing the large blue blade of Haspin's saber up into the room. Is the blade darker than it used to be? "This here is the blade of a Jedi master. The Jedi master I murdered. It can cut through durasteel like a hot knife through butter. So you gotta ask yourselves one question. Do I feel lucky? Well do ya, punks?"
toddmoonbounce 24/02/2020 16:38
As Testy bursts into the door and announces his presence, Adorhi takes cover on the door frame, blaster at the ready. She puts her other hand on her vibrodagger, wishing she could get up close. She always preferred the element of surprise and quick submission.
Stormchaser 24/02/2020 17:04
The Rodian by the speeder leaps over the front of his vehicle and takes cover behind it, firing off another shot at Kite. His aim, however, is wide, and the blaster bolt just leaves a scorch mark on the wall behind the clone. Meanwhile, the men in Barin's apartment are clearly displeased by the interruption, and they too reach for their weapons... (edited)
toddmoonbounce 24/02/2020 17:26
"Looks like you got your gunfight afterall, buckethead!" Adorhi yells as she pulls up her blaster at the reaction of the two inside beginning to line up their own. Once again, she's reminded why she likes to be up close and personal, Kriff off Barin, you pile of dwang! Adorhi says to herself as the shot misses.
Stormchaser 24/02/2020 17:37
Adorhi could swear that her shot should have hit home, but, at the last moment, the man in the brown suit simply steps aside, as though he knew it was coming. The phrase 'be careful what you wish for' comes to mind as he raises his gun and blows the hostage's brains across the living area in a single shot. Moving quickly, both men take cover behind the toppled sofa, and the second takes a pot shot at Testy that scrapes the clone's shoulder, leaving a raw red plasma burn. Nothing deadly, but it hurts like hell. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 24/02/2020 18:35
Kite huddles on the other side of the speeder and pops up and tries to take a quick shot with his carbine at the Rodian. As he pops up the Rodian's shot goes past him, throwing Kite's aim off. He makes a quick snap shot at the Rodian that goes wide. Kite curses his aim but does mark the Rodian with his helmets heads up display (rangers quarry)
Rick Fisto 24/02/2020 18:35
Testy hopes his threatening gambit will work, but immediately knows it won't once he sees the cold, resolute look in the men's eyes. Gritting his teeth and ready for a fight, he hopes Adorhi gets behind them quick and thinks to himself I can't believe I trusted that Togruta enough to turn my back on her. She's not Haspin, she... "Blam!", his heart skips another beat when a blaster bolt flies past his arm from behind, shattering his calm and turning conscious thought off. He doesn't even notice it when the blaster bolt from the humans burns across his shoulder. (edited)
RisenZed 24/02/2020 18:51
As the firefight on the street starts, Zed raises his rifle to his shoulder. Been a while, but you've got this, old man. He flips the weapon to the stun setting and prepares to fire, but the staccato ring of blaster fire coming from the apartment catches his attention. He looks to Gauss, makes a single hand gesture in the direction of the apartment, then returns his focus to the rodian. He pulls the trigger and lets loose a single bolt of energy that hits the rodian center-mass. The rodian staggers and Zed closes the distance to the assailant.
Drake | Emperor 24/02/2020 18:52

Rick Fisto 24/02/2020 19:00
"Sssssssssssss," Testy's comm replies.
Drake | Emperor 24/02/2020 19:02

Drake | Emperor 24/02/2020 19:11
As Gauss rounds the corner, he sees Testy standing in the door, ready to fight someone and calls out to him "I got your back brother! Try not to kill them, we need any information they might have." (edited)
Rick Fisto 24/02/2020 19:27
Testy leaps into the apartment and onto the overturned couch. As the man below him raises his left arm in a protective gesture, Haspin's saber slashes down, severing it at the elbow, and the man falls to the ground, unconscious. The bloodless, cauterizing strike will later strike Testy as surprisingly similar to how sterile fighting droids was.
toddmoonbounce 24/02/2020 20:18

She races forward to the other and takes two quick strikes with her vibrodaggers incapacitating him. "That's more like it!" she says, sheathing her favorite weapons.
Stormchaser 24/02/2020 20:52
The Rodian thrusts out a hand towards Zed, who feels a disembodied force try to lift him front his feet. However, the clone is able to cling to the edge of the speeder, resisting the effect, much to the shock of the alien in front of him, who turns to make a break for it and run.
RisenZed 24/02/2020 21:03
Seizing the opening the rodian gave him, Zed lunges out with his left arm and cocks his fist down, allowing a small blade to slide out of his vambrace. The blade makes contact at the back of the rodian's thigh, cutting the fleeing attacker's escape short. Zed retracts the blade and aims his rifle at the prone rodian. "Toss your weapons to the side and stay on the ground," he shouts.
Rick Fisto 24/02/2020 21:05

Stormchaser 24/02/2020 21:21
Olev's living area contains only simple furniture, spread across the floor where it has been tossed. The scattered remains make the living area somewhat treacherous in the dim light. Both bedrooms are nearly identical - each contains a bed and a simple desk built into the wall. The beds have been overturned, and the drawers of the desks have been upended onto the floor. The only room that seems unharmed is a small kitchenette, which is relatively clear of obstacles. Shelves and cupboards line the adobe walls, and an unused stove occupies the northern wall.
toddmoonbounce 24/02/2020 21:22

RisenZed 24/02/2020 22:28

Then with great care, he opens the human's mouth to search for some sort of poison pill, undoubtedly what killed the rodian. He finds what he was looking for almost immediately: a fake tooth -- activated with a hard bite -- filled with poison. With a careful yank, he pulls it from the human's mouth. (edited)

Pain might, but I'm not willing to do that. I don't know if any of my brothers would be. Testy might, but I don't want to ask him to do that. He's struggling as it is. Maybe the Togruta? He walks over to Adorhi and quietly says, "Do you have any experience getting people like this to talk?"

RisenZed 25/02/2020 21:44

Stormchaser 25/02/2020 21:59
The exterior of 'Kie's Storage' is nondescript, featuring a sloping roof and windowless permacrete walls covered in weatherworn adobe. A number of vagrants use the building's high walls for shade, especially during the hottest times of the day.

Drake | Emperor 27/02/2020 16:24

Gauss exclaims before hurling a Kolto Pack at Kite, he then immediately powers up his Carbine and fires a flaming bolt at the assailant. The shot lights up the dim hallway for a split second before hitting its mark, instantly engulfing the man in fire. "I got to him just in time" Gauss thinks to himself, "I got Kite! I also lit his attacker up like a Life-day tree!" He shouts loud enough that everyone can hear him in the cramped building. RisenZed 27/02/2020 17:59
Zed glances around the corner and sees the Sable operative, ablaze with fire, and Gauss' carbine, slightly smoking with the energy expended by the charged shot. "Nice work, brother!" Better go make sure she's okay, Zed thinks as he takes off running down the other hallway. Not that she needs our help. She's a perfectly capable fighter. Shame we're not on the same page about tactics. Hopefully we don't get her killed. Rounding the corner at the end of the hallway, Zed spies another operative. Rick Fisto 27/02/2020 20:33
Running side by side with his brother like the old days, Testy feels in fine form and confident. He pulls one of his vibrospears from it's holster on his back, the weapon automatically humming to life. As he rounds the corner, he sees another Sable Dawn member mostly turned away from him. At the extreme end of his range, Testy grits his teeth as he heaves with all of his might, letting loose the silver missile at his distant foe. The spear, audibly buzzing almost as if in anticipation of the hit that it is about to score, alerts the man, who turns, taking the blade across his shoulder and releasing a thin spray of blood as the spear cuts through cloth and flesh and leaves a long gash--a near twin to Testy's blaster burn across his own shoulder. (edited)

toddmoonbounce 27/02/2020 22:19

RisenZed 27/02/2020 22:39
Watching Testy hurl a durasteel spear down the corridor and listening to Kite's words on the comm, Zed thinks to himself, Can't let Sable get away with our new "partner." Gathering his strength, he sprints, full-tilt toward the corridor that Kite indicated. Rounding the corner at full speed, he spies the operative and the togruta at the end of the hall. Without stopping, he raises his rifle. His hand shakes. Sweat drips. His eyes blur, and his aim drops off target. He stops, shakes his head, and aims down the sights of his old DC-17m. *Inhale. Count to four. Exhale. Count to four. Squeeze the trigger. The rifle kicks. The Sable operative drops, a plasma burn smoking in the back of his head. His body hits the door, opening it and spilling out into the alley. "He's down," Zed says into the comms, taking a moment to steady his breath and regain his focus. "Adorhi, are you okay?" (edited)
Drake | Emperor 27/02/2020 22:51

Rick Fisto 28/02/2020 22:36

He also assures the owner that they will even take care of the bodies for the owner, and mentions that there was very little blood. "My friends and I are former soldiers...we do clean work." Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 28/02/2020 23:59

Stormchaser 29/02/2020 11:39
Kie, the proprietor of Kie's storage, is surprised, to say the least, when he receives Testy's comm. It seems that most residents of Mos Eisley know better than to cross him. A squeaky-sounding alien voice thanks the clones for protecting his business and requests that they wait for him to arrive with guards of his own, in order to ensure the security of the site. He assures Testy that the squad will be appropriately compensated for their time and trouble.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 29/02/2020 14:35

Rick Fisto 29/02/2020 23:26

Stormchaser 01/03/2020 13:36
About ten minutes later, Kie shows up with a pair Gamorrean bodyguards, each of which is wearing body armour and carrying a blaster rifle. Kie himself, it turns out, is a fuzzy little Chadra-fan businessman dressed in a sharp blue suit, and he takes in the state of his place of business with a keen eye. "Nothing a coat of paint won't hide..." the alien muses, mostly to himself, as peers up the corridor at the scorch marks on the floor. "Which of you gentlemen did I speak with earlier?" Kie shuffles over to a nearby container, which quickly opens when he slots in his code cylinder. Inside a bank of computer screens displays the feed for several hidden cameras, and he begins to spool back to check the sequence of events. (edited)
Rick Fisto 01/03/2020 16:19
Testy leans up against the wall near Kie. "That was me sir. Hopefully you'll find everything is in order. That couple that came in before us opened up a couple of lockers after the fight...I don't think they were their lockers, but I made sure they didn't take anything. Anyway they left after I called you. Some gratitude. Those suits almost killed the guy. Luckily one of us has some medical training from the war."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 01/03/2020 16:22
Kite gets in position that he believes to be out of sight and watches the exchange with the chadra fan and Testy. He thinks why does every two bit "boss" on Tatooine use Gamorreans, they are big, dumb and slow. Good for shaking people down but not the best in a fire fight. Should hopefully make life easier if this goes south.
Stormchaser 01/03/2020 16:43
Kie sits in silence as he watches the events unfold on screen. Once he's finally satisfied with what he's seen, the little Chadra-fan turns to address Testy. "You're right. Nothing was taken without a key - although your friends are nosy. I'd like to meet them, if you don't mind. I expect they're still nearby. You do have my thanks for saving young Liam though. He's a good kid, and his mother would never forgive me if anything happened to him. What brought you here today, soldier? It seems unlikely that this was all a coincidence."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 01/03/2020 16:47
Kite takes a deep breath and readies himself to attack in case anything happens
RisenZed 01/03/2020 16:51
"We were simply passing through, sir, when we happened to see those individuals run into your facility armed," Zed says, raising his shoulders in a shrug. "Like my friend said, we're former soldiers. We do get bored from time to time, and saw an opportunity to sate our fighting instincts and possibly do some good while we're at it." Zed looks at some of the blaster burns in the walls. "We are sorry about the damage though," he says. "We did our best to keep it clean."
Stormchaser 01/03/2020 17:02
Kie shrugs. "I suppose it doesn't really matter either way. My business is safe, and for that you have my thanks. I'd like to give each of the three of you a gift. A lot of things get left in a place like this, and when the lease runs out they go to my cube for confiscated property." The squeaky little man closes up the container full of screens and walks over to another. His code cylinder slides into the lock with a metallic click, and the doors slide open with a hiss as the seal releases. Kie's bodyguards watch the clones warily the entire time, their chubby hands steady on their rifles. The interior of the container is a treasure trove of abandoned goods of all kinds, including a wide variety of weapons and armour. "Are you looking for anything specific?" Kie asks. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 01/03/2020 17:13
Kite sees a sniper rifle in the vault and gives a sad sigh but holds position
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 01/03/2020 18:44
Kite sees Testy going for the sniper rifle and cracks a big smile behind his mandalorian helm
RisenZed 01/03/2020 19:00
Zed looks about the locker. His eyes go first to the weapons, but in Zed's heart, nothing could ever replace the DC-17m IWS. I wish I could find a anti-armor attachment for it. Maybe someday, he thinks to himself. He spies a set of armor plates hanging at the back of the locker. Configuration isn't quite right, but they look like they could replace some of the missing plates and components from his Katarn armor. At Kie's nod, he takes the armor off the wall.
Rick Fisto 01/03/2020 19:23
Testy finds that he has loosened up a bit over the last day, even though by all rights he should be a mess. The action he and his brothers have been in today have been the only serious fights they have seen in the last few years. He knows he hasn't worked through all of his issues yet, but the trust in his brothers has really been restored at an instinctive level. Even though they--he--betrayed one who was like a brother to them, they hadn't betrayed their actual brothers. And he was beginning to feel deep in his bones that they never would. They had his back. Kite, in particular, always has his back; even now he was watching it from far away. Well, he could watch our six a bit better with a better rifle. Testy grabs the sniper rifle from the storage unit for his brother and says "Thank you sir. That's mighty generous of you." (edited)
Drake | Emperor 01/03/2020 19:57

He admired thier sheer firepower back when his squad was sent to Kashyyyk on a mission. Gauss thinks to himself as he grabs the Bowcaster. The suns outside have reached their zenith and those inside the speeders find themselves incredible grateful for the vehicles' air conditioning. Stormchaser 02/03/2020 19:28

Rick Fisto 02/03/2020 19:33

Stormchaser 02/03/2020 21:00
"Only Mistress Prello, I'm afraid," C-4RL replies to Testy in the classic chirpy tone that is characteristic of C-series protocol droids, as he leads them through the residence. When the group arrives at Prello's study, the Hutt is waiting for them as expected, but she's clearly pensive and quieter than normal. "Welcome back," she says, nodding to each of them in greeting. "What have you discovered of Barin?"
toddmoonbounce 02/03/2020 21:57
As the group enters Prello's townhouse, Adorhi immediately notices the lack of her Hutt friend greeting them at the door. That's not like her at all, the Togruta thinks to herself. Pride and ego force there way past her compassion however as she then thinks back to asking Prello to let her do this job alone. "Carl, darling, no Alderaanian Red for this gal?" Adorhi says to the droid, disappointedly, as they proceed to Prello's study. She takes her usual place on the chaise lounge but offers no initial reply to Prello's first query.
RisenZed 02/03/2020 22:01
"We followed your lead and checked out the brother's apartment," Zed says. "When we got there, there was a person posted outside the apartment, as well as two people inside it. They said they were part of an organization: Sable Dawn." As he mentions the name, Zed searches Prello's face for any hint of recognition.
RisenZed 02/03/2020 22:11
Seeing recognition and surprise in the hutt's face, Zed continues, "They executed Olev on the spot when they saw us, before Testy and Adorhi could get to him. These people were devoted to whatever cause they serve. One of them killed himself with poison right in front of me. We were able to take a prisoner, but he ended up being less than helpful." Zed shifts his weight, casually looking around the room for trouble. "Testy found a code cylinder that unlocked a storage locker at a facility owned by a chadra-fan named Kie. Sable Dawn ambushed us there too, but we were able to play it off as us stopping a robbery. In the storage locker, there was a datapad with coordinates and one word: Nadir. Does that sound familiar to you?" (edited)
Stormchaser 02/03/2020 22:33
Prello appears visibly distressed when she hears of Olev's fate, and sighs sadly. "If only you could have saved poor Olev... Barin will be most upset to hear of his cousin's death. 'Point Nadir' is a shadowport built within a rogue comet known as 'Resh 9376'. It's nominally under the control of my kajidic, the Anjiliac Hutts. However, other powers also vie for control of Point Nadir - including the Sable Dawn. If Barin has tracked the Fell Star there, then I fear for his safety all the more." Prello slithers down closer to the group, keeping her voice hushed as she talks. "The location of Point Nadir is a closely guarded secret. My kajidic is very careful about who receives this information. Clearly Barin was able to acquire the coordinates. I can provide you with a transponder code that will grant you free access to dock, but you must tell no one. It's not just my life on the line. Remember that." (edited)
RisenZed 02/03/2020 22:38
Zed's mind races. A secret star port? Clandestine operations? It's like we're special forces all over again. He clears his throat and half-turns to his brothers and Adorhi. "Let's finish the job, yeah?"

It hasn't turned out well for others. But this past day has pushed her over the edge. Stormchaser 02/03/2020 23:52

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 03/03/2020 00:12
Kite winces behind his helm he chose his words poorly, he didn't mean to offend his brother. Kite was thinking of the war itself, when he and his brothers fought against insurmountable odds and survived, not the way the war ended. Order 66 almost tore the brothers apart. The others considered Haspin family, Kite respected him but that was it. He had seen the way other jedi treated the clones, viewing them as little better than droids. Concerned more with their precious ideals than making the sound tactical decision, costing not only their own lives but the lives of his fellow clones. Anyone who was part of an order of beings like that isn't family to Kite. When the order came Kite didn't hesitate, and used maximum force to insure that his brothers were safe. Jedi have to many tricks not too. Kite would let Testy cool down and then try to apologize. Kite thinks they did the right thing but he would rather have his brothers than be right. (edited)
RisenZed 03/03/2020 16:20
Zed heads out with some of the others to sell some of the gear that the group had collected from the day's skirmishes with the Sable Dawn. That was the most action we've seen in a long time, he thinks as he heads back to the clone's hovel. We're rusty, but we still handled ourselves pretty efficiently. After doffing his broken Katarn armor, he begins to replace components of it with the armor that he had gotten from Kie's place. Replace a few plates here, reconnect some broken wires here. Lastly, he grabs his dusty, old helmet and integrates a new headcomm with its old electronics. He dons the armor. It feels almost the same as the old armor did. He slides the helmet over his bald head. The HUD flickers to life, linking with the DC-17m's ammo count. His breath rasps inside the helmet as he looks through the eyes of a commando again. He checks the armor's connections one more time, then heads back to Prello's place.
Rick Fisto 03/03/2020 17:17
After trading in his vibro spears and hand-held comm unit for a chakram and a headcomm with the guys, not to mention a trauma kit and medpack, Testy rests for a few minutes at their hovel with his Alderanian kitteh curled up on his lap. The soft, furry little thing loved being scratched right between it's middle and back legs. "I'm gonna miss you, little one. Hopefully we won't be gone long." After a few more minutes, Testy gets up, cradling the thing in it's arms, and walks next door. Tapping with his toe on the door across the lane, he waits for their grumpy, zabrak neighbor Veets to come to the door. After a minute, Veets opens up, looking like he is about to chew up and spit out whichever canvaser was there to ask stupid questions of him, disturbing his work...whatever that was. But his eyes soften as he takes in the kitteh in Testy's arms. "Hey. I'm gonna be out of town for a little while. Not sure how long. Would you take care of the little guy for me?" The zabrak's heavily tatooed face breaks into a grin as he takes the kitteh from Testy's arms, assuring him that he will take care of the beast. OK. Time to get moving. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 04/03/2020 13:52
Kite trades in his carbine and purchases a new fiber armor breast plate. He then goes back to their home on the planet. Taking a few hours he replaces his old breast plate with the new one and then works to make sure his Mandalorian armor is in optimal working order. He also integrates his wristpad and few tech enhancements that he had been working on into both his rifle and armor. Installing a Target Lock & Assess the Situation program into his helmet's HUD, he upgrades his rifle with the Combustive Shot protocol, Kite always liked a bit of fire. He also copies Gauss's Kolto Pack design, it saved his life and if it comes to it he wants to be able to do the same for his brothers. After he gets the armor back in working order, he runs to a general store purchases some blue milk and leaves the milk, with a note outside Testy's door. the note says "For the Furball, Kite". He then goes out to a shooting range and practices with his new rifle and recites the Resol'nare the 6 actions that made a being a Mandalorian. One of the Mandalorian commandos who trained the clones taught him this, it wasn't something he really considered until he left the GAR. It gave him comfort and direction in a time where he felt lost. He then gets his gear and gets ready to move out. (edited)
Drake | Emperor 04/03/2020 18:45
Gauss sold much of what he had on him, either because it was unneeded or worn down to much. He traded in his Combat Suit for a "new" suit of Fiber Armor, keeping what plates of his battered and worn down Katarn armor, that he could. He also sold his old carbine, which was a shadow of it's former self as a DC-17m IWS, even if he could find the attachments, they probably wouldn't work anymore, he bought a Power Belt to attach to the wookie bowcaster he got from Kie's. "This should help with reloading this monster" he said to himself as he attached it to the weapon, loading eight of the power cells he was carrying into it. He also bought some extra medical supplies, "You never know when we will need them he thought we sure did with those last two encounters with Sable Dawn" He also bought a few extra pouches and a bandolier to hold all the gear he bought and could need. Before heading out he neatly packed the Mechanic's Kit and a new set of Armstech's tools in a locker in his room, they are far to heavy for him to lug around all day. He also made sure the power bank for his mouse droid, S1-lv35, was filled. He found it one day bumping against a wall repeatedly, its navigation protocol having malfunctioned. He couldn't find a designation for it, however it was painted with an almost chromium finish, so he nicknamed it "Silver" He spent some time attempting to fix it, he never was one for droids, seeing as he fought them night and day during the war. But the challenge intrigued him, keeping him busy on restless nights. It still doesn't function 100%, but it at least can move around the apartment room and clean dust and sand away. "Don't go wandering off into the hallways while I'm gone Silver, who know what Veets will do to you if he finds you beeping along." (edited)
Stormchaser 04/03/2020 18:46
The next day, Prello calls the team back to her study to meet a dashingly handsome human named Captain Rider. The Captain is wearing a white shirt and a blue leather waistcoat, and stands with his hips aslant and a cocky grin sprawled across his face. "Captain Rider owns the Katarn's Bane," she explains, batting her eyelashes at him. "He will fly you to Point Nadir, as a special favour to me, of course." "Howdy, folks, call me Flynn," the man declares as he steps forwards to introduce himself. Flapping some loose hair back from his forehead, Rider holds out a hand to shake for whoever takes it.

toddmoonbounce 04/03/2020 19:34

Stormchaser 04/03/2020 19:37
Prello sighs, and, although they are in the privacy of her own home, she glances about, as though fearful of who may be listening. "The balance of power on Point Nadir is a delicate thing. The Anjiliac kajidic are the de facto rulers, but both the Sable Dawn and a syndicate known as 'Epsis' exert their own degree of control over the shadowport. The Sable Dawn are the smallest of the three factions, but perhaps also the most dangerous. They are assassins, bounty hunters and terrorists for hire. Barin was searching for the Fell Star. Perhaps the Sable Dawn were competing to find it first, or perhaps it is already in their hands, and Barin tried to steal it from them? Both seem equally possible at this point." (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 04/03/2020 19:39
Kite nods and says "Thank you Prello we will retrieve both the item and if possible Barin."
RisenZed 04/03/2020 19:44
"What's security like at this place?" Zed asks, sinking back into memories of mission briefs with Haspin and other commanders. "Are we going to be able to walk around freely, or should we keep to the shadows?"
Stormchaser 04/03/2020 19:51
"The population come and go as they please," Prello replies. "The real secret is the coordinates that you have acquired. Finding Point Nadir without the support of one of the factions is usually very difficult indeed. Just be careful not to broadcast your intentions. The local leader of my kajidic is Zietta the Hutt. She deals in slaves, spice and games of chance, and is ostensibly allied with Epsis and the Sable Dawn. Publicly, they enforce the local laws, collect tariffs and keep the economy running smoothly, but behind the scenes all three compete for business and influence."
RisenZed 04/03/2020 19:58
"Should we talk to Zietta about Barin?" Zed asks. "If she's the local leader of your clan, she might be the best contact point for that."
Stormchaser 04/03/2020 20:22
Prello hesitates. "I would prefer not to involve my cousin in this, if at all possible," she notes with a shark-line smile.
RisenZed 04/03/2020 20:22
Zed nods. "Copy that."
toddmoonbounce 04/03/2020 20:23

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 04/03/2020 20:27

Stormchaser 04/03/2020 21:00
Prello chuckles, as though enjoying a joke unknown to all others in the room. "Epsis is the love child of the Ubese technocrat Liash Keane. Keane's power stems from his control over Point Nadir's connection to the holonet. Without Epsis the entire port would be left crippled. If it runs on a computer, it goes through Epsis."
Rick Fisto 04/03/2020 21:47
Testy watched Rider during this exchange, trying to take the measure of this man. He seemed confident in himself and his abilities. Hopefully it's justified. "OK, Rider, let's move out. If we think of any other questions, we'll holo you on the way out, Prello."
Stormchaser 04/03/2020 21:58
Rider bids Prello farewell and leads the group to docking bay 77 of Mos Eisley spaceport, where the Katarn's Bane, a Maka-Eekai L4000 transport, awaits them. "She's a squat little lady, but she's roomy inside!" Flynn tells them as the boarding ramps lowers. "Cabins are on deck 2. Make yourselves at home."
RisenZed 04/03/2020 23:06
Zed nods to the captain and ascends the ramp. The ship's interior was spacious and somewhat orderly, but not up to Republic Navy military specs. I miss how clean those navy ships were, he thinks. Finding a cabin, Zed sinks down on the cot and falls into the routine of inspecting his kit. Rifle. Sidearm. Blade. Extra cells. Comms. Bandolier. All good.
Drake | Emperor 05/03/2020 01:04
Before boarding, Gauss inspected the outer hull of old L4000 transport, checking it over as much as he could from a distance. He was always into researching and tinkering with starships during his time with the Republic, although he didn't get to fly them much because of his role. Nowadays he tries to keep up with the newest ships on the market when he can, their specifications and intended uses, even their weaknesses, in case he has to deal with one or fly it himself. The guns look good, although the dorsal and ventral sides are left fairly exposed, but she should do well against some of the newer Mandal and or TransGalMeg fighters that pirates, and hutts, are fond of these days. The hull looks like it could take a beating as well, although it seems it already has. "She sure is one hefty ship, Gallofree knows how to make them bulky." Gauss exclaims as he enters the ship. "As soon as we are in hyperspace, care to give me a tour Captain??" He asks Captain Rider as they begin to board. "I myself am very interested in any manner of starship, especially one that has withstood the test of time, and she seems like a fine vessel."
Rick Fisto 05/03/2020 01:56
As Testy heads up the ramp with Kite, he quietly says "Hey, I'm sorry for snapping at you before. I was out of line, brother."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 05/03/2020 02:28
Kite pauses removes his helm and looks at Testy and says " No worries brother I should be the one apologizing. I chose my words poorly earlier. What I meant was the last few days while difficult have been like the good old days of the war. Back when we all knew who our enemy was and pulled together to win. We don't agree on what down, or the Jedi, but my biggest regret is not how the war ended, but how it affected our squad. The squad is my family and I've got your back Test" He then gives Testy a light punch on the shoulder puts his helm back on and gets on the ship.
toddmoonbounce 05/03/2020 17:16
Adorhi gives a silent nod to Rider, implying as little of a thank you as possible, and heads up the boarding ramp. She makes her way to the ships lounge and settles into a corner seat pulling out a deck of cards and begins shuffling them.
Rick Fisto 05/03/2020 19:01
Testy finds his bunk, stows his gear, and settles in as the engines hum to life. Haspin sits cross-legged on a short, cylindrical, cushion-topped chair aboard their specially-modified long-range LAAT incursion ship, the Anvil. He's been sitting motionless for over seven hours now, and Test is not sure what the point of this is. "Why do you do that, Haspin?" he asks. Without opening his eyes or moving a muscle outside of his face, Haspin responds. "I commune with the Force, Test. I feel it. What it wants of me. What it wants to give me. It calms me and focuses me. It give me confidence and peace with our missions. Why do you not do it?" Test responds immediately. "I don't know how." Haspin smiles. "Would you like to learn?" Feeling a bit embarrassed, Test quickly demurs and leaves Haspin to his Jedi practices. Looking down at the saber hanging from his belt, Testy wishes he had taken Haspin up on his offer. Well, how hard can it be? He thought he could teach me. From everything I've ever heard, it seems simple enough in principle. Testy sits up fully on his bunk, crossing his legs and straightening his back. OK Force, what do you want of me? (edited)
Stormchaser 05/03/2020 21:07
"Sure thing, Gauss!" Rider remarks as they stroll on up the boarding ramp. "She may look bulky, but she's real roomy on the inside..."
Stormchaser 06/03/2020 19:54
Once all the clones have settled in a cabin or one of the lounges, Rider heads for the cockpit. Not long later his voice can be heard on the ship's tinny intercom. (edited)
19:55
"Alright boys and girls, this is your Captain speaking. We'll be lifting off shortly, so please stow any loose belongings and secure yourselves until we make the jump to lightspeed." (edited)
20:01
There's a dull rumbling, and the ship begins to vibrate slightly as the old freighter's sub-light engines kick into gear. There's a slight groan of creaking durasteel as the Katarn's Bane gradually heaves off the ground, and then a rush of inertia as the engines kick into a hard burn, pushing to clear the atmosphere.
20:02
A few minutes later, the vessel is clear and everything stills as the artificial gravity kicks in.
20:06
For another few minutes everything is quiet as Rider brings the ship out to a safe distance from Tatooine's orbit, and then there's familiar rushing sensation as the hyperdrive powers up and the vessel is thrust into the swirling blue of hyperspace. (edited)
hugehuman 06/03/2020 21:16
A rustling sound is heard from the direction of the cockpit, then the swish of the passenger's lounge door opening as, not the handsome Captain Rider, but a short and stocky blue skinned Ortolan comes strolling in, muttering in a Nar Shaddaa accent. "Kriffin' hell... wake me up from my usual midday nap, tell me we've got a charter for the Hutt, and get me calculating a hyperspace jump before I've had my snacks n' caf! Whatta guy, that Rider." He limply throws down an empty orb shaped soda container, nearly hitting Adorhi. (edited)
hugehuman 06/03/2020 21:26
Realizing it didn't land in the waste disposal like he expected, he double takes, and looks to the room's occupants. "Oh, hey. You guys the Hutt's passengers? Name's Shorlu. Rider's the face, I'm the brains a' the ship." (edited)
toddmoonbounce 06/03/2020 21:34
Adorhi, a thin, blue Togruta, with darker blue markings on her montrals and head tails, reflexively retracts into her seat as the beverage container completely misses it's intended target. She looks up at the stout, blue creature now joining her in the lounge. "Looks like the stomach of the ship as well," she says half under her breath, with a side-eyed up and down look of judgement and annoyance. "So, what's our travel time, Blue?" (edited)
Stormchaser 06/03/2020 21:52
Once he's satisfied with their course, Rider also emerges from the cockpit. He glances about the crate littered cargo bay, realising that his passengers must have all found their cabins, and shrugs.
hugehuman 06/03/2020 21:55
Blinking, then squinting and sucking in his gut a little as he walked up to the table and had a seat. "Well, Rider wouldn't say the destination, just had me number crunchin'. Plenty long enough for a game or two, for sure." He reaches into a pouch at his side, and pulls out a metal cylinder. He flicks open the top and plucks out a little pod of meat wrapped in fiber with his trunk. He continues to munch on these, sucking them right through his suction cupped fingers, as he speaks. (edited)

She deflects and tries not to stare too long at the Ortolans hands and those weird fingers. I'd really prefer to keep...whatever those are off of my deck, she thinks to her self.

hugehuman 06/03/2020 22:52
"Oh, mostly larceny, jilted lovers spying on their significant others, that kinda stuff." Shorlu chuckles, pausing his snacking to stroke his trunk, reminiscing. He has some more interesting stories, but likes to keep some under his trunk. "Shorlu Podobo, co-pilot at your service." He blinks, realizing this man and Kite have almost the exact same voice and face. "Oh, you guys are clones, aren't ya? Haven't seen any in a while, after the whole uh, reformation thing." (edited)
RisenZed 06/03/2020 22:53

Lost a lot of credits to the others in the squad in my time. But sure, maybe sometime." His stomach rumbles lightly. "As for now, I'm going to find a meal on this bucket of bolts. I bet the ortolan knows where to find some grub."
Rick Fisto 06/03/2020 23:12
Testy breathes in and out slowly, as he remembers Haspin doing, his eyes closed. He concentrates on the patterns of swirling colors and popping lights swimming across his vision. Is that the force? he thinks to himself. No. That's stupid. He tries to shift focus, paying attention to the sounds of the ship: the breezy humming of the atmo conditioners; the quiet rhythmic pumping of the fuel pumps; the light swirling sound the hull makes as the ship swims through hyperspace. All familiar sounds to him, but not ones he had ever cataloged before. His concentration breaks as a door opens down the hall, and voices pour out, covering the background sounds that he had been holding onto. Switching focus again, he breathes in more deeply, trying to catch the scents of the ship. The ship still smelled distantly of the dry dessert air of Tatooine with the distant musk of beasts of burden, but the atmo conditioners were already stripping these comforting scents out to leave the familiar stale air of any other starship. And then his concentration is shattered once more as a subtle, fruity scent, like a moist, crisp melon, cracked open on a hot summer day creeps into his cabin. Adorhi, he thinks, as he tilts his head, cracking the joints in his neck. That girl is like a gujuaro bush. All blue and violet flowers until you get close and notice all the thin, sharp needles protecting the blossoms. He opens his eyes, catching a glimpse of her disappearing inside her own bunk. Still easy on the eyes though, he thinks, as he closes his eyes once again. Haspin made this look so kriffin' easy. (edited)
1

Kite then looks down and goes back to tinkering with his rifle

Rick Fisto 09/03/2020 18:18
Over the next few days on ship, Testy continues to try to learn meditation, even borrowing Gauss's datapad to watch some instructional holos on meditation practices. He also spends time practicing with Haspin's saber in the lower level cargo hold, out of the way of everyone else. (edited)
Drake | Emperor 09/03/2020 18:32
Gauss spends the time traveling, poking around the Katarn's Bane, learning everything he can about the ship, sometimes asking Rider questions about it. (edited)
hugehuman 09/03/2020 18:35
Shorlu folded his arms behind his head and reclined a little as Kite and Rider's pointed comments rolled off of him. "Yeah, yeah... Anyway, since Her Highness took her cards with her..." He flicked on the dejarik board and occupied his time over the next few days with it, and occasional trips to the galley for some food.
Stormchaser 09/03/2020 21:35
Four days later, there's a familiar sliding sensation as the Katarn's Bane emerges from hyperspace with a jolt. Anyone who looks out a window is greeted by a vast expanse of space. A dim corona of vapour gives a distant comet an eery illumination against the dark backdrop.
21:39
Rider has clearly done this before, and immediately adopts a specific flight towards the comet, forwarding the specifics to Shorlu's station.
21:40
"Sorry for the secrecy, Big Blue. The Hutts are very specific about this place being need-to-know." (edited)
hugehuman 09/03/2020 21:43
Back in his copilot's chair, Shorlu glances at Rider skeptically. "Uh huh. But y'know, that just makes me feel like I got a need to know." His old investigative habits were kicking in, and the tiny hairs on his arm started to stand on end. He smelled a mystery here, and a damn good one at that.
Stormchaser 09/03/2020 22:00
Rider chuckles. "Point Nadir's an interesting place. If you want to explore why don't you tag along with our passengers? Keep them out of trouble?" He flashes Shorlu a wink. "I have some personal business to take care of while we're here anyway." (edited)
hugehuman 09/03/2020 22:07
Shorlu's eyes shine with an unspoken gratitude that Rider could surely pick up. "Ahh, why the hell not, right? Someone's gotta keep an eye on those kids!" Prello seemed to like him anyway, so he could always explain things away later.
Stormchaser 09/03/2020 22:18
A few minutes later a beacon on the outer surface of the comet activates. It's a simple arrangement of lights and transmitters, directing the ship into a large, cavernous opening in the comet's anterior. "There's our welcome," Rider observes. "Got a transponder code from Prello, or we'd have some less than pleasant company right about now. They call this one the 'Jackrab Hole'. You'll see why."
22:24
The comet looms up ahead as Rider brings the Katarn's Bane in close. The hole in the surface appears to be about 500 meters in diameter, and the ship slowly drifts inside under the captain's careful hand. Moment's later they pass through an atmospheric shield that holds back the harsh vacuum of open space. (edited)
22:27
The tunnel is littered with old wrecks, debris and scrap, each piece telling the story of another freighter pilot that didn't pay close enough attention to his instruments. The passage winds ever so slightly, cork-screwing gently towards the comet's heart, until finally it opens up into a massive cavern.
22:28
The cavern seems to encompass the entirety of the comet's interior, and leads, umbilical cables and thick durasteel chains float lazily in the null gravity, some attached to vessels, others unoccupied.
22:33
Small ferries and skiffs flit amongst the docked vessels like insects, carting crews, maintenance technicians, cargo and curiosity seekers from the relative safety of the docks to the more hazardous anchorages nearest the Jackrab Hole. (edited)
Stormchaser 10/03/2020 00:34
"Those're the Slips," Rider explains, gesturing to a series of well-accommodated docks on the far side of the cove. "They'll look after you real good, but it'll cost you an arm and a leg. Epsis controls them. Out here in the Tethers is cheapest, and it's Anjiliac territory, but you'll have to get a skiff to the docks."
Stormchaser 10/03/2020 10:27
A variety of ships can be seen docked in the cove as Rider brings the ship in. Only smaller starfighters and shuttles are docked close to the Jackrab Hole. Otherwise, numerous freighters are moored in the Tethers, and even a frigate or two floats in the thin atmosphere of the central cove. Ships, sloops, ferries and skiffs fly about in every direction, none oriented towards any particular horizon.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 10/03/2020 12:58
Kite holds the seat railings with a death grip white knuckling it , until Rider gets to the docking areas. He has never liked space travel, having to implicitly trust another's skills was something he never grew accustomed too. Even back in the GAR when it was his fellow clones doing the flying, he preferred to be on the ground or preferably a high perch where he could be in control. He exhales as they come to a stop and loosens his death grip and says "The Tethers should work well, unless we want to separate ourselves from even the appearance of being affiliated with Anjiliac" (edited)
Stormchaser 10/03/2020 18:34
Rider guides the Bane in under an out-of-the-way set of moorings and brings the ship to a full stop. "Someone want to come outside with me and hitch her up?"

Stormchaser 10/03/2020 18:50

19:28

19:31

Stormchaser 10/03/2020 20:32
After a brief conversation with the operator on the other end, Shorlu is informed that a skiff will be at the Bane shortly to collect their docking fee and ferry them to the slips. (edited)
Stormchaser 11/03/2020 16:02
Up atop the hull, Zed sees a one of the open-topped repulsor-borne craft heading in the direction of the Katarn's Bane. Looks like their ride is in-bound.
RisenZed 11/03/2020 16:04
Activating his commlink with a chin-toggle in his helmet, he says, "Our ride is almost here. Everyone get topside as soon as possible." Then he hesitates. Something about the situation made him revert a few years back into command mode. Reactivating the comms, he says, "You know, when you're ready. If you want. We should probably go, but take your time." (edited)
hugehuman 11/03/2020 16:17
Disconnecting the comms after sorting out the skiff, Shorlu went to his cabin and gathered his gear. He straps on his backpack, slips on a pair of fingerless gloves and specialized open-toed shoes that wouldn't obstruct his suction pads, grabs his Westar 35C, and finally throws on his old but well-kept overcoat, emblazoned with the IntSec Detective Agency's insignia, an eye bisected by arrows. (edited)
16:18
He now looks a far cry from his casual shipbound appearance, and ready for a foray into the space station.
Rick Fisto 11/03/2020 16:19
Feeling his breath course through is lungs in slow, deep surges; the weight of his body pressing on his bunk; and the slight air currents tickling the hairs on the backs of his bare arms, Testy is gently pulled out of his meditation by Zed's voice over his headcomm. Why is he so reluctant to lead now? It worked in the war, and got us through the toughest situations. We need someone making the calls or we are just a bunch of hired guns. We're at our strongest when we act as a unit. Testy get's up and straps on his weapon belt. He glances at his pack, but leaves it behind, preferring to travel light for now. This ship should be safe for now, he thinks, stuffing some rations into his belt pouch, just in case. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 11/03/2020 17:59
Hearing Zeds message Kite grabs his rifle slinging it over his shoulder and says "on my way" into his helmet comm checking to make sure the new sound proofing is working. He doesn't like the hesitancy in Zeds voice but doesn't want to push the issue. It's something that will need to be addressed eventually but not by Kite order 66 made to much of a rift for him to do so. He then gets outside and prepares to move out (edited)
Stormchaser 11/03/2020 19:51

Rick Fisto 11/03/2020 20:15

Stormchaser 11/03/2020 20:18

Rick Fisto 11/03/2020 20:29

toddmoonbounce 12/03/2020 02:21

Stormchaser 12/03/2020 18:46
Rider laughs and sidles forwards between the others as he steps up to speak with the Twi'lek in Huttese. "What's Zietta hiked the docking fee up to this time, huh?" The captain jibes good-naturedly. "You should watch yourself, Rider," the enforcer sneers in return, "McCarthy won't be pleased to see you back. The fee is 80 credits, plus another 50 for the skiff." Rider fishes a handful of credit chips out of his jacket and hands them over with a mock bow. "Will that be all?" He asks, his voice dripping with sarcasm. The Twi'lek frowns in distaste as he counts the credits, but nevertheless stiffly steps aside to allow the gathered travellers to board the skiff. (edited)
Rick Fisto 12/03/2020 18:51
Testy climbs aboard, situating himself close to the Gamorreans.

Also total fees are 130 CR. Lets see how honest our pilot is."
RisenZed 12/03/2020 18:56
Zed looks at Kite and taps his knuckle twice on his helmet, signaling affirmative, understood. He steps onto the skiff, taking care to position himself with good line of sight at the two Gamorreans. This should be fun. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 12/03/2020 19:00
