hugehuman 12/03/2020 19:36
Shorlu steps up the ramp and onto the skiff, keeping an eye on the Twi'lek while folding his arms behind his head, appearing casual.
Stormchaser 12/03/2020 19:38
Once everyone is aboard, the gangplank is retracted and the skiff zooms off into the cove, taking a tight arc as it comes about and heads for the Slips. The Slips abut the cove and extend inward for two hundred yards before they give way to other districts. The most luxurious starship moorings and docking facilities are located within the slips. They feature actual landing platforms furnished with inertial generators, rather than umbilical links and extended boarding corridors. A few small cantinas are sprinkled throughout the Slips, with easy access for pilots and crew who don't wish to venture too far from their ships.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 12/03/2020 22:31
As the skiff moves through the facility Kite looks at both Rider and the Twi'Lek and asks in basic through his helmet's speakers "Are there any popular cantina's or meeting places on station, that you would recommend checking out while we are here"
Stormchaser 13/03/2020 17:02
Rider nods. "Three cantinas and a couple of casinos. 'Fische's Pub' is at one end of the Slips. That's mostly a pirate dive. 'Under the Table' is at the other. Good place for business. Lots of smugglers. Otherwise there's 'The Cruelest Cut' in the Nest and the casinos in the Arcade. Watch yourselves if you try the Nest though. It can get pretty rough." The Twi'lek ignores the conversation and not long later the skiff pulls up alongside the Slips. Each of the passengers is handed a token by the Devaronian pilot as they disembark.
RisenZed 13/03/2020 18:10
Zed looks at the token. "What's this?" he asks the Devaronian.
Stormchaser 13/03/2020 18:52
"Your ticket back to your ship," the pilot replies with a toothy grin. "Don't lose it."
Rick Fisto 13/03/2020 19:39
After a quick consultation amongst the group, Testy walks beside Adorhi toward Fische's Pub while Gauss walks behind them about 30 feet.
Stormchaser 13/03/2020 19:41
The trio head right down the Slips, towards an unassuming cantina at the far end. As they get closer they can hear live music pouring from within. (edited)
toddmoonbounce 13/03/2020 20:17
So glad to be stuck with Mr. Unstable himself... Well, then you should've spoke up, Adorhi's mind pushes back. I'm not here to make friends, but opening my mouth isn't helping any either. I just need to take care of business so we can get back to Prello and hopefully move on. Adorhi usually loved to socialize. She was very good at it. Her looks obviously helped in certain situations, something she was fully aware of but often frustrated with. Prello would be the first to tell her that she's so much more than a pretty smile. It may have gotten her in the door a time or two, but her skills beyond that were the true measure of her worth. She was at her best however, on her own. She keeps quiet for most of the walk to Fische's Pub. Maybe I'll at least bump into some cute red tails while we're here. Her mind wanders back to the years leading up to leaving her home and a thought that at first brought excitement, quickly turns sour. "So, what's the plan here boys?"
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 13/03/2020 20:48
Kite nudges Zed and heads off to the Under the Table with Shorlu. "We will let them deal with the pirates, with Adorhi's people skills it will be a miracle if they make it off station" (edited)
RisenZed 13/03/2020 20:54
"I'm sure she can be charming when she wants to be," he says. "Look at it from her perspective? She's been thrown into some blaster fights that she would rather not participate in, and she's been stuck with us for a while now. Let's be honest, we're not the easiest bunch to be with." As they walk, he looks at Kite's new weapon. "That's a nice rifle," he says. "Not as nice as the sniper attachment on the old DC-17, but still nice."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 13/03/2020 21:18
Kite chuckles and says "Fair enough, we were never the most sociable group even with our fellow clones." Kite then lifts the rifle admiringly and says "Its not the DC-17, but it's the best thing I've seen since we left the GAR. That old carbine I had is like a slingshot compared to this beauty."
Stormchaser 13/03/2020 21:27
Rider walks along with Shorlu and the two clones as they head left up the slips. "So you're looking for this Barin guy, right? Where do you plan to start?"
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 13/03/2020 21:40
Kite freezes and thinks may have spoke too soon, this guy has the sublty of a Rancor. We may be the ones in need of a miracle. He then looks at Rider and abruptly says "No names in public." Our primary goal though is to stay under the radar"
Rick Fisto 13/03/2020 21:46
Turning to Adorhi, Testy says quietly,"I'd prefer to leave the planning to you this time. You let us know if you need anything killed. Otherwise, I'm planning on just looking tough to make sure no one tries anything funny." (edited)
Stormchaser 13/03/2020 22:36

Stormchaser 15/03/2020 21:57
Fische's Pub is bustling, but not overfilled, as Adorhi, Gauss and Testy step inside. Most guests are relaxing after work. Some are grouped in booths, others sat on stools at the bar. Humans make up the majority, but Balosar, Barabel, Houk and Wroonians are all notably well represented.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 16/03/2020 18:18

Stormchaser 16/03/2020 19:08
The dockmaster's offices are located in a control tower overlooking the slips. The ground level is open to the public and a wroonian secretary sits behind a desk besides the elevator doors.
hugehuman 16/03/2020 19:22

19:26
His change in posture and improved grammar are notable to Kite and Zed.
Stormchaser 16/03/2020 19:30

hugehuman 16/03/2020 19:51

"My, uh, very demanding Hutt employer insists." He looks back and forth sheepishly between the well-armed clones flanking him, as if they're there to make sure he's doing his job. "It'll only be a minute, ma'am."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 16/03/2020 19:56

Stormchaser 16/03/2020 22:04

"I still can't just give you free access to our database," the secretary insists forcefully, before glancing left and right. "What exactly were you looking for?" she quietly asks.

He hasn't seen many of their kind since the war.

Stormchaser 17/03/2020 14:57
The secretary arches an eyebrow, shaking her head at the vague description. "A lot of ships come through Point Nadir in a week, and most pilots aren't exactly chatty about where exactly they came from or are headed to. Usually, all we have is a hyperspace trajectory and the most recent vessel to come in from that general direction was the 'Katarn's Bane', which moored in the tethers less than one standard hour ago. Before that... a YT-1300 freighter by the name of the 'Mad Line', about 12 hours earlier. They set down in the slips in Bay 226. Then there's the 'Harlequin', a 3-Z light freighter. She arrived two night cycles ago - also moored out in the tethers. The 'Marchana' has been birthed in Bay 132 for three days now. That one's a Ghtroc 690... do you really want to hear the whole week? Many of them have left again already." (edited)

Stormchaser 17/03/2020 22:46
The balding man is well dressed and still has a spattering of light blonde hair around the sides of his head. However, he remains silent for now, waiting for Adorhi to reveal her own cards.

Lots of beings set off his radar in this place, so he had to raise his standards on what suspicious activity actually was.
Stormchaser 18/03/2020 14:34
As far as Zed can tell, the trio is not being followed, and after a short work they arrive outside 'Under the Table', at the other end of the Slips. This cantina has a low-lit interior and a grungier aesthetic than the bubbling atmosphere of Fishe's Pub. Patrons clad in dark clothes hold murmured conversations in their shadowy booths, and the background music is decidedly less lively.
RisenZed 18/03/2020 14:49

There are a several tables free about the dingy cantina, and the trio quickly claim one for themselves. A bored-looking and heavily made-up waitress soon makes her way over to them, waiting with an expectant stare.

Stormchaser 18/03/2020 21:16
"Call me Alastair," the man tells Adorhi, raising his glass in kind. "If I might lend you a word of advice, Adorhi, Andy over there is something of an institution in these parts. He's managed behind the bar of Fische's Pub for longer than most here can remember, and it seems that he had no trouble pointing you in my direction, so maybe pay him a little more respect, hm? Regardless, as for 'short-term employment', I do have a job I could use some extra hands on, but why don't you tell me a little more about yourself first, my dear? What is it you do, hm?" Alastair leans forward as he talks, clearly interested to hear the mysterious Togruta's story. However, his sharp eyes don't miss the two clones hovering a few steps behind her.
Stormchaser 18/03/2020 21:45
Meanwhile, the waitress in 'Under the Table' jots down the trio's order without so much as a smile. "That'll be four credits," she declares dryly, before carrying the order off towards the kitchen. Kite spots a few different Balosar about the cantina, but everyone except the staff seems to be keeping a low profile.
toddmoonbounce 18/03/2020 21:55

Stormchaser 19/03/2020 19:00

You came to me looking for 'short-term employment', did you not? Acquisitions jobs typically run a little longer. Or have I misunderstood you?" Back in Under the Table, it isn't long until the server returns with a steaming pile of greasy fast-food for Shorlu. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 19/03/2020 19:05
when the food & drinks return Kite hands the waitress 4 credits and sets another pile of 10 credits to the side and says "Thank you. toddmoonbounce 19/03/2020 19:07
Adorhi kicks out her chair and stands up, finishing off the last bit of her wine."If someone asks, who are we working for? Just Mr. Allstar? Or do you belong to some group of even more charming fellows?"
Rick Fisto 19/03/2020 19:39
With that response, Testy's mental image of Adorhi snaps. He hadn't realized it, but he had somehow made himself believe that Adorhi was some confident, smooth operator. Her disdain for the clones had read as supreme and justified confidence in her own abilities. For a while now, he had been heeling her like a hound heels his master....like a clone heels his Jedi. Oh stars... Testy thinks to himself. She's broken. She's broken and I've... Emotionally overwhelmed, Testy turns and flees to the bar, demanding a double portion of Dagobah Whiskey, slamming it back hard. The smokey flavor of the bog peat with the hot burn of the alcohol making the drink taste like a campfire, burning away the confused thoughts running through his mind.
Stormchaser 19/03/2020 20:33
"What do I look like, an information broker?" The girl drawls sardonically. "You're on the wrong side of town, Reg." ---------- "Mr Alastair will do just fine," Adorhi is told as he taps briefly at a nearby datapad. "Docking Bay 53. They'll be expecting you." Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 19/03/2020 20:39

toddmoonbounce 19/03/2020 20:49

Drake | Emperor 21/03/2020 16:52

We should meet up there before deciding what to do next.) (edited)
hugehuman 21/03/2020 16:55
"Already on it," comes Shorlu's quiet reply, as he continues listening to the two Epsis agents, just in case they mention something else. His plate of greasy food is now sparkling clean.
Stormchaser 22/03/2020 21:37
The Epsis grunts have moved on in their conversation, and are now discussing the going odds at the bookie's for pod races.
Stormchaser 23/03/2020 15:30
The Souk is a true interstellar open-air marketplace and the heart of Point Nadir. The streets lined with stalls selling food, exotic beasts and even spice and slaves. The odour of many creatures living together in less than sanitary conditions permeates the area. Adorhi can see the aqualish who she was following ordering a fried gorg from a street vendor's stall. (edited)
toddmoonbounce 23/03/2020 19:03
Adorhi scans the various food stalls, looking for a quick snack in the form of fresh fruit. "Are the others on their way or what?" she says to Gauss. (edited)
hugehuman 23/03/2020 19:12
"Seems that's all they had to say about it." Says Shorlu, leaving a 2 credit tip of his own. Sure the food wasn't great, and the waitress was worse, but it was another Ortolan custom that he couldn't simply ignore. He hops down from his seat, and gestures to the others. "Let's get moving." He starts heading for the Souk.
RisenZed 23/03/2020 19:34

Stormchaser 25/03/2020 14:15

toddmoonbounce 25/03/2020 15:36

Stormchaser 25/03/2020 16:23

Stormchaser 31/03/2020 17:45
Puzell pulls a data tape from his jacket pocked and slips it into his datapad. "Why don't you tell me what you think of this, hm, Kite?" A holorecording from a security camera begins to play. It shows, first, a short-haired Balosar male in gaudy green and blue clothing leaving the Mad Line. The cameras track him until he leaves the Slips and show that he is headed into Point Nadir's Trade District. The recording cuts to another, which shows the arrival and departure of a group of men. The men are dressed in simple earth-tone suits. Their leader, a Human of similar posture who wears earth-tone robes, enters the Mad Line while the other three wait behind. He emerges later, and the group departs. "Phellip's body was discovered by an Epsis protocol droid that was sent to collect his docking fees. He died of asphyxiation. His larynx was practically crushed. Critical flight systems have been removed from the ship and the weapons systems have been disconnected. Whoever did this wanted to keep the Mad Line from leaving Point Nadir, and knew precisely what needed to be done to accomplish that. Now, I have a pretty good idea of who's behind this, but what I don't yet understand is why. You're sure that you don't know anything about that?" (edited)

Stormchaser 31/03/2020 19:06

If I were coming to Point Nadir to hide from someone who wanted me dead, I'd probably find a nice cosy safe house and wait them out. At that, he leans forwards, still fixing Kite with the same unblinking red-eyed stare. "Evad Court is the the best one here, though I doubt this Balosar could afford more than a couple of weeks in one of their smaller safe houses. The only trouble is - and this isn't common knowledge - Evad is a part of the Sable Dawn. If they discover that he's alive in one of their safe houses, I don't expect he'll be alive long enough to pay the bill. Try Fetwin Porlo. He's an information broker. Runs a shop called 'Down Low'. He might know something about this Balosar." (edited)

Zed gives a mere glance at the woman blocking their path before continuing to watch their followers. "Knowing what we have isn't part of what we were paid to do, ma'am."
Stormchaser 02/04/2020 07:15
She rolls her eyes. "Yes, well I don't suppose Alastair has paid you yet. That's really not his style. I'll help you out. The medical supplies that that droid is transporting could save hundreds of lives, but he'll sell them for close to 1000 times what they cost to produce. Does that sound fair to you?" (edited)
Rick Fisto 02/04/2020 07:19
"Sounds like it'll save hundreds of lives either way."
RisenZed 02/04/2020 07:20
"What's your stake in this?" Zed asks, still half facing the people behind them. "I suppose you're going to tell us that you'll just give them away?"
Stormchaser 02/04/2020 07:23
The womans eyes harden when she hears Testy's response. "At cost. We all have to eat too. Everyone here knows somebody suffering under Alastair's boot. I get the impression that you have very little stake in this. What would it cost you just to walk away?"
Rick Fisto 02/04/2020 07:26
"I took a job lady. I'm not walking cause you don't think lives are worth the money he's asking. Why don't you go make some more of whatever's in here and be useful instead of just playing a shell game with what's not yours."
Stormchaser 02/04/2020 07:33
Near the rear of the convoy of escorts, one of the gathered gang members seems to snap and breaks ranks from the shadowy crowd near the edge of street, charging towards the hauler droid with a roar. "Wait-," the woman shouts stretching a hand out helplessly. (edited)
Rick Fisto 02/04/2020 07:51
As the gang member rushes headlong at Zed with a bared blade, Testy waits for Zed to stun the man. As Zed seems to hesitate and the gang member swiftly approaches, a murderous glint in his eye, Testy realizes how young the man is. Barely a man at all. Testy steps diagonally in front of Zed, igniting his blade and sweeping it across the man's path, slicing the man's blade from it's hilt. "Everyone stop. Go home," Testy shouts, holding his blade up, pointed at the disarmed man. (edited)
RisenZed 02/04/2020 07:54
Zed raises his rifle reluctantly and points it in the kid's face. Kriff. He's just a kid. How desperate do you have to get to rush a group of armored troopers with a vibroblade? "My friend here could have just killed you. Listen to what he says," Zed says, a wave of sobering fear crashing over him. "Go home." This Alastair has a lot to answer for, Zed thinks, his mind racing, trying to think of a way to get these meds to the right people. But he pauses as he realizes that at least Testy isn't with him. Testy wants to do the job and get paid. (edited)
hugehuman 02/04/2020 07:59
Shorlu keeps his blaster out but lowered, eyeing the others in the assembled group, hoping they don't try anything as rash as the first one.
Stormchaser 02/04/2020 08:01
The kid drops to his knees, clutching shakily at the useless hilt of his weapon as he stares up at the shining blue of Testy's lightsaber. Ahead of the droid, the woman steps aside, but shoots the clones a filthy look as the other gang members back away in fear. "You've chosen a side today, remember that." (edited)
Rick Fisto 02/04/2020 08:07
"Sorry about your blade kid. You've got guts. Go make something of yourself." Testy powers down his saber as he backs away from the kid a few steps before turning around and continuing to follow the droid.
RisenZed 02/04/2020 08:07
Zed lowers his rifle as he and Testy leave the area, keeping pace behind the droid while backpedaling, keeping an eye on the crowd they were leaving behind. He says nothing. He always knew there was corruption. No organization is ever truly good. But he always imagined that he, at his core, was good. That he did good. But in this moment, all he feels is an unravelling inside him, as if all the good he ever did was undone right then.
hugehuman 02/04/2020 08:09
The words hang in the air, but leave their mark on Shorlu. He nudges Testy (or rather, Testy's shin) and whispers, "I know it's risky having a guy like Alastair on our hinds, but... ya think we could throw 'em a bone? Maybe make it easier for them to take this stuff back? I'll take the blame for it."
Rick Fisto 02/04/2020 08:11
"Whatta ya mean take it back? It ain't theirs. Their problem isn't with Alastair, it's with their limited opportunities. I don't know how this place is run, but if someone is preventing more of these supplies coming in, that seems to be the person they should be lookin' to string up." (edited)
hugehuman 02/04/2020 08:19
"Yeah. Always a buck to pass. Right. I'll clamp this old trunk of mine." Shorlu is dissatisfied, but doesn't force the issue. He gradually begins to remember beyond the excitement of being "back on the case:" the shady deals, the looking the other way time after time. It had worn on him then, and he knew it wouldn't be any different now. But still, he had a harder time letting it go than in his youth.
Rick Fisto 02/04/2020 08:26

First the deep remorse and personal loss associated with murdering our friend. Now this. Sometimes I think they programmed me different than the others. Or maybe the programming just didn't stick with me. (edited)
Stormchaser 02/04/2020 08:58

toddmoonbounce 02/04/2020 22:52

"Not an ounce of a chance that they don't screen these calls regardless of encryption..." she thinks to herself with frustration. She slams a fist down on the machine and turns to continue on towards the pub.
Stormchaser 02/04/2020 23:13
Shorlu and the clones find 'Down Low' behind a grimy door to the basement level of one of the buildings in the Trade District. A knock on the door is met with distant shouting from the far side, and a short time later a metal grill opens to reveal a pair of bulbous green eyes set into blue-green skin. "Hello, hello, and welcome to the Down Low. Information... for a price. What do you want?" The voice is somehow simultaneously nasal and hoarse.
Stormchaser 02/04/2020 23:31
Meanwhile back in Fische's pub, Adorhi finds Alastair at the bar chatting with Andy.
hugehuman 03/04/2020 03:07
"Know anything about a Balosar, come in on the Mad Line?" Shorlu speaks just loudly enough for the sentient on the other side of the door to hear.
Stormchaser 03/04/2020 09:02
The eyes glance left and right, scanning the faces gathered outside the door. Four soldiers and an Ortolan, all in search of one thing - information. "Aaah, you want to do business. Come inside, come inside," the voice replies. The grill shuts with a clack, followed by a series of rattling and scraping noises, after which the door opens with a creak. The group find themselves face to face with a portly Toydarian, who flutters about nervously, never staying in one spot for long. He's wearing a baggy, single-piece lounge suit that looks like it's in desperate need of laundering. "Fetwin Porlo, at your service," the Toydarian introduces himself, with a miniature bow in mid air as he shows the group inside. He speaks in a rapid, distracted manner. "As I always say, if they respire, then there's something that they don't want someone else to know!" Porlo laughs hard at his own joke, before composing himself. "I probably know what you need, for a price," he adds, with a smile full of crooked teeth. "Give me some specifics!" (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 03/04/2020 15:14
Kite walks into the establishment and listens to Fetwin chatter to himself he then says "Fetwin we need information on a Balosar who has a habit of wearing gaudy clothing we think he is hiding out inEvad Court and he arrived on planet on the Madline ship" (edited)
Stormchaser 03/04/2020 16:22
"Mhm, mhm, and who might you be, yeah? Not the talkative types, huh? Evad's got a whooole lot of safe houses out in the Fissures. It's not just one. They've got good ones, and then they've got not-so-good ones. Your friend? He's in one of the not-so-good ones." The Toydarian scratches his prodigious nose before continuing. "I got the directions here... for a price. You might want to buy some extra firepower too. Maybe some explosives, eh? These places, I hear they're tough nuts to crack! I can show you to a weapons dealer, and I'll even do it for free! Ha!"
RisenZed 03/04/2020 16:37

Stormchaser 03/04/2020 16:56

toddmoonbounce 03/04/2020 17:11

Stormchaser 03/04/2020 17:45
Alastair throws Adorhi a sidelong glance as she pulls up besides him and Andy serves their drinks. "So I noticed," he remarks, tapping lightly on his datapad, which rests atop the bar. "Good work. Andy, would you be so kind as to pay the lady?" The wookie reaches below the bar and sets a stack of credit chips in front of Adorhi. "I do hope it wasn't too much trouble," Alastair adds. -------------------------------------------------- Across town in the Trade District, Fetwin's mouth twists into something between a grimace and a smirk. "1200 then, I have to live on this, you know? You're short on cash? How about you head over to the Arcade. Put what you got on a winner. Maybe you'll win, maybe you'll lose. The chance is something you'll have to take, I think."
toddmoonbounce 03/04/2020 18:37
Adorhi quickly thumbs through the credits and puts them away, but not before sliding 5cr on the bar over to Andy for the drinks and his service. It's not the best pay for a job like that she's gotten, but not the worst either. She was used to a variance in credits for her work. And often, the payment came in other forms - information usually. "It'll likely be talking to a wall," Adorhi thinks to herself as she puts together the right questions to ask Alastair. Discretely acquiring her employers' requests was her specialty, but getting information to set up those heists was still required. She had to at least try. "You would know better, I'm sure, of how much trouble those charity workers would've been, but my lovely acquaintances felt the need to puff out their chests and might've escalated things more than necessary. Regardless, no, it wasn't much trouble. Not as much as we've been finding ourselves in otherwise. Ever since I've grouped up with those bucketheads it's been nothing but trouble. And it's followed...er, lead us here." Adorhi gives her drink a gentle swirl before taking another sip. Amber...red...her favorite color. "You certainly seem to be a man with some power and knowledge around here. Is that fair, darling? Would you humor a gal with some of the latter?"
Stormchaser 03/04/2020 21:53
Alastair chuckles and sips at his own drink - a tumbler of golden hued liquor that smells like smoke. "My, my, Adorhi. You're certainly an eager young go-getter, aren't you? It does sound like you handled those bleeding hearts quite well though. They can be troublesome sometimes. How about this? First you humour me with your full name and then you ask your questions."
toddmoonbounce 04/04/2020 16:49

Stormchaser 04/04/2020 16:50

toddmoonbounce 04/04/2020 17:33

Stormchaser 04/04/2020 18:11

toddmoonbounce 04/04/2020 18:15

Stormchaser 04/04/2020 18:34

toddmoonbounce 04/04/2020 18:37
"Who collects the paycheck for them?"
Stormchaser 04/04/2020 18:57
"Virec Xan," Alastair tells Adorhi with a look of distaste, as though merely saying the name is unpleasant, "he's their administrator here on Point Nadir. He's unquestionably loyal and a dab hand at finding out what others would rather remained unknown. Virec has a seat on the council here. Not a man to cross lightly."
toddmoonbounce 04/04/2020 19:29

Stormchaser 04/04/2020 20:24

Stormchaser 04/04/2020 23:54

toddmoonbounce 05/04/2020 19:07

Stormchaser 05/04/2020 19:42
A little less than half an hour later, the party reconvenes in the Fissures, close to the Arcade district. Kite has chosen a spot to wait two blocks from the Evad Court safe house. The Fissures are Point Nadir's slums, in large part because they encompass a winding series of cave-like fissures between the Arcade and the mines. Those with no place else to go eke out an existence in the Fissures District, spending their time sorting through garbage in the hopes of living for one more day. The poorest of Point Nadir's residents constitute the majority of the Fissures' population, but more affluent individuals occasionally spend days or weeks hiding from enemies in the district. The Fissures are technically part of the mines, and given that the mines are a prohibited area by Anjiliac decree, violent encounters between Anjiliac thugs and the impoverished residents of the Fissures District are common.
RisenZed 05/04/2020 19:55
"This place," Zed says, looking around at the destitution. "I hate this whole asteroid."

"Yeah its no resort. Lets grab the thief and get out of here before someone takes a shot at us." The rest of us can keep a lookout and will be ready to back you two up incase it goes sideways" (edited)

10:31
The safe house appears to be nothing more than a run-down casino from the outside. It's a single-story permacrete structure in the middle of a large cavern in the lower part of the Fissures District. There seems to be no external security, and no one is seen leaving or entering the building. A quick walk around the area reveals three entrances: two airlock-quality doors in the rear of the building, and a single metal door in the front. (edited)
RisenZed 06/04/2020 15:22

Stormchaser 06/04/2020 20:27
The door slides open with a sharp hiss when Adorhi knocks on it, revealing twenty foot by twenty foot room, capped at the far end by a pair of sealed airlock doors. Two armoured transparisteel windows, on on either side, reveal two well-dressed guards seated at consoles. The guard to the left looks up from his monitors and asks through a speaker, "can I help you?"
Rick Fisto 06/04/2020 22:31
Testy takes the room in as he bends his head left and then right, cracking the joints between his vertebrae. "Play nice, Dori," Testy says in Twi'leki under his breath.
toddmoonbounce 06/04/2020 22:44

Rick Fisto 06/04/2020 22:57
Testy is startled by Adorhi's correction. Another crack in his understanding of the world that should have come long ago, perhaps. He was assigned a number at creation, but he had been given a name by his brothers. Earned it, in fact, whether he liked the name or not. But he liked it because he earned it. But Adorhi hadn't earned the nickname "Dori". He'd used it because it was quick and because "Adorhi" sounded too much like "adore" and it made him a little uncomfortable. He wasn't close enough to her to feel right using her real name. But I'm not close enough to giver her a nickname either.
22:57
"Sorry, Adorhi," he says in basic as she walks away.

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 07/04/2020 20:19

Drake | Emperor 07/04/2020 20:39
"On our way"
RisenZed 07/04/2020 20:46
Meanwhile, Zed finds another hidey-hole with good line of sight on the safehouse, this time, behind an overflowing garbage disposal container. He wasn't sure what was making him more nauseous -- the smell of the garbage, or the fact that they had just kept medical supplies from desperate people. He had been tempted to crack the box of supplies open right there in the square and letting people take them, but he knew that they'd just end up being sold anyway. He knew that there wasn't a clear "right thing to do" in that situation, but a small voice in the back of his head kept pestering him about it. It didn't sit right. He squashed the thought down. Focus on the mission at hand. You can worry about it later. (edited)
Rick Fisto 07/04/2020 20:53
Testy goes with Shorlu, trusting him to find a good stake out vantage.
20:55
"Hey, Shorlu. Just wanted to say I'm sorry about the 'Trunks' thing. I uh...I'm. Well, I'm sorry. That's all."
hugehuman 07/04/2020 20:57
Shorlu meanders back down the street in a casual manner, pretending to be looking for food, as his race were wont to do. Subconsciously, he begins to fall into his old method. A few steps forward, a half-step in one direction accompanied by a sniff from his trunk here and there. The last time he'd done this for a job had to have been on Ord Mantell...
20:59
"Huh?" He says, snapping out of his reverie for a second, before realizing what Testy was talking about. "Oh, that? You don't have to apologize for that. I really like the name! The galaxy needs more sentients with a sense of humor, I find." (edited)
21:06
"Me, I'm just happy to be doing what I'm best at again. Piloting's fine, but eh, a side gig's a side gig. Right here." He mutters as he coolly slips into an alcove, leaning against the wall of a building within sight of the safe house, then hands him a cheap tabac stick. "Have one. Even if ya don't smoke."
Rick Fisto 07/04/2020 21:08

hugehuman 07/04/2020 21:15

He does the same for his own. "Old spacer's trick." he quips afterwards. He focuses on the building while remaining outwardly relaxed.
toddmoonbounce 07/04/2020 21:19
Adorhi reaches up to the zip line and gives it a firm tug, testing it's hold. It was an almost automatic reaction, one she made hundreds of times before. "Ready?" she says, looking back to Guass, as she grabs the rope, ankles wrapped around it as well, and slides to the other roof.
Drake | Emperor 07/04/2020 22:09

Purpose means nothing if they get gunned down before fulfilling it.
Rick Fisto 08/04/2020 18:56

The slightly thin air of the asteroid helped to offset the heaviness of the odors from this quarter. The streets was mostly quiet with the distant buzz of conversation occasionally punctuated by a shout or an argument from afar.

"Here we go, boys!" she says to the others through her comm before firing up the fusion cutter and going to work. The sounds of battle of the Clone Wars were usually enough cover for the loud nature of the fusion cutter. There wasn't the same luxury here. The cutters in her hands were bittersweet, however. She began to get the usual rush she did when executing an extraction, but knowing what, or who rather, she was extracting dampened that feeling.

RisenZed 11/04/2020 20:26
Zed exhales as Kite counts down and squeezes the trigger of his blaster rifle a millisecond after Kite says 'go.' Both bolts collide with the well dressed man and he hits the pavement hard. Zed moves out into the street to begin dragging the body back into his hideout.
Stormchaser 11/04/2020 20:56
A few moments later, the roof plating drops into the building with a clank, swiftly followed by a blaster bolt that fortunately doesn't come anywhere close to hitting Adorhi or Gauss. Cowering behind the bed in the room below is a Balosar who looks small, even for a member of his species. He's dressed in a gaudy suit of dyed leather that includes a green vest and bright blue pants tucked into black boots that rise to his mid-calf. His brown eyes dart back and forth like those of a hunted animal. Adorhi recognises him as Barin Trevina. "Stay back!" The thief yells as he shoots, his voice shaky. However, when he sees Adorhi Barin's manner shifts to one of utter surprise. "Tails?!?! Oh kriff, it's actually you. I thought it was a trick. What the hell do you think you're doing?!" (edited)
toddmoonbounce 11/04/2020 23:01
"What am I doing? Perhaps you'd like to answer that for yourself? But first, we need to get your ass out of here. You know how easily it would be for me to just let you rot, so don't screw around and let's move. Gauss, help me with this rope, will ya?" Adorhi unravels her fibercord and throws one end down into the apartment while handing the other to Gauss. With Barin holding on, she pulls with Gauss until the Balosar is on the roof with them. "Kite! Drop the cable from your end. We'll use it to scale down the building. Anyone have a bright idea of what to do then?" Adorhi yells in to her commlink as they rush to their initial arrival point on the roof.
RisenZed 11/04/2020 23:04

Stormchaser 12/04/2020 05:16

toddmoonbounce 12/04/2020 19:22
Barin, I could give a womp rats ass if you end up dead in this druk hole," she didn't really mean this, "but I'd prefer to stay in Prell's good favor by bringing you home. The Dawn are nothing to mess with and they will get to you if you stay here." Adorhi assumed she looked purple now that her blood had rushed to her face in the rage over Barin's foolishness. How he was Prello's number one she'd never understand. But still, number two to someone as influential as Prello wasn't bad either, right? And it was so much more than just a working relationship. Prello was like family to Adorhi. One of the few she could be close to among years and years of being on her own. Leaving her family was the hardest thing Adorhi ever dealt with, and in an exaggerated swing of the scales, she pledged to solitude and independence to prevent any possibility of that same devastating heartbreak again... ...even in a working relationship... ...with four trigger happy bucketheads and a living garbage disposal... As the hint of tears begin to surface, Adorhi shakes off her thoughts and again yells down to Barin, "You have two seconds to grab this rope and come with us, otherwise we'll take you back in a bag. One....two...."
Stormchaser 12/04/2020 19:34

Rick Fisto 14/04/2020 22:03

Drake | Emperor 15/04/2020 07:34

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 15/04/2020 15:33
Kite slings his rifle and starts sprinting down the stairs to the exit
hugehuman 15/04/2020 19:13
Shorlu takes a moment to breathe, and more clearly takes in the situation. Kite should be making his own way down from his perch, no need to worry about him. Adorhi had Barin, and they were getting down with no problems, relatively. The other clones were on the approach as well, and could flank the guard that shot him. He scrutinizes the guard, and realizes he's seen many security forces use the same moves and tactics, and begins to predict them in advance. He aims at him and fires, but his calculated shot is thrown off by residual pain in his back. He drops down to his knees before the guard can shoot back.
Stormchaser 16/04/2020 22:42
The guards on each side of the building move closer to the street, raising their weapons to head off the intruders...
RisenZed 17/04/2020 17:01
A blaster bolt from Zed's rifle was already flying by the time the guard's entire head had popped out of the alley. I might need a new rifle, Zed thinks, looking along the barrel of his old DC-17m. This old thing doesn't seem to be cranking out enough power.
Drake | Emperor 17/04/2020 18:25
As soon as the guard is within range, Gauss fires off his blaster, the bolt deviates slightly to the right, merely hitting the man in the arm, but the charged bolt sets him ablaze. That's gonna leave a mark, he thinks to himself. (edited)
Stormchaser 17/04/2020 19:54
The guard by the east corner of the building returns fire at Zed, catching the squad leader with a glancing bolt the knocks his shoulder back. Meanwhile on the west side the other guard sends blaster bolts sailing over the heads of Adorhi and Barin as they exchange fire.
toddmoonbounce 17/04/2020 21:41
Maintaining her trajectory towards hopeful cover, Adorhi checks over her shoulder for the pursuing guards and fires off a shot with her pistol. RisenZed 17/04/2020 22:16

Drake | Emperor 17/04/2020 22:19

RisenZed 17/04/2020 22:24

A short skiff ride back across the Cove to the Tethers and the Katarn's Bane can be seen moored up ahead... but something isn't quite right. The freighter is hanging at an odd angle and has drifted very close to a neighbouring vessel. As the skiff draws closer a Gran can be seen stood atop the other ship. "Is this your bucket of bolts?!" toddmoonbounce 20/04/2020 19:26

hugehuman 20/04/2020 19:40
The skiff pulls off, and is piloted over to The Slips. From there, Shorlu and co. will head for The Cruelest Cut.
Stormchaser 20/04/2020 20:04
Barin sighs and rubs his temples. "Fische was a Corellian pirate captain a few centuries back. Real extravagant guy. He made this comet his base of operations, back before anyone else was here. Fische's mining droids carved out the first tunnels of the Fissures and he stashed aaall his loot away there. 'Fische's legacy' the locals call it, and every two-bit treasure hunter dreams of finding the hoard and making his fortune. Thing is, it ain't just one pile of booty. Fische hid caches all through the deepest parts of the comet, and the Anjiliac's have been digging them up ever since they took over." Barin watches Adorhi for a moment to make sure that all this has sunk in before continuing. "Now, it happens that I know a guy who claims to have found one. Sure, him and every other fool on this comet, you might say, but he described the Fell Star perfectly. Too perfectly. This guy has seen the thing. He tells me this whole tale about where to find it too... and the next thing I know the Sable Dawn are breathing down my neck. Still, Prello wants the thing and so here I am on Point Nadir waiting them out so I can go get it. Then you and your friends show up." "You trying to steal my job, Tails?" Barin adds with a wink.
Stormchaser 20/04/2020 20:11
By the time Gauss, Kite, Shorlu and Testy arrive at the Cruelest Cut, it's packed with raucous customers that can be heard from all the way down the street. In fact, the cantina is so full that patrons are spilling out the doors. Lights flash from inside the building and some kind of muffled commentary can be heard over the cheers and hubbub of the event's audience.
toddmoonbounce 20/04/2020 20:19

toddmoonbounce 28/04/2020 19:44

hugehuman 28/04/2020 20:09

(edited)
toddmoonbounce 28/04/2020 20:23
At Shorlu's mention of the job, Adorhi immediately throws a look over to Zed. Her firewater clouded mind then clears, reminding her that the Fell Star gig also brings in 15k and she does her best to play off the sudden snap movement and expression on her face.
RisenZed 28/04/2020 20:32
Zed raises an eyebrow at Adorhi's look, but keeps his mouth shut about the Lucrehulk for now. "Well, we've got the Fell Star job that we should move on quickly, according to Barin here," Zed says, gesturing at the Balosar. (edited)
hugehuman 28/04/2020 20:59
Shorlu looks between Adorhi and Zed for a moment. He might've simply paid no mind, if he were just a bum off the street, as his looks suggestedâ€”but he was indeed a detective. "Wait a sec. I got a feeling I'm not in the loop on something here, run it back: do we have... another job that pays around 15 grand?"
toddmoonbounce 28/04/2020 22:01
Adorhi does her best to shake off any reaction to Shorlu's intuition and deflect his question. She steps towards him, hand out, in a silent request for her flask. "So, Barin, what all do you know about the Dawn?"
Stormchaser 29/04/2020 20:23
Barin freezes with a mouth full of booze, before gulping sheepishly. "They're big stuff on Point Nadir. They want the Fell Star and they're not afraid to kill people to get it." The Balosar shrugs. "That's what matters, right?"
hugehuman 29/04/2020 20:30

Drake | Emperor 29/04/2020 20:46

Stormchaser 29/04/2020 21:42

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 30/04/2020 16:31
Kite nods and says "Mirrors what Prello and some of the others have said. Lets head out, hopefully we can beat them there and if not we can gather some more info from them in person"
Stormchaser 01/05/2020 11:10
Barin checks his pistol in its holster and makes for the hatch. "We should head for the Fissures, that's where the entrances to the mining tunnels are. Just so you know - they are off-limits. The penalty is, uh, 'summary execution'. They're rarely patrolled though, if ever. Just, uh, keep your eyes open for ministry goons, or, you know, spiders..."
Rick Fisto 01/05/2020 14:58
"Kriffin' hell. I hate spiders," Testy shivered. One of the side benefits of his kitteh was her constant vigilance against the insidious threat posed by creepy-crawlies. (edited)
RisenZed 01/05/2020 15:18
Following Barin, Zed slaps his brother on the arm. "Could be worse. Remember the geonosian brain worms? I hate those things."
Stormchaser 01/05/2020 20:59
Once Shorlu has righted the Katarn's Bane and new moorings have been attached, the clones and their newfound friends catch a skiff back to the Slips, before heading for the Fissures. The streets seem quiet and at the rear of the enormous cavern the gaping tunnels at the entrance to the mines extend into darkness.
hugehuman 01/05/2020 21:38
Shorlu identifies the entrance, and checks his weapon. "I don't picture this as an espionage kinda job. Let's get in and get out." He gets out a small glowrod, and activates it, casting soft green light into the mines.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 01/05/2020 21:45

Rick Fisto 01/05/2020 22:01

RisenZed 01/05/2020 22:14

Drake | Emperor 01/05/2020 22:18
Gauss turns on the glowrod hanging from his bandolier "Reminds me of the Geonosian tunnels we had to climb through at the beginning of the war" (edited)
Rick Fisto 01/05/2020 22:32
Testy shivers again as his mind drifts back to those tunnels. He moved as quietly as possible and, although never quiet as nimble as some of his brothers or Haspin, Test usually managed to get the drop on foes in these situations. But he didn't like it right now. Haspin had gone another route, and they planned to meet up further down the tunnels. That meant he was all alone up front, on point. He knew his brothers had his back, but right now he was more worried about what would be behind the next bend. As he rounded the corner, his infrared scopes lit up, revealing a mass of oddly-jointed, carapce-encrusted, wing-flitting geonosians waiting for him. He brought up his vibrosword quickly, but they pulled him in passing him through to a second wave of the creatures and he went down underneath them, their bodies crushing and pawing at his armor. His vision was blocked by the press of the bodies all around, tearing at him. He yelled for help over his comm unit and he quickly heard the reassurance of his brothers. They spoke to him, telling him they were coming. The sounds of blaster fire filled the claustrophobic tunnels and spoke to him too, reassuring him that they were, indeed, coming for him. He wasn't sure how long it took--perhaps mere seconds--but it seemed like the pressure and the quickly moving limbs everywhere would never let up. Until they did. And Zed pulled him out of the pile of corpses. The smell, not fully filtered by his helmet, should have nauseated him. But to him, the smell would always trigger feelings of relief and freedom. Of life.
Stormchaser 01/05/2020 22:37
Setting out into the dark, Barin leads Adorhi and her allies into the labyrinthine network of tunnels. They twist and turn, but the Balosar never hesitates, only muttering to himself as he repeats the old pirate's story back like a mantra. Eventually they come to a wide cavern that seems to have been expanded recently. The tell-tale signs of plasma diggers on the shaped walls indicate recent excavation, as does a large amount of fresh rubble piled in the corners. The sounds of small mechanical treads turning and whirring, accompanied by a glowing pair of droid photoreceptors, approach from the dark cavern ahead.
Stormchaser 02/05/2020 08:09
The small droid is low to the ground, and moves confidently on a pair of noisy treads. A single plasma jet projector emerges from a mount on the unit's back. It does not appear to have yet spotted Barin or Testy. In the distance additional droids can be seen rolling about and mining the walls.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 02/05/2020 13:46
Kite moves stealthily through the caverns bringing up the rear of the party, making sure they aren't being followed. He notices the mining droids at work he moves quickly and quietly to evade their notice. He sees Testy & Barin do the same and thinks Barin is a natural thief if I didn't know he was here I would have lost track of him. He looks at the rest of the party Good work brothers. Even Zed in his bulky armor is moving like a ghost through the caverns. He spots Adorhi moving stealthily but still standing out Adorhi has some moves but its clear why Barin is Prello's number 1 thief in comparison. He then sees Shorlu about to trip over a burnt out droid shell and silently rushes up and grabs shorlu by the shoulder and gently pulls back as Shorlu's foot clips the shell. A noise echos through the cavern but fortunately the droids fail to notice it. He pats Shorlu on the back and moves back into the rear position. (edited)
hugehuman 03/05/2020 18:23
At first a little surprised, Shorlu steps back as Kite guides him, and gives a little signal of thanks. He keeps his glowrod covered, so as not to shine too much light and reveal them another way.
Rick Fisto 03/05/2020 19:07
Testy continues to walk next to Barin, telling him to hush it up a little so as to not attract the attention of the droids. Barin asks in a whisper how they should approach the droid situation. "Keep trying to sneak, Barin. But don't look like your trying to sneak." Barin gives him a withering look. "I don't know...sneak casual." (edited)
1
Stormchaser 03/05/2020 19:49
The cavern is filled with rubble and loose rocks, making footing treacherous. The ceiling is relatively high, although smaller, more confining tunnels lead off to the left. At least seven droids trundle about the immediate area, using their plasma projectors to mine at the walls.
hugehuman 04/05/2020 22:27
Looking ahead, Shorlu sees no easy way around the droids, nowhere to hide, and no likelihood of them simply abandoning their mining. He stands up a little straighter, and starts acting like he belongs here, hoping the others can pull it off too. For his part, he moves with rather convincing pomp and circumstance.
Stormchaser 05/05/2020 20:57
Shorlu strides through like he owns the place, but the clones are less convincing, armed and armoured as they are. Several of the little droids turn to face them, raising weapon-like protuberances from the top of their chassis. (edited)
Rick Fisto 06/05/2020 22:34
Testy is practicing his calm breathing although he can feel the fear rising within him. As the droids turn on them, raising weapons, it's like he's back there again surrounded by Geonosians. But as he brings his arm down to hold the lightsaber between himself and the droids, his left hand joining his right on the long pommel, the fear vanishes, replaced by a calmness and focus as he becomes almost one with the closest droid. Bringing his visualization into reality, Testy rushes forward as the hum of the saber fills his ears as it rips through the air towards the droid. Just before connecting, his mind is filled with an...image...for lack of a better term...of scalding pain. He immediately twists the saber away from the droid into a defensive position as two gouts of plasma crash into him. The saber catches the streams, diverting the flows mostly around him, leaving his left side feeling a little cooked from the intense heat and his right side blistered from it. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 06/05/2020 22:46
Kite sees Testy rush forward and while thankful for the extra illumination is a bit concerned that Testy is still using the traitors blade. He shakes this thought aside and thumbs a switch on his rifle turning on his combustive shot protocol and thinks I will just have to add some light of my own. He lines up a shot at the droid Testy is rushing towards, Testy's blade isn't able to get a solid hit on the droid but the attack does push the droid right into Kite's sights. Kite lightly pulls the trigger and blasts a whole right through the droids center of mass. Setting the husk on fire with his Combustive Protocol. He holds position at the back of the group (edited)
Stormchaser 07/05/2020 07:09
The droids roll forward on their tracks, two of them spraying gouts of plasma at Testy and Barin. The Balosar quickly leaps out of the way, but Test is not so lucky and takes the brunt of the burning wave. Another pair emerge out of the darkness, launching devastating plasma bolts across a seemingly bottomless drop at Barin and Zed.
RisenZed 07/05/2020 16:20
Zed drops to a knee as he takes the plasma bolt directly to the chest. His armor heats quickly, and he can feel the skin beneath begin to crackle and burn. He steadies himself, takes aim, and fires back at the droid, but the blaster bolt zings past as the droid slides out of the way. By instinct, Zed cries out, "Medic!"
Stormchaser 07/05/2020 17:01
Barin yelps in surprise and pain as the droids harry him and Testy with plasma, shooting an errant blaster bolt off behind him as he dashes back around the corner. It's a glancing hit, but a hit nonetheless.
toddmoonbounce 07/05/2020 17:42
Rolling out from any semblance of cover she could get from the cavern wall, Adorhi pulls up her pistol and takes a couple shots towards the mining droids now turned aggressors. The first hits its mark, and with a seemingly extra bit of force as it catches the droid off guard. Now aware of the new threat, the droid is able to avoid the second round from Adorhi's pistol. Out of options for now, she tucks back behind the cavern wall hoping to escape from the droids' memory, if only until she sees another opening at attack.
hugehuman 07/05/2020 19:18
Shorlu darts around the corner, backing up Zed. He quickly takes stock of the situation, seeing that a number of their group was already seriously injured, and focuses on Testy, nearly surrounded by the attacking droids. "Test! Knock down the rubble!" It was a hasty plan, but it might just kill two mynocks with one shot: if a rockslide occurred, it could damage the droids, and hamper their attempts to get closer. He raised his blaster to help get the droids off Test for the idea to work, but couldn't split his careful attention between Test and the droid behind him, missing.
Drake | Emperor 07/05/2020 20:54
It's gonna get bright real fast!" Gauss shouts while running forward, launching an impact flash bomb from his wristpad to the other side of of the pit, "Flash out!" In an instant, a bright light, followed by an ear-piercing sound, fill the tunnel, blinding the sensors of the three closest droids to the explosion. Immediately after, Gauss hurls a kolto pack at Testy, which bursts into a healing mist. "I have your back Testy, throw those clankas into the pit!"
Rick Fisto 07/05/2020 21:08
Shielding his eyes from the flash bomb and toggling his blade off, Testy grunts with effort as he pushes one of the droid's over the edge of the pit into the blackness. Pain lances through his shoulder as his tender flesh presses against the cold durasteel of the droid. Wish I could do this the way Haspin used to...with his mind.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 07/05/2020 22:00
Kite rushes around the bend and sees the bright flash of light go off temporarily blinding his scope. He shakes his head and whips his rifle around and targets the droid that Adorhi is blasting with her twin pistols and lines up another shot center of mass and blasts through it. He then taps on his data pad and syncs up a kolto pack for Zed and throws it over to him shouting Can't let you get roasted alive by the offbrand Clankas, us clones have a reputation to uphold.
Stormchaser 07/05/2020 22:08
Two of the droids close on Testy, extending whirring buzz saws on tool arms in front of them. However, Test is too quick for them, even slicing the saw off the front of the first. The blinded droids remain stationary as they reboot their photoreceptors and from behind them two more appear out of the darkness, launching further bolts of plasma at Testy. A glancing hit scorches him, but in his trance-like state he shrugs it off.
RisenZed 07/05/2020 22:26
Zed catches the kolto pack and jams it into his chest, under his armor. The cooling surge of fast-acting medicine bolsters him, and as the pain leaves his mind, the combat instinct floods back in. Test engaging two contacts, two more within close range. Move to support. He sprints up behind Testy, placing a hand on his brother's back so he knows he's there, and doesn't slice Zed's head off with the lightsaber. Zed takes two quick shots at the droids across the seemingly-bottomless gap, damaging one. The second bolt strikes a unarmored part of the droid and with a small plume of smoke, its lights and photoreceptors go dark.
Stormchaser 07/05/2020 22:28
Barin presses himself against the rock, remaining out of sight until he dares take another shot, but the blaster bolt flies high over the top of his target. The Balosar curses and fishes a stimpack from his jacket, jamming it into his thigh.
toddmoonbounce 07/05/2020 22:49
Seeing Barin fall against the wall in a fury of pain next to her gives Adorhi a quick bit of twisted satisfaction given the wonderful situation this stoopa put her in. But quickly that fades and the frustration floods back in and stands in the way of her aim. Two more shots from her pistol, both coming up short. She rolls back against the cavern wall and takes a long look towards the way they came in. Do it, Adorhi, just leave this mess. (edited)
hugehuman 07/05/2020 23:16
Shorlu watches with mild surprise as Testy, having expected the sudden flash, instead opts to shoulder check the droid adjacent to him instead. He suddenly remembers a crucial fact: these guys were clone troopers. They'd likely been working as a squad as far back as they could remember. It'd take more time together before they started listening to his half-baked plans over their own strategies. He spares a brief glance at Adorhi, wondering how she fit in with this squadâ€”if she even did. His mind moving a mile a minute, Shorlu performs a cooling flush, then aims at the droid once more, scrutinizing it with his gaze. He wasn't an expert on droids per se, but he could start to see the patterns of its movements and attacks. He fires into the melee once more, a bit more accurately, but only grazing its armored exterior, doing no lasting damage.
Drake | Emperor 08/05/2020 01:58
Spotting a small group of droids directly on the other side of the pit, Gauss slips behind Shorlu, attempting to get a better shot, charging the bowcaster's spread shot. "Now, lets see how this spread fire setting works" he thinks to himself. Aiming between the two droids, the bowcaster makes a loud brruzzt sending several high powered bolts flying towards the droids, the attached power belt quickly cycling a new power cell. However, having not fired the weapon like this before, Gauss miss-judged his aim, missing both droids, blowing huge chunks into the walls and floor of the tunnel. "Kriff, lucky droids..." "Go for center mass Testy!" he exclaims to his brother, as several droids start to surround him. (edited)
Rick Fisto 08/05/2020 13:03
The droids melt away and are replaced by geonosians in Testy's mind. Deeper in the mines and still no sign of Haspin. He and his brothers are all surrounded now. The Geonosians are as think as Corellian molasses. The stout, vibrating blade in Testy's hands flashes out, severing bony limbs as the scent of burning flesh--of freedom--fills his nostrils. His brothers' blaster fire rings out in a continuous blaze, but the Geonosians are coming too quickly. Then he feels a hand on his back and the flash of an extending lightsaber. Haspin's finally made it. They fight back-to-back, the five of them. A few minutes later, they stand alone in a small depression of corpses, walled in by the vanquished, and collapse together as one, still back-to back. "What took you so long?" Testy asks Haspin. Oh, your mother and I had a previous engagement." Haspin replies, the grin on his face visible in the sound of his reply. Unconscious of the current threat, Testy's humming blade slices through the next droid as Zed's hand touches his back, indicating his presence. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 08/05/2020 14:25
Kite runs forward ejecting his rifles power cell as he runs and jamming a new one in once he gets into position. He sees that Testy is still being harried by one of the droids he then raises his rifle and takes aim at one of the pesky clankas. He begins to pull the trigger but his HUD display targeting protocol lets him know that shot would fail to hit the droid so he slightly adjusts his shot and pulls the trigger catching the droid center mass and bringing it down.
Stormchaser 08/05/2020 15:38

The remaining two mining bots send burning waves sweeping over the two frontmost clones, who drop to the ground as they succumb to their wounds.
15:44
Once more, Barin pops out of the shadows behind Adorhi, this time placing an unexpectedly effective blaster bolt. There's a loud band and the rearmost droid grinds to a halt with a puff of smoke.
toddmoonbounce 08/05/2020 16:20
Shaking her desire to run, Adorhi again rolls out from the corner of the cavern to take another shot. The sight of two of the clones down rattles her. One more than the other, at least. Testy and his big ego, his pride for killing their leader. Making a point that Haspin was Togruta, and using Adorhi's native tongue, a slap in her face. Throwing around his lightsaber like some hot shot; likely a compensation for his own shortcomings. She'd never find a way to let her guard down with him. But Zed. Adorhi liked Zed. The only one so far who seemed to give her a fair chance, who seemed to understand that she was a complete outsider to the rest of the group. The only one she would've, and did, tell about the Starworm. Kite, Mr. Tactical Droid himself, didn't seem to be able to read an emotional situation outside of a training sim even if it hit him in the face. Gauss. Gauss wasn't bad, just a little stiff sometimes. And Shorlu, not a buckethead, although maybe that would've been better as you might know what you're getting. On her own, she'd have been careful. But once again, she was helpless. Thrown into this group of others and with no way to help her fallen counterpart. Her shot goes wide...
hugehuman 08/05/2020 17:30
As he sees Testy and Zed go down, Shorlu redoubles his efforts. Though he hadn't known them as long as he had Rider, he knows he'd need everyone's help to even have a chance at getting him out. He hones his focus on the previously damaged droid, using its predictable movements to line up a shot straight to its core, finishing it. Knowing they'd retaliate, he takes several steps back out of precaution, but running is the furthest thing from his mind. (edited)
Drake | Emperor 08/05/2020 20:29

Drake | Emperor 08/05/2020 22:51

hugehuman 08/05/2020 23:05
"Eh, in my experience, it's not the size of the blaster, it's how ya use it." He chuckles a little at the innuendo in his kernel of wisdom, before yanking out a particularly stubborn part, recognizing it as a plasma cell. "Speaking of blasters, Happy Life Day." He tosses some plasma cells around to anyone who wants them, keeping one for himself. He then indicates a couple of heavy armaments mounted on the droids, easily detached. "These babies still work. Just gotta do a little retooling, if you're up to it. This pachyderm needs a break." He stretches his short limbs and sits on a bit of rubble for a rest.
RisenZed 08/05/2020 23:41
Zed yanks the makeshift blaster cannon off the droid and hefts it. It was a heavy, unwieldy thing -- but serviceable. He loads a power cell into it and checks the charge. Levels look good. This thing looks like garbage, but it could pack a punch. He gets to work on the rifle, removing the shoddy integration patch extra bits of soldering. "I'm with Shorlu. Let's take a bit of a rest, then continue on our way. Keep your eyes and ears up, though. Don't want any of those Sable shabuire to catch us flat-footed."
hugehuman 09/05/2020 10:16
Shorlu's gaze was drawn back to the lightsaber when Kite remarked on it. He'd noticed it before, in more tense situations like the one just now, but only now did he fully consider how odd it was for him to be carrying it around. "So, where in the kriffin' hell did you get that from, anyway?" He says in reference to it, while dimming his glowrod. "Rider could probably use a laser sword himself, maybe he wouldn't get grabbed so easily." He opted for the colloquial term, though he had learned quite some time ago that they were actually called lightsabers.
Rick Fisto 09/05/2020 16:42

toddmoonbounce 09/05/2020 16:56

Rick Fisto 09/05/2020 17:06
Twisting his head up to look at Adorhi while his face twisted with emotion, his eyes reddening, Test responds. "How did he die? He died in confusion. He died a hero. A hero confused by why his friends were betraying him.". Switching to Togruta, he adds "Because we were following orders." Testy spits and gets up in frustration, going over to the cave wall and punching it hard enough to draw blood.
toddmoonbounce 09/05/2020 17:08

Rick Fisto 09/05/2020 17:13
"We were the kriffinest best soldiers in the kriffin' Galaxy!" Testy shouts back at her in Togruta, pointing his bloody hand at her. "I wish he had been faster! Fast enough to kill a bunch of lousy test-tube-grown, motherless son's of bitches. But we were kriffin' good. And kriffin' cowards!"
Stormchaser 09/05/2020 17:16
Testy hits the rock wall with a resounding crack and a small portion crumbles away, leaving a palm-sized hole that reveals a hollow space on the far side. (edited)
RisenZed 09/05/2020 17:18
Zed drops his rifle and intercedes himself between Testy and Adorhi in perhaps a futile attempt to hold his much-stronger brother back, should he choose to do something rash. He looks at Adorhi. "We were tricked," Zed says. "We were pawns in a much larger game." (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 09/05/2020 17:29
Kite grimaces under his helm after Testy barks out that the traitor died a hero. He almost lets it go until Zed add on that they were tricked. Kite jumps to his feet and removes his helmet and breaks his usual monotone speaking pattern and shouts "The only deceivers were the jedi. They orchestrated the whole war, in a bid to take over the Republic and turn it into a jedi run theocracy. Fortunately the Chancellor was able to see through their lies. We were made to serve the Republic not the traitors, we didn't just follow orders we did our duty to the Republic itself." He looks like he is going to continue until he sees that Testy's blow left a hole in the cavern wall revealing a hollow space. He places his helmet back on and moves to look at the hole
RisenZed 09/05/2020 17:31
"What Republic?" Zed says. "It's gone. The chancellor wanted power, and the Jedi were in the way. He orchestrated the war, not the Jedi." Adorhi and Shorlu can easily tell that this conversation has been had before between the clones, in more or less the same way.
Stormchaser 09/05/2020 17:32
Through the gap in the rock, Kite spots some kind of metallic silver container. It's engraved with #43. With a little more firepower, it should be possible to enlarge the gap. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 09/05/2020 17:35

17:38

Rick Fisto 09/05/2020 17:42

RisenZed 09/05/2020 17:44
Zed sighs. He was never going to get through to Kite. The Chancellor had used his own power that he had convinced the senate to give him to make himself the emperor. He never surrendered his emergency powers. And as for Dooku leading the seppies, Haspin had said that Dooku was one of the Lost 20, or something like that. As for Testy's comment, Zed didn't have any grand ideas about what kind of system would have been better for the people of the galaxy. But he knew it wasn't this one. The Empire was cruel on its best days, and probably genocidal on its worst.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 09/05/2020 17:48

Rick Fisto 09/05/2020 17:55

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 09/05/2020 18:08

He sighs and says "We killed a traitor at the behest of the Supreme commander of the GAR. But I don't want to fight with you brother I choose to run with the squad vs staying in the Empire. We've all made our choices, keeping each other and the squad alive is all that we can do now" (edited)
RisenZed 09/05/2020 18:10
Kite and Test's debate brings it flashing back to Zed's mind. His holocomm beeps. A hooded figure appears. "The time has come, sergeant. Execute Order 66." And mechanically, he replies, "Yes, sir." Only after it had already happened, did they stop to think about it. It ate him up inside every time he thought about how quickly they had acted. They were good soldiers. But whatever scheme the now-emperor had plotted had torn them apart. Now, we brandish lightsabers in the faces of scared children just trying to get medical supplies. Some soldiers we are. (edited)
hugehuman 09/05/2020 18:11
Shorlu was a bit taken abackâ€”he wouldn't have guessed the wounds that he'd be opening up here. Whatever had been going on between the GAR and the Jedi Order, the details hadn't been made public; all he knew was that the Jedi usually led the clones on the battlefield, right up until it was announced that they had attempted some sort of coup, trying to assassinate Palpatine. Had he still been at IntSec, maybe he would've had access to more details... but here were people who'd lived it right in front of him, a stellar opportunity! (edited)

hugehuman 09/05/2020 18:26

Brothers in arms don't just up and turn on each other because of orders, I know that for sure. The entire clone army had been very quick and unanimous in hunting down the Jedi they'd been serving less than a day ago.
RisenZed 09/05/2020 18:33

Stormchaser 09/05/2020 18:50

Drake | Emperor 09/05/2020 19:12
As Testy pulls out the container, Gauss sees the faint light coming from the crystals that were behind it. He moves closer to them, a faint memory of Haspin appears in his mind. Haspin had often meditated alone in his room on their assigned Venator cruiser, one time Gauss came to inform him on information about a mission they were on. The Jedi had been slowly deconstructing and reconstructing his lightsaber, to Gauss, it seemed to be how the jedi kept maintenance on their sophisticated weapons. He saw a small blue crystal floating in the air, before being slotted into the hilt of the saber. "Hey, these crystals that were behind the container resemble the ones used within the lightsabers of the jedi." Gauss says as he slowly recalls the past. "I'm not sure what they used them for, but they did seem important to them." (edited)
hugehuman 09/05/2020 21:20

Shorlu says this last sentence with an overdone, sarcastic parody of McCarthy's thick accent. He spits on the ground.
toddmoonbounce 09/05/2020 21:22

Stormchaser 09/05/2020 21:57
"My friends, I do believe that we have stumbled across one of Salovan Fische's hidden caches!" Barin declares with a broad grin, eagerly wringing his hands. "Not the Fell Star, but hopefully still something valuable or useful. Shall we open it?"
Drake | Emperor 09/05/2020 22:00

Rick Fisto 09/05/2020 22:23

Drake | Emperor 09/05/2020 22:32
"Let's check it for any surprises first" Gauss remarks to Testly before having a look-over the box. After a short amount of time he finds explosives strapped to the underside of the container, latched to the lid of the container, which sets them off when opened. "We got explosives. Zed, wanna exercise your demo expert muscles? They are located on the underside, hooked to the seal. The rest of us should stand a safe distance away, just in case." (edited)
RisenZed 10/05/2020 02:51
Zed pulls out his bomb disposal kit and goes to work. He carefully removes the outer plating of what was essentially an anti-personnel fragmentation mine, leaving magnetic strips on each of the four corners, as to not detonate any anti-tampering failsafes. Swiftly and assuredly, he begins to work on the internal wiring, removing components from the actual explosive, which was a small detonite charge surrounded by metal shrapnel. "This is pre-Clone Wars era junk," Zed says. "Even the droids had better bombs than this." In a few minutes, the bomb is disarmed and the box is ready for opening. "Easy," Zed says, dusting his hands off. The bomb defusal was actually less stressful than the conversation they had been having.
Rick Fisto 10/05/2020 06:38
As Testy holds the light for Zed and hands him tools, Testy quietly says, "Hey, brother. I appreciate what you were doing back there, but you know I wouldn't hurt someone over an insult or because I got hot under the collar, right? Adorhi might be a moof milker sometimes, but she's one of us for now. And even if she wasn't...well, that's not the kind of man I am. Anyway, sorry for getting heated." Testy lets out a little laugh. "She really does get under my skin though."
RisenZed 10/05/2020 15:21
"I didn't for a second think that you would do anything like that," Zed says while he works. "But I wanted to make sure that she knew that, you know?" There's a few moments of silence before Zed speaks again. "You know, I think that he'd be proud of how you've taken up his saber."
toddmoonbounce 10/05/2020 17:50
Stepping up to the metal container, ignoring the thick tension towards her from the two clones, Adorhi pulls out her tools and prepares to do her thing. "I'll take your not stepping back as trust in your work, Zed," she says with a dry smile. "Let's see what's in box number 1!"
RisenZed 10/05/2020 17:59

Stormchaser 10/05/2020 18:29
With a couple of helpful tips from Shorlu, Adorhi's deft hands make quick work of the aging mechanism. There's a soft click and then a hiss as the container decompresses, releasing a chilly puff of centuries old air as the top swings open. It looks like some kind of cryogenic storage unit, which explains the coolant leaking from the back. Inside, a series of pen-style injector vials are arrayed in a grid of vertical chambers. Those on the right hand side look oddly discoloured, but six on the left end of the case appear to have survived, along with what look like three energy shield type devices.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 10/05/2020 18:48
Kite sees the loot letting go of some of the earlier tension and remembers that the number 43 was on the crate. He says "Lets keep our eyes peeled, the crate had 43 written on it so there may be more scattered around the area"
hugehuman 10/05/2020 19:19
Shorlu compares the stuff in the vials to the slime leaking out, realizing that the medicine must've had some chemical reaction. He gently pries the crystals off of the wall and places them in a small container. "Like I said, no Fell Star, but they might be worth something." He remembered a pretty amusing case he had in his old career, the client being a rather ditzy Coruscanti celebrity who got swindled for fake diamonds. He then looks over to Barin. "There's seriously at least fourty-two more of these things in these tunnels?"
Stormchaser 10/05/2020 19:21

Stormchaser 10/05/2020 20:20

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 11/05/2020 15:18

Sable may be working to restart the order or at least establish themselves as a new sect of force users Kite clenches his fist and swears to himself that will not happen. "We should move out, with the confirmation that Fische actually has jedi relics, we can't allow them to fall into Sables hands."
Stormchaser 11/05/2020 18:02
Barin leads the group on through the tunnels and after another hour or so the passage opens up into into a large natural cavern that extends off into the darkness. The air here is still and motes of dust float lazily through the air. Though the atmosphere is still breathable this far from the dubious comforts of the shadowport, the temperature is near-freezing, and the gravitational pull of the comet is low. A series of dark chasms abut the path, one to each side, their depths lost in darkness. Footing along the meandering path is treacherous and the ceiling is high and cracks and crevices give it the appearance of a rocky moonscape. "Ghorus spoke of this place," Barin murmurs, "Fische's legacy should be on the far side."
RisenZed 11/05/2020 19:00
"Nice place," Zed says, scanning for signs of movement. "Pirates always pick the nicest places to bury treasure."
hugehuman 11/05/2020 19:07
Shorlu sighs, his breath becoming visible in the frigid air, but is clearly not bothered by the cold. The shadowport proper was bad enough, but this place really gave him the creeps. "I've got my reservations about following some geriatric pirate's directions, but I'll credit him for knowing about the caches."
Stormchaser 11/05/2020 20:35
Just as the group pass the half-way point along the path, two bulbous creatures the size of a man emerge from the shadows. Five spindly legs sprout from their bodies and a single mouth surrounded by five jagged beaks and five black spots flexes open and closed menacingly. They leap at Kite, snapping viciously at him, but the clone's reactions are too fast.
Rick Fisto 11/05/2020 21:49
Testy, always alert for danger, sees the movement of chitinous limbs gathering to propel hideous spider-like bodies towards his brother. Shouting, knowing it is to late to effectively warn him, Testy brings his already-lit saber down in a swinging arc severing one of the many legs from the closest beast as it tries to strike Kite. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 11/05/2020 22:03

With a squeeze of the firing stud, the industrial cannon jumps back into his shoulder, releasing a destructive blast of yellow energy. It manages to steady itself, much to Zeds chagrin.
Stormchaser 11/05/2020 22:10

toddmoonbounce 11/05/2020 22:21

Stormchaser 11/05/2020 22:29
The mynocks swarm the group on the narrow pathway, slashing with razor sharp claws and battering with their wings as they fly by.
22:33
Barin runs for the cover of the tunnel ahead, shooting wildly over his shoulder at the mynocks as he goes.
hugehuman 11/05/2020 23:01

Stormchaser 13/05/2020 22:15
"It can't be far," the Balosar replies, "this way!" Barin leads the group on through the winding tunnels, occasionally stopping to sniff the air or take a fork. Finally, they turn a corner into a vaulted cavern, in the centre of which sits a single durasteel cargo crate labelled #128. The mummified remains of two Humans, seemingly locked in eternal battle, are the only occupants of the tomb-like chamber. (edited)
Rick Fisto 13/05/2020 22:18
"Well that's ominous."
hugehuman 14/05/2020 06:59
Shorlu cautiously steps forward into the room, and begins to look around. This place was starting to remind him of one of those cheesy holo-serials. What was it called again? Mon'taana Jos and the Palace of Death? Hardly the time for reminiscing anyway. He approaches the cargo crate, and looks it over.
hugehuman 14/05/2020 07:07
Shorlu inspects the container. "This was trapped before, but someone else took it apart. I'm gonna open it."
Rick Fisto 14/05/2020 07:20
"Careful. You don't want to end up like those Sith in Ides'dahoe J'onzz."
Stormchaser 14/05/2020 11:09
The door slides open with the rusty creak of metal on metal. Inside sits another long dead corpse leant up against the door. It tumbles backwards onto the stone outside as the door slides aside. Its stiff withered hands clutch a seven-pointed silver star studded with blue stones to its breast. Barin's eyes go wide and he immediately begins heading for the trinket.
11:11
Inside the container, a true fortune has been stashed. Twenty bars of gold and silver bullion are stacked besides a number of hermetically sealed casks.
RisenZed 14/05/2020 14:56
"I'm going to go ahead and assume," Zed says, pointing at the star in the corpse grasp, "That that's what we're looking for."
Rick Fisto 14/05/2020 15:25

Stormchaser 14/05/2020 16:40
Barin jerks to an abrupt half as the lightsaber swings out in front him. "What's the big idea?" He asks, starting to edge around it.

Stormchaser 14/05/2020 18:52
Only a thin covering of leathery skin remains on the bones of the aging corpses. They wear a mix of what might have once been pirate clothing and light armour. One clutches a crusty blaster pistol with a half-charged power pack, the other a vibroblade with a dead power pack. They also carry a couple of glow rods and a liquid cable dispenser.
toddmoonbounce 14/05/2020 18:56

She then turns towards the corpse, pulls out her dagger, and uses it to snatch the relic by the chain from the lifeless hands. toddmoonbounce 14/05/2020 20:01
Adorhi watches the clones and ortolan drool over the spoils like bonegnawer's on a pack of womp rats. Amateurs, she thinks to herself, slowing yourself down is the last thing you want to do when making an extraction. You take what you came for, and get out. If a return trip seems worth it, then you figure that out later. Adorhi almost never made a return trip. It wasn't worth it. The repeat business of her employers was where the real financial gain laid. She looked over at Barin and was pretty confident he was having the same thoughts. "Ready?" she said to the Balosar, patting the pouch with their prize, while giving a head nod towards the way out.
