20:37
His head spins. He is somehow perceiving voices...voices appearing to be associated with the Fell Star. The object was supposedly associated with the Force somehow. And earlier today he had been arguing about the legacy of the Jedi and how he had killed his friend, one of that order, and he had, seemingly by chance, lashed out in frustration at the cavern wall, finding equipment...finding lightsaber crystals, apparently. Haspin always spoke of the Force working in mysterious ways and guiding destiny. He had always thought Haspin had been a little deluded on that score, especially after what they had done to him. That was Haspin's destiny? But this...this was beginning to overwhelm his doubts. (edited)
RisenZed 14/05/2020 20:43

Maybe take on the Empire itself, he thinks. He shakes his head at his naiveite. Don't be stupid, old man. No amount of money will get this squad to fight the Empire. Not with how mixed their loyalties were these days.

Stormchaser 14/05/2020 22:24
The trek back through the mines takes well over an hour, and Adorhi is nowhere to be seen as she and Barin forge ahead until they arrive at the exit back into the Fissures. The strange silence here seems out of place. The air smells of the cooking fires of the Fissures District's residents, but no signs of life can be heard in the darkness. It's as if the area ahead has been cleared of all indigenous life. Either that, or they're hiding.
toddmoonbounce 14/05/2020 22:35
As they come to the exit of the mines, Adorhi blinks away the drastic change in lighting. Her instincts kick in to use caution while exiting and she is quickly reaffirmed why it was a common practice of hers. Something felt very off about the Fissures. She scans the area looking for anything, while also feeling for any movement within range.
Stormchaser 15/05/2020 12:11
Barin casts a furtive glance at Adorhi, noticing the distinct lack of life. When they left the Fissures were filled with Point Nadir's destitute denizens. Now nobody can be heard talking. There are no children crying and no footfalls other than those of the two thieves.
toddmoonbounce 15/05/2020 16:17
Keeping tight to the cavern exit, she can't help but feel something is amiss among the silence. One disguise kit and two of them. Probably not much help there, she thinks to herself. She begins to plot a course between the darkest and tightest rows and alleys of the shanty town towards the more established structures of the Arcade. She turns to Barin and in a whisper says, "Quiet and quick. If we can get to the Souk, the crowds might offer some cover until those bucketheads can catch up. Any other thoughts?"
Stormchaser 15/05/2020 16:34

Stormchaser 15/05/2020 16:55

toddmoonbounce 15/05/2020 17:20

Rick Fisto 15/05/2020 22:51

Stormchaser 15/05/2020 23:11

Testy abruptly finds himself locked in place and unable to move. Blaster fire flares out of the dark, but it seems the Force is with Testy this day and it merely impacts the wall behind him.
Stormchaser 15/05/2020 23:19

hugehuman 15/05/2020 23:56
Shorlu starts creeping down the street quietly, ready to try for a counter-ambush, but moments later, he hears the telltale sounds of blaster fire. No doubt something went awry, not too surprising. Before he can heed Test's directive, a bright flash of something (lightning?) issues from around the corner. He spares a brief moment to gawk with surprise, before hearing blaster fire coming from Testy's direction. Figuring he'd been jumped too, Shorlu hurries to his aid. When he sees him standing stock still, he realizes he's somehow been paralyzed. Shorlu calls out to him, "Focus on one limb! The rest'll follow!" It was a good tip for shrugging off the effects of poison. Little did he know, this was a power far beyond something so mundane.

Rick Fisto 16/05/2020 06:45
Testy loses feeling in his body which goes rigid, as if someone else is controlling it. As blaster shots speed toward him, just missing, he thinks to himself that the force seems to be calling him to destiny today, and is protecting him from harm, even. But this Jedi wannabe is twisting the force to his will...twisting it away from what it seems to want. Haspin always said that, although not as flashy as the dark side, the light side of the force was more powerful than many suspected, because using the light side of the force involved at least some surrender to what the force was trying to accomplish anyway. It was like running with the wind. It didn't feel like you were running as fast as when you ran against the wind, but that was only a trick played by your mind. An artifact of your own point of view. Testy concentrated on the lack of feeling and willed himself to once again feel his body. And all of a sudden, he did. Like a dislocated bone popping back into it's socket, his body slammed back into his mind--painful at the first instant, but right and true. "Focus on one limb! The rest will follow!" he hears Shorlu shout as his feelings return. I agree heartily, he thinks to himself as he focuses on parting a limb from this fellow's frame. After all, he was willing to bet the Force was cool with that. (edited)
Stormchaser 16/05/2020 09:00
Out of the darkness, Testy feels a tendril of darkness wrap itself around his brain, drawing the strength from his limbs and sapping him of the will to fight. The black-clothed man opposite him strikes rapidly with hands and feet, but he's expecting Testy to still be rooted in place and the clone is able to move aside in time.
09:02

toddmoonbounce 16/05/2020 17:51
Amidst the scramble away by Barin and his pursuers, Adorhi thinks she hears continued engagement back towards the center of the court. She could catch Barin, sure, but it would be no good with another bolt of lightning to the back. She instead runs along the rock wall coming around the corner to see one more ambusher duking it out with Testy. Apparently still shaking off the earlier blast, her first shot misses its target. With a slow and deep breath, refocusing, she lines up another at the back of this pile of bantha fodder's head. The hint of a groan, quickly snuffed out by the loss of life, followed by a heavy thud of the corpse to the ground. With seemingly no further sense of other threats, awareness floods back into Adorhi's mind. She replaces her pistol in its holster and instinctively puts a hand on the pouch with the Fell Star. Nothing. Barin. Filled with a rage she has not known in such a long time, she yells out as loud as she can in Togruta towards the clone. "Test!" Funny, the nick name Testy. It was so appropriate for him, Adorhi thought. He always seemed to be put off by the simplest of things. But did it fit because she perceived him that way, or did the name actually only contribute to that perception. With what Barin just did, any fraction of loyalty that might've been there to begin with was now gone. Shattered. Unrepariable. But with Test and these clones. She respected his loyalty to the others, which possibly included an ounce towards her. They'd never understand why this situation was so difficult for her, but she had to admit that that wasn't a reason to not give them some sort of a chance. Or respect. Test, not Testy. "Test," she echoes once more, still at the top of her lungs, "Barin stole the Star."

Zed sprints, trying to catch up with Testy and Barin. He levels his blaster pistol at the balosar. "Barin, STOP!" he shouts. "If you stop running and give the kriffing thing back, you won't be harmed. Test, put the weapon away."
hugehuman 18/05/2020 18:06
Shorlu continues running, huffing and puffing a bit. This was definitely the most exercise he'd had in a 24-hour period in... months? Years? But he wouldn't even dream of complaining. He loved it. He lived for the thrill of adventure. Breaking out a person of interest, spelunking and finding pirate gold, nearly dying, in some ways this was even more intense than his detective days. The clones weren't bad, though Kite seemed a little single-minded at times, and Testy seemed to be keeping more than a few things bottled up. Again, Adorhi stuck out a bit, and he wondered about her past, and her history with Barin. As he turns to reiterate his question though, he sees her darting ahead at nearly twice his speed without a word. "Hey! You could at least gimme a hint, Maker-dammit!" (edited)
Drake | Emperor 18/05/2020 19:45
As the extremely winded Testy sprints by Gauss, he throws him the last kolto pack he has in Testy's direction. As Barin clambers up the shack, Gauss stops a couple dozen yards from him, flips a switch on his bowcaster, readying a stun bolt to fire on the balosaur if he continues to run. "Stop running!" He yells in Barin's direction. (edited)
Rick Fisto 18/05/2020 19:47
Testy slices open the bag in mid air, the spray bathing over him like jumping through a mountain waterfall, breathing new life into his lungs.
toddmoonbounce 18/05/2020 21:25
Catching up to the others, Adorhi spots Barin just getting over the edge of a nearby roof. "No more running, stoopa," she says in clenched teeth. Pulling out her pistol, reluctantly setting it to stun, she fires off a shot. It hits and Barin falters but doesn't go down. In frustration at his resilience, she shouts to the two clones nearby with weapons trained on the Balosar. "Take him down!" She then begins scanning the area for the quickest way up to Barin.
RisenZed 18/05/2020 22:08
At Adorhi's shout, Zed squeezes the trigger of his pistol. The blue concentric circles of the stun blast catch Barin in the chest and the balosar drops to the ground with a heavy thud. Zed immediately whirls around to face back the way they had come, waiting for any of the ambushers to show themselves.
Drake | Emperor 18/05/2020 22:08
At the behest of Adorhi, Gauss discharges his weapon immediately after Zed, the sonically enhanced bolt sings through the air smashing into Barin, further knocking him unconscious after Zed's shot knocked him out. (edited)
Stormchaser 18/05/2020 22:16
Barin stumbles, turning to look back at Adorhi in confusion as her shot catches him in the back. "...Adorhi? Why?" The words barely leave the Balosar's lips before Zed's stun ray takes him in the chest and he crumples atop the roof. (edited)
RisenZed 18/05/2020 22:18

Rick Fisto 18/05/2020 22:20
Testy drops the make-shift gold bundle and stows his chakram as he waves Adorhi over, making a cradle with his hands to boost her up to the roof as he keeps watch for pursuers.
Drake | Emperor 18/05/2020 22:21
Gauss spins around, slowly walking backwards towards where Barin fell, searching for any more hostiles.
hugehuman 18/05/2020 22:21
"Wait a sec, wait a sec," Shorlu sputters between breaths. "I don't even know why we're shooting him in the first place."
toddmoonbounce 18/05/2020 22:31
"I'll use a boost to get through," Adorhi says to the clone reflexively in Togruta. "Good idea, Test." With a slight skip and step into his clasped hands, she uses his assist to push off and get on the roof. Standing over Barin, she almost shivers at what she was about to do. A dirty move by even the lowest of thieves, but with recent events seemed that much more necessary. She kneels down, takes the Fell Star off of Barin and replaces it to her pouch, tightly securing the latch. Now in basic, Adorhi says to the others,"I'd love to kick this pile of druk off the roof, but probably not the best of ideas. Thoughts on getting him down?"
RisenZed 18/05/2020 23:54

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 19/05/2020 00:10
Kite runs up with Shorlu checking behind him for signs of pursuit. Seeing Adorhi over Berin's body, he grimaces thinking I can't believe they gunned him down. He then hears Adorhi's remarks about getting him off the building. He breathes a sigh of relief thinking at least he is still alive. We gave our word, the Squad can't be both deserters and oathbreakers Kite then coldly remarks "That wasn't necessary. We had eyes on him, and he wasn't trying to duck us. And starting a secondary firefight while we were under attack by those force freaks was beyond di'kutla." "Prello contracted us in part to bring back her prize thief. Gunning him down isn't going to win us any favors with a Hutt who was actually willing to pay to protect her people." Kite then throws Adorhi his set of binders, takes a deep breath and refocusing himself and says "Lets get him bound and get out of here. No use crying over what's already happened. And we need to move before Sable calls in reinforcements." He checks his wrist pad and says" If we need him conscious my armor has enough charge to power another kolto pack" (edited)

The spray of healing fluid settles over the Balosar like morning dew and Barin awakes with a sudden gasp of air. RisenZed 19/05/2020 17:13

Stormchaser 19/05/2020 17:17

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 19/05/2020 17:27

RisenZed 19/05/2020 17:27

Stormchaser 19/05/2020 17:43
Bit by bit the Fissures grow ever more populated as the group heads away from the mines. By the time they're nearing the Souk, the poor and the destitute hover once more on every corner. However, the usually bright and gregarious Barin is downtrodden, depressed and resolute in his innocence. "What am I even supposed to have stolen?" He demands. "You all have your loot and I sure as hell don't have the star. It's right there in Adorhi's pouch, right?" (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 19/05/2020 17:46
Kite turns his head to the man and looks at him through his mandalorian helmet. Trying to see if he is bluffing or honestly doesn't remember what happened. Kite asks "run us through what you remember happening during the fight with Sable" Kite intently watches him as he gives his answer.
Stormchaser 19/05/2020 19:17
"Uh, Tails and I went ahead," Barin begins. "She sensed four of them waiting for us and stopped me from running into a trap. Then we went back to the rest of you. Tails and Kite went to spring the trap, then all hell broke loose. There was fire on all sides, then a big flash of light and sparks by Adorhi. I went to see if she was alright and she'd been knocked out, so I jabbed her with one of the old stims! Then we made a run for it and you bucketheads started shooting at me!"
RisenZed 19/05/2020 19:21
"You missed the part where you lifted the star from Adorhi's pocket," Zed says. "Just keep moving. We'll talk more when we get to the ship." More like if we get to the ship, Zed thinks, glancing around for anyone following them. He doesn't pick up on any tails, so he focuses on getting back to the ship. This was all very confusing. Did Barin really not remember lifting the star? If that was true, what caused him to do that? What kind of Jedi mind trick was being pulled on them. Haven't been this confused since I stepped out of the growing vats, Zed thinks to himself.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 19/05/2020 19:39
Kite watches Barin closely as he speaks and notes the inflection, word choice, and Barin's body language as he recounts his story. During his time within the GAR Kite often assisted Haspin in interrogations, Haspin taught Kite how to become adept at spotting the ticks liars generally displayed, or methods operatives used to disguise their lies. Showing Kite how to do this, even without a connection to the force. Kite thinks interrogation is one of the few areas Haspin didn't completely rely on the force. Haspin frequently said in determining a being's fate, its better to have two methods of confirmation vs one. As Barin finishes his story, Kite is nearly stunned and thinks He completely believes what he is saying, this shouldn't be possible. His word choice, body langauge and inflection all mirror someone who feels deeply betrayed and believes he is telling the truth. He must have been mind tricked by Sable Kite opens a head comm channel and says "I'm not sure what's going on but he truly believes what he is saying" (edited)
Stormchaser 19/05/2020 22:08
Moving on through the Souk, the party eventually arrive in the Slips and grab a skiff back to the Katarn's Bane. As they draw closer they can see a figure moving about on top of the ship - their angry neighbour the Gran. (edited)

Drake | Emperor 19/05/2020 22:26

Stormchaser 19/05/2020 22:26

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 19/05/2020 22:27

Stormchaser 19/05/2020 22:32
The Gran is ash in moments, consumed by the ensuing fireball. Immediately chaos erupts all over the cove. Several ships rapidly take off, making for the Jackrab Hole and a siren begins to sound from the Slips.
hugehuman 19/05/2020 22:34
"SON OF A KARKING SCHUTTA!" Shorlu screams at the burning wreckage. He thuds a fist against the side of the skiff. Feeling a mixture of emotions, he settles for a quieter fury. He knew, deep down, that the ship would likely be compromised. He should be glad, really, that Rider wasn't on it. But this was too much for one day. Too. Kriffing. Much.

RisenZed 19/05/2020 22:51
Zed watches the chaos around him. His ears were ringing. His brothers were talking. Barin was sitting down, head in his hands. Eyes unfocused, he looks unblinking at the explosion. His hand hurt. He realized he was squeezing his blaster pistol with a white knuckle grip. It wasn't in his holster, just hanging at his side. He didn't remember drawing it. The explosion had... Zed shakes his head, clearing the ringing noise. Barin's ship, his cousin's dead, talking to Puzzel, we need proof it was Sable. "W-we need to get out of here," Zed says.
hugehuman 19/05/2020 22:56
Shorlu spares one last look at the Katarn's Bane as they turn the skiff and leave the smoldering wreck behind. Five years worth of memories were on it. Not a long time in his four decades of life, but definitely the happiest. He passed a hand over his eyes, and exhaled. He'd had his doubts before, but this was it. Thanks, Sable Dawn. Detective Podobo is back. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 19/05/2020 22:57

hugehuman 19/05/2020 23:09
"Let's take these binders off him. No point to them." Shorlu will do it himself once someone hands him a key, then gets Barin's attention. "We'll get 'em back for this, but we'll need your help. First, while you were at that safe house, did anyone touch your clothes or gear? I want to make sure you weren't bugged, these guys know too much about where we're going and when." His tone is cool, patient, and not accusatory. He affords him all the courtesy he would to the kin of a murder victim, a sort of interrogation he handled often back in the day. With Barin's consent, he'll try to conduct a search of his person. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 19/05/2020 23:09

Rick Fisto 20/05/2020 00:34
"Whoa there. Even if you buy this guy's story, that doesn't mean we can trust him. We don't know how long mind magic works. And what if the Star did it to him? No way is he getting out of those binders yet."
toddmoonbounce 20/05/2020 00:42
As Barin receives the news of his pilot friend, and then of his cousin, Adorhi goes dizzy and then doubles over in pain, falling to her knees with an urge to be sick. She knew the feelings he was undoubtedly having, but she was, impossibly it seemed, actually feeling them herself. It was so much worse having known this pain once before. This feeling of loss. Emptiness. Helplessness. Seeing the clones out the corners of her eyes drove the point home even more. ...Just a young Togruta making a living, if you could call it that, cleaning up after the war. The Separatists and Clones would lay waste to a city and then she would come in and dig out what she could for the highest bidder. If she could get ahead of the battles and save more relics and ancient artifacts though, she stood to gain much more. Enter Daesh'. A bit of a fellow thief, together they cleaned up and cleaned up well. With contacts on both sides, they would gain information on the next strike, the next advancement, and get ahead of it. They were inseparable. A blur of violet between Adorhi's bright blue head tails and montrals and the deep red lekku of Daesh'. Since leaving home, this was the first time Adorhi had begun to feel almost completely whole again. Having someone to share her life with. But war generally doesn't have a happy ending. A job that seemed all so routine, an attack came early. Daesh' was gone... How? Why? What was making her feel the Balosar's anguish? (edited)
hugehuman 20/05/2020 01:41
"You don't have to trust him anymore than you do me, Test. Look at it logically: he hasn't done anything to cross us of his own volition. The only time he did, or even acted shady, was to take the Star, and even then, he still took the time to revive Adorhi, and wanted us to follow him to safety. So long as I can do a thorough search of him, for the reasons I mentioned, he'll be fine." "If it was a Sable Dawn guy somehow controlling him, wouldn't they just have him bring the Star directly to them, not a word to us, let alone healing someone? And if you're worried it's the Star..." Shorlu turns to give Adorhi an inquisitive look. "...You should be talking to the person who still has it. Which reminds me: Adorhi, how'd you know the ship was about to explode?"
Rick Fisto 20/05/2020 06:06
Arguments against and apprehension at Shorlu's plan flee his mind as Test sees Adorhi go down. Extricating himself from between Kite and Shorlu, he goes to one knee, instinctively running his hands over Adorhi looking for a wound. Shrapnel? Sniper? He asks in Togruta, "What's wrong?" (edited)
toddmoonbounce 20/05/2020 20:03
The sense of a hand on her back is just enough to snap Adorhi out of the agonizing emotional state she somehow found herself in. Reflexively, she pulls away from the touch shooting back a glare to it's owner. Seeing Test should have softened the look but a larger concern now washed over her. She takes a step back, making note of everyone and her surroundings, her hand going to the pouch hanging on her belt. "Nothing. I'm fine."
Stormchaser 20/05/2020 21:53
A driver of the skiff swerves violently to avoid the blast and flying shrapnel, and the repulsors wine with the strain as he heads for the Slips at full speed.
hugehuman 20/05/2020 22:11
Shorlu watches the two, folding his arms as the awkward scene played out in front of him. At first, he thought it was Adorhi feigning something to avoid answering his questions once more, but it does seem she was actually dizzy. That wasn't much better, though. "That... didn't look like 'fine' to me. The Fell Star must be messing with your head, like Barin." As he speaks, he leans against the railing of the skiff to brace himself while the pilot whipped it towards the Slips. Shorlu didn't know a lot about the Jedi and their "Force," but there was clearly more than superstition to it. If this artifact had something to do with it all, it might make sense.
Drake | Emperor 21/05/2020 03:31
"Makes me really miss the Jedi, if that thing truly has that kind of power, they would know what to do with it. But alas, they are gone, now we are just left with this band of persistent nerf herders that refuse to let it go, even at the cost of their lives." Gauss says, at hearing Shorlu's remark about the Star messing with minds. "There is no way they were all traitors. Maybe some of them were, maybe some of them weren't, but what i do know is, we could really use their help right about now." he thinks to himself, as he turns back to keep an eye out for any Sable members that might get in their way, again. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 21/05/2020 20:26
Kite stares in disbelief as Shorlu connects the dots between the Fell Star and the strange behavior of Prello's thieves. It can't be true. It shouldn't be possible to change a beings biology and give them the jedi's powers. Kite's hand grips his blaster, knuckles scrapping against his armor. The jedi cannot be allowed to return, he knows he should pull the blaster take the relic and destroy it. But a memory holds him back. Kite is back on Kamino with his brothers training with the Cuy'val Dar, under the eye of a Mandalorian named Krin Ordo. Krin had taken to teaching the clones both the mandalorian language and culture during their brief respites from training. One of the lessons that stuck with Kite was when Krin *"Most of the galaxy sees the Mandalorian people as mercs for hire, but we are much more than mercenaries. Mercs will cut and run, mercs will take on contracts and turn on their clients, and mercs only fight for credits. Mandalorians fight because we are the best in the galaxy, and have been for generation's . What separates us from simple mercs is that if a Mandalorian takes a contract, he gets it done. He doesn't double cross or break his word, he does his duty." Kite's fingers loosen and while he doesn't like it, his decision is clear. (edited)
Stormchaser 21/05/2020 20:29
A fuzz of static rushes in Kite's ear as he tunes his comm to contact Puzell, replaced with crisp silence as the Duros picks up the line. "Puzell."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 21/05/2020 20:40
"This is Kite, I've got good news and bad news. Good news we were able to find the Balosar you told us about. The bad news is that Sable is after us in a big way. We believe they were responsible for the explosion at the Slips that destroyed our ship. We need to get off planet, if you can provide us with a ship that would be optimal. If not my ask is to stand aside and let us take the ship your men were watching in the Slips"
Stormchaser 21/05/2020 21:24

Stormchaser 21/05/2020 22:15

Rick Fisto 22/05/2020 00:57

Stormchaser 22/05/2020 16:25
Barin glances at the gold in his hands, torn somewhere between grief and greed. After a few more moment to compose himself, he settles for the latter and packs the loot away in his own bag. A couple of minutes later the skiff sets down at the central taxi point in the heart of the slips.
RisenZed 22/05/2020 16:31
As Adorhi and Testy move to disembark, Zed pulls Testy aside and quietly says, "Whatever that thing is, it's making people do things." He gestures vaguely toward the Fell Star in Adorhi's pocket. "I know you know this, but I'm saying it anyway: Keep your guard up."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 22/05/2020 16:35
Kite interjects as they move to disembark "I'm not sure what you two have planned but the Star should stay with the group. Sable maybe able to track it through the force and the two of you won't be in a good position to fend off an attack on your own. Especially if it continues playing mind games." (edited)
RisenZed 22/05/2020 16:37
Zed pauses, looking at Kite. Maybe the clone-turned-Mandalorian's paranoia and hatred of the Jedi was making him sharper than Zed gave him credit for. "I hadn't considered that," Zed says.
hugehuman 22/05/2020 17:04
Shorlu nods in agreement with Kite's words.
toddmoonbounce 22/05/2020 17:12
Walking off the skiff, Adorhi snaps her head around to the group giving a heavy scowl towards Kite. A reflexive hand to her belongings, she slowly continues to put distance between herself and the others. "Not a chance you greedy duplicates. Just like all that damn gold that nearly got us...no, did get me killed, you all seem to have lost sight of the end goal here. We have what we came for, and now we need to leave. I'm going to find us a way." Now turning to Test, "This," she pats the pouch on her belt, "this is where our trust restarts. If you're going to side with them however, you can stay here. Either way, I'm going to get us a ship." Still keeping her attention on the group, Adorhi continues to distance herself, not caring so much anymore if Test is joining, ready to slip into the alleys of the Slips on her way to Fische's Pub.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 22/05/2020 17:26
Kite scowls under his helm and says "Our mission is to retrieve the Star and Barin, and you would do well to remember your near death experience. That is what fighting a force user is like, next time there may not be someone there to save you. Also we were ill prepared for the ambush because you and Barin, decided to split from the squad and go off on your own limiting our options. I won't take the Star from you but if your task is that important, its a squad mission and the rest of us will be tagging along." Kite then places a hand on Barin's shoulder and leads him off the Skiff.
Rick Fisto 22/05/2020 18:11
Test puts a hand up to forestall Kite and the others. "Brothers. We've got to earn each other's trust to function as a unit. And sometimes speed is as important as force concentration. And we aren't exactly inconspicuous as a group," he says looking down at the 3 foot tall elephant and across at the men dressed almost like imperial storm troopers. "Adorhi and I don't draw attention just by being there, and I swear that I will protect her and the Star with my life." (edited)
RisenZed 22/05/2020 18:14
Zed trusted Test. He knew something was guiding his brother, even before he had just happened to find the cache in the caves. The Force, Zed presumed. He didn't know what it was all about, but he knew that it had been their ally in the past. Haspin had recited that old Jedi maxim time and time again: "May the Force be with you." Zed had always responded the same irreverant way Krin Ordo had: "Shoot straight and run fast, sir." But now, with all the Sable Dawn agents and premonitions and ship's blowing up and being chased, Zed felt like he didn't have much else to rely on, except his brothers, and maybe even the Force. He puts his hand on Kite's shoulder. "He's right. We're not exactly inconspicuous like this. And they'll comm us if they notice anything suspicious." (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 22/05/2020 18:44
Kite hears Testy's reply but continues to move after Adorhi, Test may trust her but after her abandoning the squad in the mines, I don't. She is unpredictable and undermines squad cohesion. He feels a hand on his shoulder and freezes after Zed steps in. It had been years since the squad left the GAR, but whether Zed liked it or not he was still the defacto leader. Kite wasn't happy about it but if this is the way squad wanted to play it, he will stand down. Kite Grunts and says "Your call Zed. Splitting the squad and sending out the smaller unit with the primary objective. When Force freaks are hunting us, feels like a mistake. Even before the fact that the Star is able to manipulate us." Kite leads Barin back into the ship and says "Stay alert Test" Kite pauses and hesitantly says "Don't be a hero, we can reacquire the Star if need be" (edited)
Rick Fisto 22/05/2020 18:45

RisenZed 22/05/2020 18:49

Drake | Emperor 22/05/2020 20:04

hugehuman 22/05/2020 20:41

Stormchaser 22/05/2020 21:51
There's a low thrum from the skiff's repulsors as it takes off once more. Down on the docks Adorhi and Testy's receding backs can be seen heading right, making for Fische's pub. They quickly disappear amongst the crowds, moving quickly and quietly. It doesn't take the skiff long to reach the roof of the Epsis command tower, where Puzell can be seen waiting with an entourage of security troopers, as promised. "Why the stop on the docks?" He asks with a frown as the skiff sets down at the edge of the roof. "I thought you were in a hurry?" Across the Slips all seems quiet in Fische's pub, although at first glance Alastair is nowhere to be seen.

Stormchaser 23/05/2020 20:39
For a long moment Puzell fixes Kite with a penetrating stare, his blank red eyes alien and unreadable. "No. That isn't 'common knowledge'. If Sable has hidden operatives with such abilities and are openly pursuing you with them, then you must have something that they want very badly indeed. We should get inside." Barin, Gauss, Kite, Shorlu and Zed are all escorted to a rooftop turbolift, which transports them down and away into the bowels of the building. When the doors open again they're in the lobby of a dispatch centre for Slips security. There's an island in the centre of the room manned by two uniforms. Armed officers regularly come and go as the daily business of running the docks continues. "Clegg, I need an interview room, now," Puzell barks, leading the group off down a corridor without waiting for an answer. "Yes sir... room three sir!" One of the officers behind the desk calls after him. Puzell leads everyone into a plain gunmetal room, just like the ones they were interrogated in earlier that day. He pulls up a chair with a clank and gestures to everyone else to make themselves comfortable. "You, sit down," he tells Barin firmly, nodding at the chair opposite before glancing over his right shoulder. "I want this all on holo," the Duros calls out in the direction of a pane of reflective glass, before looking back to Barin. "Now. From the beginning. I want to hear everything." Reluctantly, Barin begins to tell his tale...
Stormchaser 23/05/2020 21:31
"...as we got closer we could see somebody moving around on top of Shorlu's ship. It looked like the Gran that the squad had mentioned was harassing them earlier, but before we could work out anything else the whole thing just explodes. Durasteel flies everywhere, takes out a couple of other freighters for good measure. Everyone's thinking that it's gotta be Sable, and Kite said that our best bet was to call you. So we dropped Testy and Adorhi on the docks and came to meet you on the roof." Puzell sits for a while, processing what he's just been told and glancing at the others in the room to gauge their reactions. "Why drop the other two at the Slips if you're so concerned about Sable? Don't you think they're also in danger out there?"
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 23/05/2020 21:41

RisenZed 23/05/2020 22:20

Stormchaser 23/05/2020 22:49
Puzell rubs his brow and stands. He paces back and forth briefly, before knocking on the window and waving a hand to cut the recording. "They're going to want to talk to all of you, you realise that? They'll want to see the bullion as evidence too, and the Hutts will more than likely demand it be confiscated... The trouble with this whole story is that it's too easy for Sable to deny all involvement with it. You thought it was them. Somebody is just trying to pin blame or slander their reputation. There's no proof. Did you catch any of this on holo? Your story sows seeds of doubt, but it's not enough to topple a regime." (edited)
Drake | Emperor 24/05/2020 01:46
At the mention of a holo recording, Gauss remembers that his gear has been recording since the group left the cache. He starts tapping at his wristpad, separating the footage of the skirmish with Sable Dawn, making sure to cut it off before Adorhi screams, so as to avoid information about the Fell Star. "It completely escaped my mind until just now, because of the hell we were going through. I have a recording of our last encounter with Sable in the Fissures, by one of the entrances to the mines.: "I did not get a good look at them however, Zed and I ran after Barin as he tried to escape the chaos, we had to protect our charge after all. But, there is at least footage of a powerful lightning strike being directed towards Kite here. It might not point directly at them, but it's something." he says, as he hands Puzell a copy of the clipped footage. Would have been nice to have gone back to look for clues or information, but not knowing how many more there were, definitely would have been dangerous. he thinks to himself as he shuts down the recording. (edited)
Stormchaser 24/05/2020 14:58
Puzell brings up the holo on his own datapad, and spools through to the point where Gauss and Zed pass in sight of the corpse of the brown-robed Human who hurled lightning at Adorhi and Kite. "There," the Duros asserts, freezing on that frame while he calls up another recording. The footage from the security camera of docking bay 226 appears in the air besides the image of the dead Force user. The same recording that Puzell showed to Kite during his interrogation. The Duros freezes the holo on a sight that Kite recognises. A shot of the arrival of a group of men dressed in simple earth-tone suits, led by a Human in earth-tone robes. The same man who lies dead on the ground in Gauss's recording. "Those suits are Sable's standard uniform," Puzell explains, "but I've never seen their operatives robed before. It's circumstantial, of course. Anyone could buy a brown suit. It's something though. There's no proof here, but it suggests that it was indeed Sable who went after you." The Duros leans his head back in his chair while he thinks. "That means that the Sable Dawn can be associated with the murder of an Epsis customer and with the assault of a neutral party in Anjiliac territory... Of course, the trouble there is that you were in the mines without permission from the Anjiliac clan. The one thing that we really have on them is a recording that appears to show the Sable Dawn employing Force sensitive operatives. Valuable intelligence, but not enough to force a vote..."
15:00
Puzell sits back up and temples his fingers, fixing the clones with another long stare. "Ever heard of Virec Xan? He's the Sable Dawn administrator on Point Nadir. How do you boys feel about cracking another Sable facility? I need actual evidence that the Sable Dawn are responsible for the bombing in the Tethers and the murder of Phellip. If you get me that then Epsis can push Zietta to move against them in the council and you get paid, but I need solid evidence. Files from their computer systems, or from Virec's office. Something to really tie them to all of this." (edited)

hugehuman 24/05/2020 20:50
Shorlu's trunk wrinkles at the offer. His padded hands feel for the weight of the gold bar in the pack strapped to his side. Heavy, but reassuring in its weight. He was loathe to give it up, and not out of greed. This gold, in combination with its cousins still in the mines, could easily purchase Rider's freedom. He glances around at the clones, his thoughts fairly evident to them: Like we need that particular ship that badly, right? The blasted thing would take even more money and work just to get flying again. The Duros knew that. He gives Puzell a skeptical look. "Uh-huh. That is something we could do. Say, how much did you say you'd pay for this dirt on Sable, out of curiosity?"
Rick Fisto 25/05/2020 06:05
Test takes his drink, looking around the bar for threats. Why am I always looking for threats? Maybe 'cause I keep finding them. Wonder if I started looking for other things I might find them instead. As the drink runs over his tongue and brushes his lips, he feels the tingle of it, enjoying the sensation. He'd always enjoyed this drink for the numbness it gave him, bit this is the first time he stopped to pay attention to the tingle that came before the numbing. The drink was made with an extract of some blossom from some bush on Ryloth. Or was it Dantooine? But now that he was looking for the excitement, he found it. A pleasent sensation tickling his mouth. Maybe there was a lesson in that. Maybe he should look for more in life...more in others than just threat or back-up. Maybe it was time to look for that tingle that made life worth living for its own sake, not just the outcome that got him through the day. Heh. Next thing I know I'll be lookin' for a gal to hang on my arm, he thought to himself as he gave an audible laugh, looking around the room for more than just threats. (edited)
Stormchaser 25/05/2020 06:35

hugehuman 25/05/2020 18:16
Before Shorlu breaches the topic himself, Kite and Zed have already begun asking about McCarthy. It threw him off a bit. He'd been anticipating more of an uphill battle as far as that was concerned. Well, maybe it was more Test and Adorhi who would be the hard ones to garner support from. Test, who didn't really like or trust those outside of his circle (Am I an exception?), and Adorhi, who didn't seem to like anyone, unless they were of use to her (In which case, turn on the charm.). But of course, he didn't begrudge them for it. They were practical people in an impractical galaxy. He'd seen far colder types in his golden years. And to them, Flynn was only an acquaintance. But still, he had to make his intentions clear. Even if it meant he had to split off from this touchy, yet so far comfortable group, he wouldn't give up on Rider. After all, Rider didn't give up on him... That was for later, though. Let's focus on the present. Rick Fisto 26/05/2020 05:58
Test takes a deep breath, feeling sweat bead on his brow as his nerves take him like they hadn't since his first mission. After taking a half step down the bar towards the beautiful woman, he spins back towards the Wookiee, placing both hands on the bar top, his half-empty drink right between. "Never done this, ya know. Got any tips?" (edited)
05:58
After the barkeep just guffaws as only a Wookiee can, Test continues, "Yeah, well, see I ain't just your average Joe who at least grew up with girls around. I didn't even have a mother. Hell I didn't even really grow up. Adorhi's the only girl I ever said more than a few words to. Are they all like that? You know what never mind. I'm sure girls are great and all, but there's more to life right? There's more that a man can live for than that? Kark it, I'm just plain scared. Yeah I know you know, you don't gotta give me that look. It's probably easy for a chap like you. Got connections. A job that literally dispenses pleasure. Surrounded by girls. And come on, I mean your obviously quite the specimen. I mean you're what? Eight-two, eight-three? I bet the girls throw themselves at you. And me? I'm shabby. Haven't cut my hair or trimmed my beard in weeks. Hell I haven't bathed in a few days. My clothes are half caked blood and half scorched linen. I don't talk good. The one girl I've talked to bounces between hating me and making fun of me. What the hell kind of chance have I got with a girl like that down there? You know what? No. That's just fear talkin'. I gotta conquer fear. Look inside, take hold of the fear and show it who's boss. And you know what? Maybe it's time to do it. If I get rejected, I get rejected. It's not the end of the world. Hell, it won't be the 7th worst thing that happened to me today, most like. What the hell am I waiting for? Let's do this." Test gives the Wookiee his biggest smile, grabs the half-full glass from the counter and dumps the contents down his throat. Feeling invigorated, he turns back to the end of the bar to see a furry, male Defel. "Kark it." (edited)
Stormchaser 26/05/2020 15:58
Puzell nods. "Speak to Clegg at the desk we passed, he'll arrange you an escort." (edited)
RisenZed 26/05/2020 18:31
"Thank you for your help," Zed says, extending his hand to Puzell. Getting into bed with a syndicate like Epsis could be dicey. But the squad didn't have any other choice. I miss having the ability to call in an orbital bombardment, Zed thinks. Not that it would solve much in this situation. It's just nice to have options.
Stormchaser 26/05/2020 21:44
"I'd like to suggest Barin remain here," Puzell adds as he returns the handshake. "For his own safety." -------------------------------------------------- "Rooohu cacoohuanwa akahoaor huak ra rrahrcan ahwh aoacwo coohuor," Andy tells Test with a chuckle. "Cacwo ohoowh'ao rhwo rarhanwo aooo rcwowwhucwo!" At the back of the pub, Adorhi tries the door handle and it swings out towards her with a slight creak. On the far side is a far more modern corridor with sleek silver walls, punctuated periodically by doors, of which one is labelled MANAGEMENT. "Come in," Alastair's voice can be heard to reply from the far side when Adorhi knocks. Inside, she's confronted with another stark change in aesthetic. Alastair clearly favours old world comforts, complete with dark wooden furniture and real paper books that must be worth a fortune. "Ah, Miss Ven," he welcomes with a smile, gesturing to the Togruta to sit. "To what do I owe this pleasure? Here to take the Starworm job?"
RisenZed 26/05/2020 22:25
"Barin's probably not safe anywhere," Zed says. "No offense to your security measures, but I don't think they were built to keep out Force users." He turns to Barin. "You should come with us, I think."
toddmoonbounce 26/05/2020 22:27
Looking around Alastair's office, Adorhi quipped in reply, "Management, huh? Certainly there's a better ruse than that for your other endeavors? But yes, I am here to take the job and need to discuss additional resources needed, namely transport." Out of habit, she fell into a silky smooth voice and putting on the charm. The male species was so easy to manipulate if you made them think you had something to offer. Getting her wits about her, she quickly turned it off, knowing that Alastair was likely not the type to fall for foolish games. "What can you do to help a gal out?"
Stormchaser 26/05/2020 22:37
Alastair throws Adorhi a confused frown that quickly transitions to a look of amusement as he joins the dots. "So that was your ship that just went off like firecracker out in the Tethers, hm? That's rotten luck. I can rent you a freighter if that's what you need. Just don't let the Sable Dawn blow this one up, or you're paying for it!" -------------------------------------------------- Puzell gives Zed a look that is something between incredulous and amused. "Whether that's true or not, this building's defences are definitely more secure than a street escort of four mercenaries. I highly doubt that Sable will dare to publicly assault an Epsis command center."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 26/05/2020 22:45
Kite looks at Puzell trying to get a read for him. During their last conversation he seemed to be a fairly honorable straight shooter for his line of work. And based on his body language and demeanor it seems he is playing it straight now as well. "That definitely makes sense Puzell, if you have any combat droids it would definitely let me rest easier knowing they are also keeping watch on him. Barin choice is yours but it seems like this may be the safest place for you until we can get off planet."
RisenZed 26/05/2020 22:46
Zed nods. Kite makes a good point. Still not totally comfortable leaving Barin here alone, but if he has droids, that might waylay Sable's efforts if they did try something. Still not totally used to working with droids instead of blasting them.
toddmoonbounce 26/05/2020 23:03

Stormchaser 27/05/2020 19:07
"Three thousand five hundred credits for the duration of the job," Alastair rattles off on cue, smirking a little as he notices Adorhi surveying his souvenirs and trophies. They seem to heavily feature items characteristic of low-tech worlds. Model sail boats and bottles of rare spirits. Analog navigation devices, stone sculptures and a great many books. -------------------------------------------------- "I don't, but I'll look into it," Puzell tells Kite with a shake of his head. Barin glances left and right between the Duros and his rescuers, obviously torn, but in the end he sighs and nods. It's the safer path.
toddmoonbounce 27/05/2020 19:49

hugehuman 27/05/2020 19:56
"Alright," Shorlu said, checking Barin's reaction, and noting the atmosphere of the room. "Sounds like an offer we can't refuse. And I know a lot about those. So..." He gives a little shrug to the group, for anyone else who was willing to part with their gold, to do so. He, for his part, does not. He carefully makes small adjustments to his posture so as not to give away that he has a bar on him. If I can just hold onto this, it could go towards getting Flynn out more easily... He glances at the eyes of his compatriots. They wouldn't rat on me, would they...?

toddmoonbounce 27/05/2020 21:34

Stormchaser 27/05/2020 21:41
Alastair carefully looks Testy up and down. "You're holding out on me, Miss Ven," he tells her with a smirk. "Just how many of these do you have? At least five, from the looks of it. Maybe more? Just a few hours ago you were willing to do grunt work for a fist full of credits - which means that this windfall came to you on Point Nadir. Quite the change of fortune." Alastair continues to turn the bar over in his hands, inspecting it from all sides. "I didn't take you for a fan of spelunking," he notes as he lays it down on the table in front of him, watching Adorhi's face carefully with his piercing blue-eyed stare. (edited)
toddmoonbounce 27/05/2020 21:56

Sure, we may have stumbled upon something here. But that's just it, we did, not you." Adorhi lets out a sigh, struggling further to hold back the frustration. "We're simply here asking for the resources to complete your job. Does that work for you?" (edited)
Stormchaser 27/05/2020 22:15
Alastair chuckles, clearly well aware that Adorhi is right in some of what she's saying. "Most certainly," he answers, sliding the bullion to the side, where he obviously intends to keep it, "but, you see, now you've also drawn my attention. This isn't just any old gold. You've retrieved a portion of the legendary treasure of Salovan Fische and it's only right that it should reside in the house that bears his name." Alastair pauses and raises his hands to indicate the building around them. "You did say that you were good at finding things and maybe I underestimated that talent. How much more is there, Miss Ven? I don't believe for a second that it's just five bars."
Rick Fisto 27/05/2020 22:17

They ain't cheap a'course, but I think what we got here is close to priceless if I'm readin' the politics of this comet right. Stormchaser 28/05/2020 16:33

toddmoonbounce 28/05/2020 16:49
Adorhi was used to some hard negotiating in her line of work but Alastair seemed to be hitting a nerve. You've over reached. We'll be back when we have a ship to do your errand." Adorhi snaps in reply while grabbing the gold bar off of his desk. RisenZed 30/05/2020 22:33
Zed sighs. He liked Adorhi, but they had made a smart, tactical decision to leave an asset with an ally in a secure location, while she had taken one-half of their quarry into unknown territory with little backup or support while not explaining her plan to the rest of the squad. Well, maybe Puzell's not an ally, but he has as much reason to keep Barin alive as we do. She was becoming a tactical liability. Zed really didn't know what to do at this point. He had tried his best to be a peacekeeper between the squad and Adorhi, but he didn't have a response for this. He nods to Kite and Test as they head out. "Just to be clear," Zed asks. Drake | Emperor 31/05/2020 03:21
Looking at Zed and Shorlu, "Let's get to the Mad Line and fix it as quickly as possible, then go get Barin and leave as soon as possible. Not having the full team is dangerous for sure, the more time we spend here, the higher the chance Sable will find us... again." Gauss says with a sigh. (edited)
Drake | Emperor 31/05/2020 03:40
Gauss never liked when the squad spilt. Even during the war they had to split up to accomplish their mission, but not being able to back up half his squad never sat right with Gauss. He needed to be able to when his brothers, or friends, were in need but he understands that sometime they had to, even if it wasn't what Gauss considered the best solution. Being separated like this did give him focus however, the quicker he could get his respective task done, the quicker the squad could rejoin. Only then would he feel safe and secure, when he and his brothers were fighting side-by-side, not running this around dangerous scum filled comet where most beings are only out for themselves.
Rick Fisto 31/05/2020 05:41

hugehuman 31/05/2020 06:19

Nick the 'jewelry' and sell it myself? We've only known each other a few days, sure, but... you know me better than that, right?" He stops walking for a second, and opens up his pack, showing the two that he still had his bar of gold. "Obviously, I'm holding onto this to go towards getting Flynn out. Unlike with the artifact, this doesn't really belong to anyone as of yet, and what Puzell doesn't know can't hurt him. Besides, heh, I know a bit about law, and stealing from pirates is fair game. "Sorry that we lost the gold," Zed replies. "This has been a helluva day."
Drake | Emperor 31/05/2020 23:47

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 01/06/2020 00:04

toddmoonbounce 01/06/2020 15:12
Aboard their rental starship, Adorhi takes a lap around the cabins and through the cockpit before running into Test. A request by the clone to talk privately hits her with a variety of emotions and the most recent events with the others aren't helping. In some very weird way, she had done a 180 with Test. He had almost become the one she now trusts the most, second of course to trusting no one. She never bought into fate or destiny and was mostly indifferent on the Force. But something was just so damn coincidental she thought, about her and this clone, who spoke her language, coming together for a job. Even then, she couldn't help but feel that this conversation would turn into an attack, or worse yet, an attempt to take Prello's new relic. Adorhi does her best to concentrate and keep aware of Test at all times following him into the cabin. "So, fill me in on why you didn't go get Barin. Instead, you let those bucketheads go pick him up after they were the ones to leave him behind in the first place."
Rick Fisto 01/06/2020 15:40
After closing the door, Test goes to sit on the bunk. As he talks, he takes off his pack, unbuckles his weapons belt, and unstraps the small shield on his arm, placing them on the floor. "For a few reasons, Adorhi. One, 'cause I trust Zed's judgment about the tactical risks. It's a trust built over years...built with sweat and blood. And two, 'cause I wanted to talk to you alone. Adorhi I...I heard voices...whispers comin' from that Star when you walked by me earlier. I know it seems to have somethin' to do with the Force and...well ever since we...ever since Haspin died I've wanted to be more like him. And lately, with you be Togrutan like Haspin, the same color even. And with finding the lightsaber crystals after us gettin' into a fight, and you having this Star that seemed to call to me and seems to call to you. Well, I...kriff this sounds weird but...would you...meditate with me?" (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 01/06/2020 16:13
Kite inspects the ship both inside and out, but his focus is anywhere but on his task. Thinking about the Fell Star and the implausibility of what has occurred since they have found it. Something like the Star shouldn't exist, he remembers speaking with Haspin regarding the Force and being told While the force is all present and binds everything in the galaxy, to be able to actively call upon it you need to have the genetics for it. Something about a parasite in the blood. Kite couldn't exactly remember what Haspin called it, but while the blood parasite sounded ridiculous the logic tracked. They need to lock it up until they can return it to Prello. But even that is starting to concern Kite, Hutt's are greedy and self serving. Prello will sell it to the highest bidder, and if it can create new force users, the galaxy could return to the chaos of the Republic. He reboards the ship, and hearsTest talking to Adorhi, and says "I will be in the cockpit, if you need me"" (edited)
toddmoonbounce 01/06/2020 17:37

Rick Fisto 01/06/2020 21:21

toddmoonbounce 01/06/2020 21:54
Soon enough indeed. The bars of gold the Ortolan still held on to were all the evidence Adorhi needed to expose his self interests. Back in the moment, Adorhi couldn't help but chuckle inside her head at Test's red face. She dealt with all sorts in her days. Arrogant, stubborn, impatient, shy...the list went on and on. But one trait they all seemed to share was cluelessness. Sure she used her charm and looks to her benefit a time or two, but she was also not too shy about her own tastes. The thing with most men she'd met was they cared more about what they wanted than what they were getting. She knew that wasn't Test's intention, but wasn't about to give up the chance to chaff him about it. "Keep your pants on, buckethead." She said overtly sarcastic. She sat down on the opposite side of the room, crossing her legs, and holding her arms out, palms up, in a typical meditation pose. She continued her satirical tone while letting out exaggerated sounds of concentration. "Ohmmmm. Ohmmmm... When do I start floating?" the blue Togruta finally asks with a dry laugh. Adorhi fought intensely with an internal struggle. Sitting down with the clone and attempting whatever it was he wanted through meditation put her in an extremely vulnerable position, which of course meant risk at losing the relic. But at the same time, she was curious if this process could provide clarity, or more answers, to the mysterious feelings it seemed to be teasing her with. She closed her eyes, let out a deep slow breath, and tried to open her mind.
Rick Fisto 01/06/2020 22:08
"I'm gonna guess you've never done this before. It's ok, I'm no expert, but I can guide you through some of it. Our minds throw thoughts at us that distract us from what we feel. Makes us think we are ridin' around in our heads like some sort of flesh exo-suit. But that's just an illusion. We do not ride in our bodies, we are our bodies. And yet we are more than just the matter of our bodies. Just concentrate on what you hear. The sound of my voice. The breath you exhale." Adding a touch of levity to his voice he adds, "the sounds your nervous shifting make against the ground. Now add to the sounds what you feel. The floor pressing against you, holding you up. The feel of your arms on your knees. The weight of the Star at your waist." Test feels out for the Star, trying to make contact with the voices he heard. (edited)
Drake | Emperor 02/06/2020 03:47

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 02/06/2020 14:00
Kite had spent the last hour getting familiar with the controls and keeping watch. He breathes a sigh of relief after hearing Gauss on the comms. He was more than ready to get off this comet. He also wondered what the Kark Test & Adorhi were doing. He expected it be a quick and explosive conversation. With Test standing uncomfortably asking to lock the Star up and Adorhi yelling nonsense. But it had been eerily quiet. He thought about walking in the room to check on them, but quickly realized that would end poorly. He pauses and dryly adds "When you two are finished doing whatever it is your doing, join me in the cockpit. This isn't driving Ms. Hutta" he chuckles and goes back to prepping the ship for launch.
Stormchaser 02/06/2020 19:19
Darkness. Adorhi closes her eyes and in her mind's eye she sees herself sitting on a backdrop of infinite black. The background whirring of the Messenger's mechanisms rumbles in the Togruta's ears, grounding her in this moment. The vibrations paint a picture through her montrals. Test sitting opposite, eyes also closed and his brow furrowed in concentration. The perspective shifts and she sees the clone across from her on the featureless field of nothing. It's different to the image she feels with her montrals. More like sight, although her eyes are still pressed closed. More than that, she can feel his presence. The image is secondary - she knows Test is there. It seems strange that that might ever have not been the case. His existence in front of her is like a fact etched in stone. Impossible to overlook. The Adorhi in her mindscape looks down and sees the pouch at her belt. It feels heavier than she knows it to truly be, like it's holding her down. Familiar voices begin to creep in, whispering on the edges of her hearing. The Test across from her stirs, his eyes snapping open, although she can sense that in truth they are still closed. He meets her gaze and she knows that this is Test, sharing this place with her as they meditate together. As he watches her, Adorhi knows that he can hear the whispers too. They call to them both and, for a brief moment of clarity, one makes itself heard. Breathy and feminine it murmurs. "Awaken." (edited)
toddmoonbounce 02/06/2020 21:17
As Adorhi gains awareness in whatever state she was in, a million thoughts and feelings seem to swirl and tug at her all at once. One in particular does seem to try and push through. A call for help, a struggle to resist something dark. But just as fast as it came forward, it is pushed away by the overpowering force of the object in her pouch and she can do nothing to resist. Her eyes snap open.
Stormchaser 02/06/2020 21:33
Testy is helpless to intercede as he watches Adorhi's essence fade away in front him. However, her avatar remains. Its head cupped in its hands, before looking up and hopelessly clawing at imaginary walls on either side of her. He can feel the power emanating from the pouch at her hip. A gruff voice speaks to him over the rustling whispers. "You are difficult to kill."
Rick Fisto 02/06/2020 23:10
Test sees that Adorhi, or at least some part of Adorhi, seems stuck...trapped, seemingly by the Star at her hip. He is not quite sure if malevolence in the right word for what he is perceiving--not sure if the gruff statement was one of admiration, frustration, or simple musing--but he knows now that he must save Adorhi from this trap that she has wondered into, even at the cost of his own safety or whatever scraps of friendship and trust that he may have built with her. He tries to stand, planning to lunge at the Star when he feels an unexpected weight at his own hip, mirroring Adorhi's Star: his saber...the one he had already taken off. No, a different saber. As he pulls it from his waist, he feels the heavy weight of it--heavier than the saber he was used to. But as it blazes to life with a blade of pure white he finds it is somehow easier to handle than Haspin's saber, the blade resisting his movements less. He carefully tries to cut Adorhi out of her prison, attempting to plunge the blade through the invisible walls and towards the Star. (edited)
Stormchaser 03/06/2020 07:05
A deep resounding electronic whine echoes in the darkness like the shockwave from a seismic charge. It's the first real sound that Test has heard since he entered this place. The white energy of his blade scatters off of a cylinder that surrounds Adorhi like a force field, sending brilliant bolts of alabaster plasma arcing across the surface. Suddenly, Test hears a different voice in his mind. Calm and familiar and speaking Togruta. "Knowledge and defence."
Rick Fisto 03/06/2020 07:18
"Haspin?" Test calls out. "Are you there?" No of course not. Don't be silly. Maybe a piece of him...somehow. But this...this is just all in my head...isn't it? Test pulls his right hand up, interposing the white blade between his body and the invisible cylinder in a defensive stance. He reaches out tentatively with his left arm to place his other hand on the cylinder and feel it. "What are you? What have you done to Adorhi? Why won't you let her go?"
RisenZed 03/06/2020 08:28
With Gauss' confirmation that the Mad Line's laser cannon is online, Zed climbs up the access tube and seats himself into the dorsal turret. He put his helmet back on and sits. As he does so, the manual controller lists wildly to one side, spinning the turret around nearly a full 360 degrees with a sharp cla-clunka-clunka-clunk before he grabs the controls and rights himself. He curses under his breath. Clicking his mic on with a chin-toggle, he comms Gauss and Shorlu. "Nothing to worry about," he says. "Just getting my bearings." Pulling up the turret's display system, he accesses the ship's communications array and tries to access the Imperial HoloNews Network. He needed to keep his mind off the day's events. The caves, the treasure, the ship exploding...the kid he nearly blasted. The memory of aiming down the sights of his DC-17m at the hard, malnourished face of the kid who had just wanted medicine made him sick. The display beeped once and snapped him out of his nausea: [[NO SIGNAL]] "Figures," he says to himself. It wasn't like the Empire made a habit of broadcasting any news anyway. Ever since the Republic died, more and more of the HoloNet had become used for Imperial military traffic. The news channels that had continued broadcasting were largely propaganda. Sometimes, they would air Imperial Senate meetings, but after a few viewings, it became apparent to Zed that they weren't live and were likely heavily edited. Nothing negative about the Empire ever got airtime. One of the old tactical texts he had read, written by a general from the Old Republic, said, One sure sign of a totalitarian state is the inability of the press to speak against it. Or something like that anyway.
08:28
That was the new galactic order. Hammer Squad had left the Empire because they were all dissatisfied in their own way. Whatever individual reasons the squad had for leaving, Zed knew that something in the core of the Empire was rotten. But it was too big. Much too big to do anything about. That's why, when the squad left the Imperial Army, Zed had suggested running to the Outer Rim. To keep the squad safe from the Empire. You know that's not it, the dark part of his mind says. You're a deserter. You pointed your weapon at a kid today. A kriffing kid. He just wanted medicine. And you kept him from it. You're not a warrior. You're a coward. Zed shrinks into himself, keeping alert, but still allowing his mind to wander. Fast-roping down from a LAAT/i on the Slips. Raiding the storehouses of the rich patrons of this comet. Taking down the thugs with Hammer Squad and the 213th Attack Battalion at his back. Setting up relief shelters and supply distribution for the people who needed it. Securing this base as a stronghold. Building an army. Marching up the steps of the Senate building on Coruscant and arresting the conspirators that destroyed the Republic. Just a failed soldier's fantasy. (edited)
Stormchaser 03/06/2020 10:12
Test's hand reaches out towards Adorhi. He feels a slight resistance and then it passes through. The booming drone echoes again through the dark and Adorhi's pouch begins to shine with a brilliant, white light. It's cold and harsh and chills him to the bone.
Stormchaser 03/06/2020 14:59
The light intensifies. Its light is blinding. It drowns out all else, but still Test pushes towards it. Then something pushes back and Test is thrown backwards into his own body, where he wakes with a start. "To have fallen so far and learned nothing, that is your failure," whispers a fading voice in his ear. (edited)
hugehuman 03/06/2020 16:55
"No problem there, Zed. Hold onto that gun, though." Shorlu reached for the inciter and gives it a pull, causing brilliant light to stream from their thrusters, and a low vorrrooooooom to increase in volume, as the ship's engines start. He flicks on his comlink one more time. "Okay Kite, we're pulling out now. Next stop, Tatooine. Helm's yours, Gauss. I've got our heading." He begins making the necessary calculations for lightspeedâ€”notably keying in the coordinates for Tatooine without pausing, or having to consult a chart.

Rick Fisto 04/06/2020 06:49
Test powers on the monitor at the operator's station, seeing that the ship directly behind the Mad Line is lining up for an easy shot on his brothers. Remembering back to a trick Kite taught him during the war he thinks to himself Let's see if your ship has nonlinear collectors. He activates his own ship's radar transmitter at full power, hoping to saturate the headhunter's sensors to prevent the ship from locking on to it's target.
Drake | Emperor 04/06/2020 07:14
More streaks of red flash by the cockpit of the Mad Line Gauss makes a hard right bank, back towards Point Nadir, with the ship, hoping to not get to far ahead of the Messenger so they can provide covering fire, and maybe get these fighters trapped between them. "Here's hoping one of the tricks Edge taught me long ago works!" he exclaims. Edge was an ARC-170 pilot stationed on the same star cruiser as Hammer Squad. Gauss had always been intrigued, and a little jealous, of the Clones bred for space combat. On some of his days off, he would chat with Edge and some of the other pilots, exchanging stories of their missions. Gauss, about times like when Hammer squad narrowly made it off the overrun Wookie home world. The pilots about some of the insane stunts they would pull off, just to see how the droid starfighters would react, and how many would wind up crashing into each other. This was not one of those tricks, Gauss was not confident enough in his skills, or the capabilities of an old freighter to try it. He did however pick up some pointers on how to successfully evade, and potentially lose, a tailing starfighter. (edited)
Stormchaser 04/06/2020 07:14
The Z-95s swoop and weave, trying to get a bead on the Mad Line. Test's inteference is extremely effective, and one of them fails to get a target lock. However a lucky shot from the other soaks into the freighter's shields. (edited)
Rick Fisto 04/06/2020 07:22
Test, seeing the easy shot go wide, continues to pour on the power to the Messenger's dish, but quickly sees the dish's temperature shoot up. Kark it. I'm going to have to better modulate that power output. Maybe try well-timed bursts that don't fry this hardware. That's not a mistake Gauss or Kite would've made. I'm out of my element here. (edited)
hugehuman 04/06/2020 07:35
Shorlu braces himself instinctively as Gauss weaves, dodging nearly every shot. "Yeah, keep that up!" He leans over to the comms station, and starts fluctuating their signal, to further throw them off. He returns to his calculations, nearly forgetting to carry a two.
RisenZed 04/06/2020 07:53
The fighter slipped in and out of the crosshairs, flying erratically. Zed tracked it for a few moments, letting the crosshair sit in the middle of the Z-95's juking course. He looked for the pattern. In combat, beings always follow patterns, Krin had said back on Kamino, and it had held true for most engagements he had been a part of, even though the enemy force hadn't consisted of beings so much as mindless battle droids. He watched the ship on the display. Up to port, pitch relative down, strafe starboard, pitch up, roll up to port, pitch relative down, strafe starboard... Zed squeezed the trigger and this time, the bolt caught the Z-95 directly in the engine housing. The trail of vapor became a plume of crystalizing air, burning fuel, and durasteel. "Got one," he says into the comms tonelessly. Riding on a combat high, he swings the gun to the other ship and pegs it in its forward shields. Now it's your turn, friend.
Stormchaser 04/06/2020 09:04
With one fighter down and barely a dent in the Mad Line's shields the second headhunter begins to peel off.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 04/06/2020 14:49
Kite sees Zed disable one of the Z-95s and the other peel away afterwards. He then checks the ships scanners to see if he can uncover any other hostiles in the area. But doesn't spot any so far. He activates the ship's comms to Adorhi and says "Hostiles are retreating, hold position in the turret until we make it safely to hyperspace. Sable has been tricky so far, I wouldn't be surprised if they have reinforcements"
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 04/06/2020 16:41
Kite looks over the instruments as the Z95 retreats and sees if the ship is ready to jump to hyperspace
RisenZed 04/06/2020 17:49
As the other Z95 peels off, Zed swings the turret back to the disable fighter. Better safe than sorry, he thinks. The cannon churns twice and the Z95 explodes in a muted fireball. He scans the area and sees no other hostiles, and decides to check on Barin. He climbs down the ladder and exits the access well. He begins to search the ship for the Balosar. "Barin, you alright?"
Stormchaser 04/06/2020 18:39
No answer comes in response to Zed's call, but after a brief search he comes across Barin in what, until recently, was Phellip's cabin. He's sat on the bed looking sombrely at a picture frame that he holds in his lap.
RisenZed 04/06/2020 18:44
Zed takes in this somber scene, standing in the doorway frozen, unsure what to do or say. He had dealt with grief before. Grief at losing men in combat. Grief when they gunned down Haspin. But this was different. A much smaller scale and all the worse for it. He removes his helmet again. "Barin, I'm sorry for what happened to him," he starts, still standing in the door. "And your cousin. We tried..." He trails off. The memory of Olev being blasted, mercilessly at the hands of Sable as they breached the door. Kriff. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 04/06/2020 19:09
Kite still white knuckling the joy sticks starts to breathe easier as they get close to being able to jump to hyperspace. He opens up a comm to the Mad Line and says "Kandosii Vods!" He pauses and adds in basic "Well fought Detective. I apologize for leaving you hanging, they caught us with our pants down and we didn't have anyone manning the guns. And the ship is the size of bolo-ball field. " He pauses again and switches back to Mandalorian "We have a bit of an incident brewing. Testy is sure the Togruta has been compromised by the Star. We are going to try to handle it, but wanted to make sure you were aware." (edited)
hugehuman 04/06/2020 19:27
Shorlu hoots victoriously as the first Z-95 goes up in flames, and the other one breaks away. "Not so easy to blow up our ship while we're still in it, huh, ya kriffin' cowards!?" He turned to Gauss, with shining eyes indicative of a smile. "Nice flying. And thanks for listening, too. Y'know why I told you to cut right? Get this: those Z-95s? They gotta defect. If they haven't been maintained properly, they get a teensy bit imbalanced towards the port side. Not a lot, but it makes it harder to turn right and shoot accurately at the same time. Nuts, huh?" He finishes up his calculations with his other hand while gesticulating to Gauss, only to be cut off by the crackle of the comms being reopened. "Oh, thanks, but it was really all Gauss and Zed here." He pauses when he hears him speaking in Mandalorian, and looks to Gauss for a translation. (edited)
Drake | Emperor 04/06/2020 20:28

Fly ahead of us, if we see anything odd, like an escape pod launching, we can hopefully catch it." Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 04/06/2020 22:13
As the Messenger hurtles through hyperspace Kite releases his death grip on the control panel and stands up. Exhaling a deep breath he didn't even realize he was holding, and stretching has back. toddmoonbounce 04/06/2020 22:14
Still sitting at the controls of the freighter's canon, moreso from being trapped by her own thoughts than Kite's command to keep an eye out, a wave of exhaustion rushes over Adorhi. She sits in silence, staring blankly, until she feels the ship lurch into hyperspace and laboriously climbs out of the gunner seat and makes her way to one of the ships cabins, closing the door behind her and collapsing on the bed. The past days' events seem to rush to the front of her mind all at once and then, again, she feels that piercing sadness and emptyness of loss. Barin, on his good friend's ship, without that good friend. Adorhi couldn't help it, nor held back, and wept. Constantly in motion, her thoughts shift to Test and their meditation. What did it mean? Why was she having these feelings, these thoughts? As if on cue, her mind goes to the Star. As became habit, she put her hands to the pouch that contained the relic and the thoughts of maintaining possession, at all costs, surfaced. Adorhi closed her eyes and slept.
Rick Fisto 04/06/2020 22:26
Hearing a cabin door open and close down the hall as Kite is stowing his blaster, Test asks, "What's the plan then? Sneak in after she falls asleep or something?"
RisenZed 04/06/2020 22:27

He give slight groan as the weight of the chest plate comes off and his spine decompresses a few millimeters. He wrinkles his nose at the smell radiating from his armpits and heads toward the refresher for a sani-steam. Coming out after a few minutes, grimaces as he puts his dirty clothes back on and starts toward the galley, but heads to Barin's cabin instead. He knocks on the door and calls, "Barin, we're going to drum up some grub and maybe play some cards, if you'd like to join us." He heads for the galley where Shorlu is already cooking.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 04/06/2020 22:46

Rick Fisto 05/06/2020 17:50

Amazingly, this seems to work, and Test is able to slowly draw the Star out of the pouch as it gleams in the low light from the hallway. He nods his head towards the door, signalling Kite to move out, motioning that he'll place the Star in the metal box once they are out of earshot.

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 05/06/2020 18:11

Rick Fisto 05/06/2020 18:26

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 05/06/2020 18:29

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 05/06/2020 18:52
Hearing Test's voice and the quite "It's not" made Kite's skin crawl. Hutt spawn, Test is compromised too, we should have worn gloves before handling the Star. Kite's thoughts instantly go to tactics. I need to retrieve the Star ,hopefully the box will block its effects. But if he makes an issue of this there isn't a way for me to take it by force here. I'm no match for him hand to hand, as numerous training sessions and a bad dust up post Order 66 have confirmed. I can't risk using a blaster even on stun, onboard this freighter, and I don't want to pull my knife on my brother. Diplomacy it is Kite turns around and says to Testy "Test you don't look well. I know you know this force stuff better, but I need you to be a 100%. You lost an hour earlier today with Adorhi, you said you were meditating. I know Haspin showed you a few tricks but even with my personal feelings aside, now isn't the time to be flirting with the Force. Especially since you never explained how you were positive that she was compromised after you came back. I think you have been compromised as well, and unless you can say you are 100%. I need you to give me the Star." Kite tries to adopt a relaxed demeanor and kind tone. You have to trust me" He then holds out his hand but still keeps some distance between them. (edited)

Rick Fisto 05/06/2020 19:54

toddmoonbounce 05/06/2020 20:59
Amidst the darkness of her dreams, emotions, feelings, and visions, of pain and power, fill Adorhi's mind. All the distance between them, she continues to sense Barin's pain, in tandem with her own of Daesh'. She feels a power...a force...that invigorates and consumes her. It pulls her in, opening her mind to so many new things. She sees Test across from her in that dark plane. Sees him coming towards her and reaching out. And then, nothing. Complete darkness. Complete silence. Adorhi continues to sleep, a weight seemingly lifted. At the edges of her mind, a bright light now pushes through the darkness.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 05/06/2020 21:17

He decided to give one last try before committing to his plan.
