Rick Fisto 05/06/2020 21:37
Test briefly closes his eyes and, as he opens them again, Kite can see--can practically feel--the muscles in Test's neck clenching. A warm wetness drips down onto Test's mustache. His free hand goes to wipe it off and comes away bright red with blood. "I...I'll put it away. With you. In a neutral spot. And you can lock it up. If..." he pauses for emphasis. "If you promise me that we don't give this to Prello. She can't be trusted with it. We can't do that."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 05/06/2020 22:44
Kite watches the blood dripping from Test's nose, and can almost feel the sense the conflict inside of his brother. Test then begins to speak and after Kite hears "I'll put it away" he smiles and starts to walk towards his brother. But freezes once Test says "IF" the rest of the sentence hits Kite like a hover truck. The only way to separate Test from the Star was to break one of the few things in the galaxy that truly mattered to Kite. His code. No one from Hammer Squad flourished after the group deserted but Kite was truly lost. His whole identity was based upon being a Republic Commando, being literally bred to be a part of the best army in the galaxy's history. Losing that left him broken, and without an identity he became despondent & directionless. Spending most of his time drinking or carrying out hits for low level thugs. This continued until he picked a fight with a Barabel and almost got himself killed. Only being saved by the timely intervention of a Mandalorian in blue and gold armor, whose name Kite either didnâ€™t get or was too drunk to remember. The only thing Kite remembers is that after saving him the warrior told him in Mandoâ€™a â€This isnâ€™t the way Vodâ€. (edited)
22:44
After this Kite located his former trainer Krin Ordo and left his brothers for a few months, spending time on Mandalor learning both the Resol'nare, and Jaster Mereelâ€™s Super Commando Codex. Since then Kite has made the code the foundations of his life and hasnâ€™t strayed from it. And one of its central tenets was to honor your word, if you take a job you do it or die trying. Kite sputters as he tries to find what to say to his brother. He wouldn't let his brother die or become corrupted but the Code was life to Kite. â€œTestâ€¦.Wwe gave our words. I deserted with the squad and left behind my honor once, and while Iâ€™m now happy that Iâ€™m not a cog in the Empire. I canâ€™t lose myself again.â€ (edited)
Rick Fisto 06/06/2020 18:09
There's no way out. Can't give up the Star, but he's not going to let me keep it. And I won't hurt my brother. His knife. Take it and lock him up. But how do I take it without hurting him? You know how. What? Reach out with your feelings. Be one with the knife. Be it as it flies towards you. I....Yes. Test closes his eyes briefly to clear the thoughts racing through it. Opening his eyes, he locks them on Kite's forearm and wills the knife to fly towards him. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 06/06/2020 18:38
Kite's arm is still stretched out to his brother hoping that Test will see reason. Kite then feels something start to pull on his left forearm. Starting small but then suddenly gaining focus and intensity, pulling at Kite's hidden knife. Kite keeps the blade sheathed on his left forearm just under his wrist. The blade's hilt matches his armor's color pattern and is almost imperceptible. Even Puzell's men were unable to find it when they detained him. But Kite's brothers know him better than he knows himself. The knife flies out of the sheath and moves toward Test but Kite is able to leap and catch the blade just in time. Rolling back to his feet in a low combat stance with his knife in his right hand in a reverse grip in a defensive position, with his back to the cockpit door. He looks at Test with tears in his eyes and says "Please brother, I don't want to fight you" (edited)
hugehuman 06/06/2020 18:45

Rick Fisto 06/06/2020 19:17
As Kite backs up, Test sees his opportunity to get away and darts into the Captain's cabin where he had previously left his gear. Slamming his hand on the door lock, he falls back against the wall breathing hard, tension loosening in his muscles. What is going on? Did the Star do that? Like with Barin? It couldn't have been me? I'm just a clone. Clones can't use the force. Can we? He moves to the bed to pick up the saber and activates it, holding it up close to the intersection of the hatch and the bulkhead, using the heat to spot weld the door so it wouldn't just open if Kite or Adorhi picked the lock. Hopefully.

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 06/06/2020 20:05
Kite slows his breathing and reviews the situation in his head. Coming to the conclusion that there really is nothing else that can be done today he rechecks the lock on the cockpit and settles in for the night. He doesn't like leaving his brother with the cursed star but without running the chance of getting himself or Test killed there wasn't anything he can do. Hopefully with some time and distance from the Star Adorhi will be better and able to help. Either way he needed sleep. He settles into the pilots chair leaving his armor on and tries his best to get some rest.
Rick Fisto 06/06/2020 22:27
Taking the Star back out of the tool chest and placing on the bed, Test sits cross-legged in front of it, staring. Why am I so afraid to lose this? It's just some fancy jewelry. No. You know it's much more than that. It would be so easy to just give up. Give in. It would be a small action, but such a large event. Falling isn't a small thing. And neither is rising. It's a hundred small decisions every day. Every moment. It's effort. And practice. And habit. And those small bits add up. So let's start small. Test closes his eyes, refusing to look at the Star, biting his bottom lip to give him pain to focus his mind on. It helps him refuse to open his eyes no matter how much he wants to. After an hour of keeping his eyes closed, with only a few falters, he feels ready to take the next small step. He opens his eyes and slowly places the Star in the tool box and closes the lid. Haspin. If you are somehow still there, help me walk this path. Help me keep putting one step in front of the other. With that, Test moves back a few inches on the bed, slightly increasing the distance between himself and the Star. He feels another small trickle of blood from his nose. This is going to be a long few days.
toddmoonbounce 06/06/2020 22:36
In her dreams, the white light continues to try and fill the togruta's mind. It bulges with a rapid expansion before suddenly going dim and turning red. Adorhi snaps awake, breathing heavily. Test...no...
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 06/06/2020 23:21
Kite stretched out and gave a deep groan as he woke up. He hated sleeping in his armor, he never felt truly rested afterwards. But he needed to be ready in case anything happened. He looks over at his wrist pad and sees one piece of good news. His new Tracker Droid and Temporary boost programs have finished integrating into his armor. When or more likely if, he gets to Tatooine he will have to find a good droid vendor. His mind goes back to the situation at hand. thinking Still as karked as yesterday, but maybe time has helped. We don't know if the Stars effects are permanent, so Adorhi could be an asset. He then opens his pack and rummages through looking for his rations, he eats one and then brings out another that has a gold mark on it. He opens it and smells the cloyingly sweet smell of an uj cake. A favorite desert among Mando's due in part to how well it travels. There is a bar on Tatooine that makes them and Kite always grabs one before a mission, but unfortunately this one is going to be a peace offering. He walks to Adorhi's room trying to move stealthily. He then knocks on Adorhi's door, with the cake in hand. (edited)
toddmoonbounce 07/06/2020 06:06
Despite jerking awake, Adorhi was still able to find some much needed continued sleep. It came a little easier as the dark feelings that initially woke her seemed to have subsided. After a few more hours, Adorhi woke again feeling...better. It was maybe a good thing they had three more days till Tatooine. She wasn't 100% yet and looked forward to the availability of rest during the trip. That is, if she was going to get the opportunity. While sitting on her bed, reviewing her thoughts and the past days events, she sensed movement coming down the hall of the living quarters from the forward part of the ship. It wouldn't make sense for Test to make the loop up and around and Adorhi didn't think he would be trying to throw her off. This had to be Kite. And if he was coming to her cabin, that only meant one thing. Trouble had already started. Adorhi opened her cabin door in response to the clone's knock and met his eyes with a look of her own that said she understood. "Morning, Kite. Get any sleep?" Looking about the passenger cabin she chose for the trip, she continued. "Not the most capacious for having guests. Shall we talk in the bridge? " (edited)
Rick Fisto 07/06/2020 17:01
After another half hour of having the box slightly further from him, Test forces himself to put it on the floor next to the bed and get some shut-eye.
hugehuman 07/06/2020 17:27
After several hands of sabacc (or really, until Gauss and Zed were tired of playing), Shorlu happily shuffles the cards away. Though he lost, just playing the game withâ€”not quite friends, but friendly acquaintances, was a pleasure in and of itself. He reclines in his seat with a small, satisfied hoot. I'm glad I met these chulhoos. (Ortolan for "good fellows.") "Me and Rider had a nice collection of holotunes on the Bane. The Mos Eisley Brothers, Jorbo and the Love Machines, the T-42s, lots of classics. I was gonna play them for you guys on the ride home, 'till all this happened." He strokes his trunk with an air of nostalgia. "That reminds me, I never answered Test's question earlier, in the tunnels. 'Bout how me and Rider wound up running together."
RisenZed 07/06/2020 17:47

Talking to Adorhi was nice too, but she had been acting strangely ever since they had found the star. I guess I just never had friends outside the squad, Zed thinks. Except Haspin. (edited)
hugehuman 07/06/2020 19:43
Shorlu ambles over to get the bottle of tequila, and sets everyone up with a shot. Pausing a moment, he pours an additional glass, then dumps it on the floor; a wordless tribute for the ship's former owner. "5 years ago, I was about at the end of my rope. I'd been out of a job as a private dick for a whileâ€”the war just wasn't good for businessâ€”and out of IntSec even longer. I was stuck in some cruddy old spaceport, and spent the rest of my creds on food, drink, and good company. Mostly food, though. I wound up taking loans from sentients I knew were a bad sort, but I didn't care at that point. They came to work me over in the cantina..." Shorlu's story wove a vivid tapestry of the events: there he is in the cantina, face down in a now empty bowl. A broken jukebox plays the same old jizz song on a loop, to which his ears twitch in time with the rhythm. A Nikto enters, flanked by a Gamorrean and an Abyssin, obviously enforcers. He spots Shorlu, crossing the floor and pulling his head out of the bowl, pointing an accusatory finger at his food-encrusted face and levying overt threats. The bartender and clientele mostly ignore them. Except for one individual with a handsome face, feet propped up in a corner booth. He heads over and greets the thugs. They recognize him, and hear him out. With a nod from the Nikto and a couple of shrugs from the others, they leave the cantina. Shorlu looks up at his benefactor, who smiles back at him, offering his hand. "So, I wound up working for the Hutts instead a' getting spaced by them, like I'd been expecting." He stretches out. "So yeah, I'm gonna do what I can to get Flynn out. Preferably without bloodshed. I'll come up with something, even if Prello's not much help. Anyway, that's enough rambling from me, feels like I've been talking for hours now." He cleans up, as promised, and settles in for the remainder of the journey.
Drake | Emperor 07/06/2020 20:16
As Shorlu is cleaning up, Gauss replys to his story "With the little personal contact we have had with Prello, she seems to someone who values her underlings greatly. She will do a lot, including sending her own people into another Hutt's territory, to find one that is missing and in need of help." Gauss pauses for a second, "She spoke highly of Flynn, I have a feeling she will gladly help us free him." After Shorlu leaves, Gauss pulls out his tools and starts working on his wristpad, preparing it for when he can get the supplies he needs to upgrade it. In the process he changes and adds some functionality to it as he comes up with ideas for new programs and gadgets to help him and his squad better combat The Sable Dawn. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 07/06/2020 23:17
Kite gives a tired nod and heads back to the bridge locking the door behind them. After they're inside he takes his helmet off, sighs and rubs his hands through his eyes. this next bit won't be easy Kite then looks up at Adorhi and says "Before we get to the situation. Uh I... I want to apologize. We don't usually work with outsiders and you have a different way of operating than I'm used too. I pick one up before every mission, but I want you to have this one." After a second he looks at her intently and adds "How are you feeling today?" (edited)
RisenZed 08/06/2020 17:07
"We'll get him back, Shorlu," Zed says. "And Barin, we'll get Phellip to Dantooine." With that, Zed heads to his cabin to get some shut-eye. While asleep, he dreams. He remembers the tactical training on Kamino. Before he had been placed in command of Hammer Squad, he trained with the other commando units in his batch. He hadn't been deemed what his batch-mates called "command material", so he was in charge of demolitions in the training scenarios. "Alright, Zeros, keep up!" said, RC-0101. The fact that 0101 had the same amount of zeroes in his designation didn't stop the clone from berating him constantly. One day, during training scenario X-1138, 0101 went down. A stunner blast. They were supposed to immobilize for a few seconds, but 0101 wasn't moving. The kaminoan in charge of the scenario called across the field: "0089, you're in charge. Continue the mission." He took a deep breath, and analyzed the scenario. The left flank was covered. Troops circling to the right. The center was guarded by a high powered auto-turret. All he needed was a split second. He ordered the remainder of his troops to charge up the middle on his order. He dove over the cover, attracting the turret's attention. He took a blast to the armor as he was tossing a electro-stun grenade. The turret focused on the cover he had fallen behind while the grenade detonated at its base. "Now!" he shouted, and the troops stormed the middle, capturing the enemy bunker, and making quick work of the displaced droids. After the scenario ended, 0101 still didn't move. The autopsy said that he had a congenital heart defect. One in three million chance. So Zed took his place and embraced the nickname Zeroes. Eventually, it became Zed. And he was scooped up by special forces and placed in command of Hammer Squad. Maybe it's time to step up again.
toddmoonbounce 08/06/2020 18:36
Adorhi takes the clone's offering breaking it in two and giving one half back to Kite while taking a bite of the other. "Delicious, Kite, thank you. And I'm feeling better." The Togruta shifts her weight as she searches to find the words for her own apology. "About the past few days..." Adorhi continues telling Kite about how, despite Togruta's strong natural sense of togetherness, her own goals and desires pushed her away from her kind and family. She told him about Daesh' and how that loss all but cemented her swearing off getting close to someone else again. Her reaction and behavior to working with the group came out of those two significant losses. She wouldn't wish that pain even on her worst enemy. "So..." she hesitantly says, "I'm sorry. These past days events have, perhaps on the brighter side, made me reevaluate and if you'll have me, I'd like to finish our other work together after Tatooine." Adorhi takes the last bite of the Uj cake, pausing to appreciate it's taste. "But first, I assume you've already dealt with the work we have on this ship. I hope you can trust me that I am free of the Star's influence. I understand, as best as one could, that it had affected me. That control over me is gone but I think a connection still lingers and I felt Test being consumed by it." With a straight and serious look, she lastly says, "It won't be easy, but we must get that thing out of his hands."
toddmoonbounce 08/06/2020 21:48
Not sure of Kite's reaction or own thoughts on the situation, Adorhi begins to probe about what he knows while also filling the clone in on what she knew of the effects the Star had over her. "I'm guessing you've realized that physically coming in contact with the relic is bad news. I got careless in the moment when I went to take it back from Barin and that's when it got me. Separation seemed almost instant though. I remember in my dream, feeling so many dark emotions and then nothing. I assume that was when you were able to take the Star from me. As long as we can get it out of Test's range for a bit, I'm certain he'll come out of it just as I did." (edited)

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 08/06/2020 22:17

Rick Fisto 09/06/2020 18:41
After a long and surprisingly dreamless sleep, Test opens his eyes. In the middle of his vision: a tool box. He wanted to go check on the Star and make sure it was still in there. Of course it was; how could it not be? But he really should double check. No. It's there. I don't need to see it. Small steps. After finishing the water in his canteen and refilling it from the sink, Test resigns himself to having to use the sink for all his liquid disposal this morning. Turning around, the toolbox remains. You're just some jewelry. Some fancy-pants force jewelry. Hell I don't even like jewelry. But it is really beautiful. And you know it's more than just jewelry. But I don't really know what it is. Maybe I can find out more. Test sits back on the bed, refusing to take it out of the toolbox, and starts to control his thoughts and reaches out with his feelings once more.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 09/06/2020 21:52

Rick Fisto 11/06/2020 18:17
Recalling the invisible barrier that seemed to surround Adorhi in their joint-meditation, and the voice that seemed to give advice, to encourage knowledge and defense over attack, Test reached out with his hands to feel for the barrier he feared would be around him. Adorhi had attacked it--tried to escape using main force. He had tried to attack it with his saber, resulting in similarly little good. He needed to probe the barrier and search for weaknesses. He would never be able to defeat this enemy without more knowledge. But he had time. He hoped he had 4 days where he couldn't hurt his friends but could devote himself to conquering this faceless enemy. 4 days to unravel at least some of its secrets. 4 days to free himself of this burden. Suddenly, inspiration took him. Knowledge and defense. I'm not stuck inside this barrier with you, Star. Your stuck in here with me. He focused all his will on creating his own barrier within the Star's barrier and centered around it, attempting to close it off from him. Perhaps lessening it's effects on him and cutting of the exterior barrier from its source.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 11/06/2020 19:11

Rick Fisto 11/06/2020 21:40
Once we get back, there'll be enough of them to take you from me. You know they want to do it. If I can convince them that I've beaten you, maybe they won't take you from me. Kite will still want to, but I can convince the others that it is too dangerous. That you are too beautiful and terrible and powerful. He won't be able to stand up to all his brothers, and I will be able to keep you. So how do I convince them that I've won? If I offer to allow Adorhi to jettison you, Kite will stop her. But they'll believe I've beaten you. When the ship's clock is reading well after nightfall and Test is convinced the others must be asleep, he attempts to cut the tiny weld holding the hatch shut and take the Star, in its tool box, to an escape pod. RisenZed 17/06/2020 00:34

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 18/06/2020 19:01
Kite's blood runs cold after hearing Test shout that Adorhi wants the Star for herself. During his time on Tatooine he had witnessed addicts lie countless times, to try to get a fix of their chosen vice. And he is near positive that is what's going on with Test. For whatever reason distance hasn't helped him as much as the others. Kite worries about the risk of trusting Adorhi but thinks she can still be useful. After sprinting through the halls he reaches the escape pod and grabs the Star. Wishing that the Galley wasn't next to the bridge he continues on to the engineering section of the ship. (edited)
toddmoonbounce 18/06/2020 19:19
Without a clue of what she was trying to attempt, Adorhi went back to her meditation with Test trying to find a connection. Calling out to him in Togruta now. "Test. Is this what Haspin would do? Give in so easily to an evil power? It is no coincidence, you and I being brought together, surely you understand that. You have mentioned wanting to follow in his ways, learn what he knew." She reaches out a hand towards the clone in a gesture to come back into the galley with her. "This may not be the last, but it surely is one of the many tests you will have to face if you truly want to follow that same path as your former...Master." As she spoke the words, her heart felt an ache. This clone's...this human being's whole life so far has been a test. Something about density seemed so obvious to her now. "Fight the hold it has on you. Fight it and become the person you are supposed to be just as Haspin would have wanted."
Rick Fisto 18/06/2020 20:11
Test turns and runs, activating his saber.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 18/06/2020 20:26
Kite's heart drops as he hears the all to familiar snap hiss of a lightsaber activating. He runs options through his head and finds there isn't anywhere to hide on the ship, the saber can cut through any door like butter no matter how well Kite locked it. Seeing that he only has one play left he seals himself into the escape pod with the Star. He yells "Test you are being controlled, we are Mando'ad don't fall prey to kriffing jedi bauble. I've locked myself in here with the Star, if you try to cut through the door I will eject the pod. With us in hyperspace its unlikely that I or even the Star will survive. We can discuss as a group on Tatooine what we want to do next. But I would rather die than let you become a slave to the force"
toddmoonbounce 18/06/2020 20:45
Adorhi sits back down, hurting from not even a look back as she tried to reach the clone. She was emotionally drained and began to welcome the realization that Test was out of reach from them all.
Rick Fisto 18/06/2020 21:56
Test knows that Kite is bluffing and can't let himself and the Star go. Kite promised Prello. His honor won't let him do anything else. His honor is more important to him then anything. Certainly more important than some genetic duplicate. And now that he had somehow been touched by the force...been able, somehow, to reach out with the force and grab Kite's knife...well, he knew Kite would likely kill him given half the chance, with his hatred of the Jedi. Test stabs the blade into the hatch and begins cutting.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 18/06/2020 22:58
Kite hears the saber start cut into the hatch and smells the metal beginning to melt. He had faced death before and he wasn't afraid to die. But this wasn't the way he expected to go, either getting destroyed by the hyperspace fields or floating endlessly through space. Especially being forced into this situation by his own brother. He truly thought that Test, his brother, who has had his back since coming into this galaxy wouldn't do this to him. Force bantha podoo or not, Test was supposed to be stronger than this. Kite meant what he said, he would rather die than see his brother become a slave to the force. He takes a deep breath and steadies himself for the inevitable. Kite has his hand on the eject button when he sees Test's blade poke through the pod. He moves to eject the pod when he has an idea flash through his mind. Before he can truly think about it he lifts up the box containing the star and pushes it upward along Test's blade. Hopefully severing the Star.
Stormchaser 18/06/2020 23:07
The toolbox hisses as the blue beam of plasma melts straight through the thin metal container. There's a high pitched crack and then a tinkling noise from within. A rush of voices abruptly fills Test's head, making him stagger and drop the saber. He falls to his knees, his hands on his head and then there is silence. (edited)
Drake | Emperor 19/06/2020 02:05
Meanwhile on Ths Mad Line. "So there we were, trapped in the back of a Geonossian cave, with no way out behind us. hugehuman 19/06/2020 04:06

RisenZed 19/06/2020 06:17

"Haspin's mind trick confused the bugs long enough that Kite had time to sight up and shoot one. Not sure what he was aiming for, but his bolt must have hit some nerve cluster. The geonosian fired his sonic blaster into the ceiling right above him, his buddies, and the droids. The whole damn thing collapsed on top of them. Haspin kept the rocks off us, and when the dust settled, there was just the smallest sliver of sunlight peeking through the cave-in." He paused to take a sip of blue milk, then continued. Drake | Emperor 19/06/2020 06:27

Rick Fisto 19/06/2020 07:24

07:25

Stormchaser 19/06/2020 07:54

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 19/06/2020 14:27

Stormchaser 19/06/2020 14:39

Rick Fisto 19/06/2020 15:21

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 19/06/2020 16:41

The force corrupts everything it touches, remember that brother." Kite then pushes past Test and begins walking down the hall
Rick Fisto 19/06/2020 17:27

As he falls over onto the cold metal deck of the ship, his eyes try to focus on the lightsaber lying in front of him, but it remains blurred, undulating as every teardrop falls. Why? How could you let this happen to us? Why! Test mentally demands of the Force. But the Force seems to remain silent. How could I let this happen to us?
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 19/06/2020 19:34
Kite reaches the passengers cabin locks the door and falls into a chair. He sits trying processing everything that has happened the last two weeks. Giving up on making sense of it he finally takes his armor off. Disassembling it's pieces, confirming that everything is still in working order and then cleaning and buffing the gear. This is the first time he has been out of his armor in the last 3 days. Feeling lighter, but exhausted he drops to the bed and sleeps.
toddmoonbounce 19/06/2020 21:07
As if the clear display of disregard from Test wasn't enough, a few moments after a wave of anger and hate seemed to envelop Adorhi. Being all too familiar with the source of these emotions, she pushed against them as much as she could and fortunately they fell away. The dread of what, or who, caused this did not subside. "KITE! TEST!" Adorhi screamed as she ran out of the galley towards the rear of the ship. With no signs of either clone in the machine shop she continued to the cargo bay where she found a figure on the floor, huddled together weeping and distraught. Coming to rest at the clones side, Adorhi kneels down and in Togruta she softly speaks, "Test, it's Adorhi. Are you OK?"
Rick Fisto 19/06/2020 21:20
"No," Test replies. "No I'm not. I tried to take it from him. I would have killed him to get it. I betrayed him. My own brother." You're worse than the others. They thought they were doing right. Following orders. You are just some deluded, washed up, selfish, shell of a man. "He...he'll never forgive me. Adorhi, I...I think...I think I can use the Force, and Kite...Kite hates the Force....I...Adorhi, I'm sorry. I should have listened to you. It was just too much for me. I thought I could...it was just too much." At this, Test finally takes his red eyes off the saber lying on the ground and turns to face Adorhi.
toddmoonbounce 19/06/2020 21:42
"He will. If he can give my stubborn lekku a second chance, I'm certain in time he will be able to give you another chance as well." As she had told Kite, Adorhi tells Test about the strong unity and togetherness of the Togruta and drew a parallel to the clones. She reminds him of how that has been true of their squad since day one. It may not be in the next rotation, or the next ten, but with time she reaffirmed, this shall pass. "Test....I," she swallows hard trying to find the words. "Even in the unlikely event that Kite doesn't come around, I still need you. I...I don't think it was the Star...well maybe it's what set things in motion...but I've felt something as well." The Togruta stands up and offers her hand to help up the clone. "Let's figure this out together."
Rick Fisto 19/06/2020 22:15
As Adorhi tells him about her people, he realizes he never really spoke to Haspin about his past and his heritage at all. But the background makes sense of why Haspin treated the clones so well, like a small family. In a lot of ways, Test had thought of him as one of his brothers, too. Perhaps an older brother back from the Academy that he hadn't really grown up with, but had always looked up to and admired. When Adorhi informs him that she, too, might feel the Force, his spirits--already mellowed by merely talking with her and remembering the good times with Haspin and the squad--begin to lift. Maybe there was a purpose to this all after all. Maybe the Star was a necessary evil that we had to face. A test, even. And we went through it, starting or strengthening a connection to the Force. His resolve firming, his thoughts continue to reevaluate the situation, bringing him out of a darker place than he had thought he was capable of. Families fight. They make mistakes. But they do forgive. And they heal. And they grow. When Adorhi offers her hand to Test, and offers to "figure this out together," he looks up at her, reevaluating her again, seeing her in a new light with all of this new knowledge and all of these new experiences they've shared together--good and bad, painful and exciting, exhausting and bonding. He takes her hand, letting her help him stand. With a genuine smile in his eyes and determination in his gut, he says, "that's what families do, sister."
Stormchaser 20/06/2020 07:02
As Test lies in his bunk that night, dreams take him. He is stood upon the surface of a dead planet. All plant life has withered and decayed to dust and the rivers run dry. Haspin stands atop a rocky tor and surveys the landscape sadly. Test approaches the Jedi master from behind. "Why do you think yourself a traitor?" The Togruta asks without turning around. (edited)
Rick Fisto 20/06/2020 07:11
Test, holding both contradictory thoughts in his mind at once--that he is here with Haspin and that Haspin is dead--replies matter-of-factly. "Because I murdered you, sir. People deserve loyalty. Ideas deserve loyalty. The Government deserves...well I don't know what, but not loyalty. And I...I almost murdered Kite."
Stormchaser 20/06/2020 07:24
"Did you?" Haspin challenges, the question tinged with what could almost be surprise. "Why would you murder me, Test? Does that sound like something that you would do?" (edited)
Rick Fisto 20/06/2020 07:30
"Because I was ordeed to. Because... because Zed ordered me to. And I just...I did it like a good soldier," Test says, heaping audible scorn onto that last part.
Stormchaser 20/06/2020 07:37
"Or maybe because you never had a choice in the matter," Haspin whispers in return. His form disintegrates into the same grey dust that the rest of the dead planet is strewn with, rapidly flying away on the wind. Test feels an itch in the back of his head. It drives him to scratch and scratch, but the itch never ends. He claws his nails into the back of his skull until they come away bloody, and when he looks down at his hands he sees the remains of a tiny computer chip crushed in his palm. "You were never the traitor, Test," Haspin's voice whispers on the wind, "the Force will show you the truth..." When Test wakes, he finds blood on his pillow, although his head appears uninjured, except for a lingering itch on the same spot. (edited)
Rick Fisto 20/06/2020 21:31
Test goes to the hold to practice with his saber, avoiding Kite.
Stormchaser 20/06/2020 21:54
The atmosphere on the Messenger is tense and silent. The next two days in hyperspace feel like a fortnight, but finally the alarm in the cockpit does begin to beep, indicating that the freighter is approaching its destination. With a shudder and a jolt the swirling cerulean blue of hyperspace condenses into rays of light that shrink back into stars and the planet of Tatooine rushes into view... complete with an Imperial Star Destroyer looming overhead in orbit.
RisenZed 20/06/2020 21:59

hugehuman 21/06/2020 06:32
Shorlu wasn't very surprised the Imperials didn't take much interest in two random freighters, but was nonetheless relieved. If they really felt like it, they could accuse them of breaching whatever new Imperial law and cart them all away to Kessel, or even blow them out of the sky, with no one knowing or caring. He'd heard of it happening to many smugglers over his past 5 years of flying, as the Empire established itself beyond the Core Worlds. So he remained uncharacteristically tight-lipped, beady eyes darting between The Messenger ahead of them, the Star Destroyer, and the comms station, until they made it in-atmo. He relaxed then, smoothly initiating landing procedure after getting clearance. "Nice getup," he quipped to Zed. "Good that you're both thinking ahead, though." As they set down in the port, he doesn't get up right away with the others. The Imperial's presence here didn't make a lot of sense. What did they want with Tatooine? The only important entities here were... the Hutts. Suddenly, he's connecting all the facts in his head. Prello supposedly had a buyer lined up. The Empire had arrived here recently, and not in force; a single Star Destroyer was no blockade or occupying force on its own. They were likely here for something or someone specific, in Mos Eisleyâ€”they were orbiting it purposely. And then there was the nature of the Fell Star itself; it could drive someone crazy as soon as they touched it. Definitely a potent Jedi artifact, and the Empire would surely have interest in what the Jedi left behind. Maybe he was getting paranoid from lugging around this pirate gold. But it all fit too well. He'd bounce this theory off of the othersâ€”after they caught up. He gathers his things, slips on his jacket, and joins the others outside. (edited)
Stormchaser 21/06/2020 12:51

RisenZed 22/06/2020 15:26

toddmoonbounce 22/06/2020 22:32
As the Messenger lands, Adorhi can't help but feel a mix of emotions. After what seemed an eternity, she was back on Tatooine. Back to see Prello. They had been successful in their main task, finding Barin and bringing him back. But surely the Fell Star would come up and she wasn't sure what was the better route - truth or lies. That nervousness and anxiousness carried over to the reuniting with the other half of their motley crew. Would they forgive the Togruta for who, or what, she was under the influence of the Star? And would they trust that those dark effects were now gone? Opposite of all of that, Adorhi couldn't ignore the new feelings she was experiencing. Something bright and good. It almost made her self-conscious that she was maybe glowing from the unexplained change. As she finally made her way down the boarding ramp, she sees the others gathering on the Mad Line and moves to join them.
Rick Fisto 22/06/2020 22:54

hugehuman 22/06/2020 23:15

He's about to call out to him, but thinks better of it at the last second. He and Kite looked less friendly. Maybe if one of them's not in the same room, they'll be more open about things. It was another old trick in a detective's toolset: separate interrogations. He joins the others aboard the Mad Line instead, hoping Test only had some minor business in town. Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 22/06/2020 23:46

But contact with the star generally began warping the holders view of reality. Maybe the pieces will be enough for Prello"

Kite tries to assume a more relaxed position and takes a deep breath He didn't want to go into this, especially without Test present to speak up for himself. Drake | Emperor 23/06/2020 01:51

"Would she accept it being destroyed, if it meant us being alive and not killing each other? " he asks Adorhi and Shorlu, who had known her far longer than the rest of the crew. (edited)
Rick Fisto 23/06/2020 02:02
Test absorbs the information from the notice and continues on to their hover, relatively close by to the loud and poluted space ports they landed in. He heads toward Veets's place.
toddmoonbounce 23/06/2020 02:03
Adorhi turns to the Balosar to see where he stood on everything. "Barin? Any input?"
hugehuman 23/06/2020 03:47
Shorlu sits back after listening to Kite and Adorhi's account of the last few days. "Wow. I knew that thing was bad news but... wow." he closes his eyes and pinches the bridge of his trunk. All the rational skepticism in the galaxy couldn't combat this. The "Force" was not only real, but it was incredibly dangerous too. Maybe that's why the Empire wanted Jedi eradicated... or more likely, why they wanted them, and any Force-y objects, under their control. "Now comes the part where I complain, say how if I talked to her, the money Prello would've given for the Fell Star could've gone towards springin' Flynn, yadda yadda. But who cares, I'm just glad you all're okay." his eyes shine with a smile.
Stormchaser 23/06/2020 06:47
Barin looks stunned by the revelation. He's sat rubbing his fingers on his temples as he tried to process all of what was happened. "The- the last couple of nights I've been having dreams. Dreams of how we escaped the mines. Dreams of how when Sable almost killed Adorhi all I cared about was taking the star for myself... and now, since dropping out of hyperspace, it's all coming back. Like the Fell Star has lost its hold on me." He glances furtively at the box containing the scorched metal parts. "It's been destroyed. Adorhi is free. Test is free. I'm free of its influence. My mind is clear for the first time in days. The Star is gone. Maybe Prello will still pay for whatever is left?" (edited)
Stormchaser 23/06/2020 06:56
At the spaceport's exit, Test notices a black uniformed Imperial officer with a cadre of stormtroopers. They're stopping people as they leave and asking them questions.
Rick Fisto 23/06/2020 07:44
Test continues on, hoping that some reconnaissance will help the group avoid any unnecessary imperial entanglements.
Drake | Emperor 23/06/2020 08:59
"The better question is, will her client still pay for it?" Gauss responds with, to Barin. "Now that everyone is caught up, how about we find Testy and then go see Prello?"
Stormchaser 23/06/2020 12:57

hugehuman 23/06/2020 15:02
"Let me put it this way," Shorlu responds to Gauss's question. "We're probably better off not letting her know what we did to it, if we're gonna finish it off here and now." He looks around to Adorhi and Kite. "If that's you guys wanna do. Based on what you guys said, it sounds like a good idea to me. I don't think anyone should have this, especially not the Imps. It's your decision, but we should decide before we leave the ship." He scratches an ear before adding, "The other problem is, I don't know who her client is, or how they'll react to this thing in pieces. I'm gonna assume very poorly." (edited)
RisenZed 23/06/2020 15:11

We should leave the pieces here for now, on the Mad Line. We can return and dispose of them later. For now, we should hurry and catch up to Testy. Any objections?" Zed stands and slings his duffle over his shoulder. (edited)
Rick Fisto 23/06/2020 15:20
Test laughs in a good-natured way at the officer's request. "You get a lot of people with identification around these parts? The name's Test. What can I do for ya?"
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 23/06/2020 17:36
Kite is tired dealing with this whole endeavor has truly exhausted him. Part of him wants to push the point and at least try to come through on what they said they will do but he knows they will fight him and right now he doesn't have the resolve to argue the point. Also a part of him realizes that they are right. The Star nearly killed everyone on board the Messenger. And with its ability to give those who hold it a connection to the force it is too dangerous to fall into the wrong hands. So Kite decides to fall in with the Squad. He curtly says "Acknowledged" and backs away from the box.
toddmoonbounce 23/06/2020 17:40

RisenZed 23/06/2020 17:42

hugehuman 23/06/2020 17:57

toddmoonbounce 23/06/2020 18:12

hugehuman 23/06/2020 18:26

RisenZed 23/06/2020 18:27

After reading them, he turns back to the group, his mind racing. Did someone see Test use his lightsaber? He thinks back through their encounters prior to leaving Tatooine and remembers the kid that was managing the storage facility. Stang, Zed thinks. The little rotter must have squealed. Now we're in trouble. "We need to find Test," Zed says quietly, tipping his head ever-so-slightly at the notice. "Quickly." (edited)
Stormchaser 23/06/2020 22:09

Stormchaser 23/06/2020 22:36

hugehuman 23/06/2020 22:56

From here, his floppy ears can hear the stormtrooper ordering him to the wall. "Speak of the Sith." Getting an idea, he digs through his pack and pulls out a pair of binders. He goes running over, hooting in Huttese. "Oi, oi! Get back here, slave! Don't let him get away!"
Stormchaser 23/06/2020 23:07

hugehuman 23/06/2020 23:15

Stormchaser 23/06/2020 23:20

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 23/06/2020 23:20

hugehuman 23/06/2020 23:29

I can ask for something more official from my employer, if it's a requirement now." Shorlu adopts a deferent tone, looking down out of shame and swinging his trunk slightly, side to side.
Stormchaser 24/06/2020 14:36
The stormtrooper shakes his head in irritation and the officer walks over to see what the hold up is. "Is there a problem here?" He asks. "This alien and its slave have no identification, sir," the stormtrooper replies. "What's your business here?" The officer demands of Shorlu.
hugehuman 24/06/2020 17:32

Shorlu continues his pleading, drawing from stereotyped Ortolan characters he remembers from old holoserials. Stormchaser 24/06/2020 20:35

hugehuman 24/06/2020 21:54

'Cause it looked like you were about to get into it with an Imperial officer and his squad in broad daylight? I don't have to tell you that's a bad idea on the best of days, right?" He keeps his voice just barely above a harsh whisper.
Rick Fisto 24/06/2020 21:57

hugehuman 25/06/2020 07:04
"Alright, alright, just think ahead next time." Shorlu wiped a bit of sweat from his brow. Demeaning himself was part of his con, most of the time, since the galaxy never thought much of his species to begin with, where music wasn't concerned. It was what made him such a great detectiveâ€”one look at the bumbling, cheap tabac-smoking, meat pod-munching Lt. Podobo who waltzed into the interrogation room would leave suspects and witnesses underestimating him, without fail, which led to them unintentionally spilling their guts, or getting caught in a lie. It was all part of the plan to get them at a disadvantage from square one. With his track record, it was no surprise IntSec kept him on as long as they did. Still though, the ruse could get tiring, especially when it was improvised, and unnecessary when a more thorough plan could be formed. I need a tabac. And another round of sabaac. "Well, let's see this bachelor pad of yours, then. I hope you wired a cleaning droid ahead of schedule. There'll be a lady present, y'know." He wrinkled his brow in a bawdy kind of way. (edited)
Rick Fisto 25/06/2020 07:29

RisenZed 25/06/2020 16:49

Without waiting for the man to respond, he flashes his rank insignia at the officer. "I am IC-0089, on a deep cover operation. These are my team," he says, motioning at the others with him. "Just a warning, if you run my number or auth code, he is going to show up here, asking questions. And I don't think you want that, do you?" (edited)
toddmoonbounce 25/06/2020 18:28

She felt herself almost subconsciously trying to aid the Clone with his bluff beyond her usual physical manner. Figure this out together, Test's words echoed in her head. Whatever this was, she knew was powerful and would take a good bit of time to understand let alone control.
Stormchaser 25/06/2020 20:34

How long is it before his curiosity outweighs his fear of Vader? Zed wonders. We had better be long gone before that happens.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 25/06/2020 20:51

Rick Fisto 26/06/2020 08:09

hugehuman 26/06/2020 19:29
Shorlu takes in the sights and smells (recoiling at the smell, in particular) of the room as he steps inside. "That's true," he says, "I didn't." With a chuckle, he adds, "Maybe you chose the wrong ship, eh?" With a glass of water, he sits and passes the time telling Test essentially the same story he did to Gauss and Zed, of Flynn's help in his most trying time. But he decides to share a bit more about his regrets this time. Maybe because he's feeling a little worse about it, maybe because he was getting bored with telling the exact same tale, or maybe he felt obligated to tell Test a little more, since he was the first to ask. "Y'know, way before all that, I was engaged to the love of my life. Cutest little Chadra-fan you ever did see. Not many people can actually tell male from female with them, but I can. It's in the nose. Well, that, and she had kinda a cute way of wiggling her behind when she walked." He waxes nostalgically, before sipping his water with his trunk, and changing expressions. "I lost her, right around the time I left IntSec. She walked out on me, when she learned the kinda stuff I was getting up to with them." He seems deflated.
Rick Fisto 26/06/2020 19:34

hugehuman 26/06/2020 19:40

Rick Fisto 26/06/2020 19:42

RisenZed 26/06/2020 19:51

Rick Fisto 26/06/2020 19:55
Test bolts up without thinking, habitually replying, "Yes, sir," barely stopping himself from saluting.
RisenZed 26/06/2020 20:00
They exit the hovel and stand in the hot Tatooine suns a few feet from the door. Zed stares at the street before starting in. "So," he says. "Can you tell me what happened on the trip? I just want to hear it to see if I have all the facts."
Rick Fisto 26/06/2020 20:09
Test closes his eyes, rotating his head down left and then right, cracking the joints in his neck. "I think we all knew somethin' was up with Adorhi, so I got her to meditate with me...me and the Star. I was hopin' it would give me some insight into what was goin' on...maybe get her to trust me a bit so she'd give up the Star. Well, we sorta both had some vision...some shared experience...elsewhere. Well, she wasn't all there, Zed. She was sorta locked up...by the Star. So anyway, afterwards, Kite and I agreed we needed to take it from her. We did that, but it got to me then too. And I didn't want to let it go. Part of me thought I could tame it. Anyway, I tried to work through it, and I got some control over it for a time, but, well, not enough. And one thing led to another, and Kite had it in an escape pod, and the Star really got hold of me, and I tried to cut it open to get at it...at him. Well, he went and destroyed the thing using the blade that was comin' right for him. That broke it's hold on me. But...I almost killed him for it, Zed. I almost killed my brother."
RisenZed 26/06/2020 20:23
Zed listens to Test's story, taking in every detail. At the end, he lets out a long, slow exhale, using the excuse to blow the cool air up across his face. After a moment, he says, "I'm sorry that happened. That's a helluva thing to go through." He pauses, searching for the right words. He sees his brother hurting, torn up inside for what he almost did. But this was never his strong point. He begins to speak, stammering at first, but gaining a bit of confidence as he finds the right words. "Listen, I know you. I know that's going to eat you up inside forever. You won't let it go, not for a long time. But here's something you need to remember: what happened on that ship was not your fault. I'm not saying shift the blame to the star or the Force or whatever else. But you have to know that it wasn't you. You're a better man than that." He looks back towards the hovel. "The star KUBAR'd everything. It wasn't you. I know that, Kite knows that, and so do you. We're vode. No relic is going to change that."
Rick Fisto 26/06/2020 20:26
Test interrupts the end of Zed's statement by embracing his brother with a great big wampa hug. "Thanks, brother. That means a lot to me."
RisenZed 26/06/2020 20:38
"Urk-" Zed gives a sharp gasp as Test squeezes the remaining air from his lungs. He returns the hug, laughing as his brother releases him. "I know things are strained right now," he says. "But I think things are changing for the better. Feels like we've been stagnant for a while, ever since deserting. It feels good to get back into operating again." Zed's curiosity shifts to something that Test had said during his recounting of the trip. "You said you were...meditating? Does that mean that the Force is talking to you?"
Rick Fisto 26/06/2020 20:44
"I...I don't know. I thought it led me to those crystals in the cave...I mean, not at the time, but afterwards...it seems like a hell of a coincidence, you know? And then, when we were with the Star, I heard voices." Lowering his voice he says, "I heard, Haspin, Zed...but I don't know if it was really him, or just the Star. But it seemed like the voice was trying to help me. Anyway. I haven't heard anything since." (edited)
RisenZed 26/06/2020 20:48
"Haspin?" Zed says, excitement and fear and shame and regret all welling up inside him at once. "Did he say anything? I mean, I don't want to intrude if it was something meant for you. I don't really know how that Force stuff works."
Rick Fisto 26/06/2020 20:51
"Naw, it's ok. Nothing personal. He warned me against fear and arrogance. Good advice, for sure." Pausing, Test continues, "It's probably just nothing but...Zed, the night after this all happened, I had a weird dream." Test tells him all about the dream, and asks if he's ever had anything like it before or if he's ever felt anything weird about his head. (edited)
RisenZed 26/06/2020 21:26
Zed's blood ran cold. "Did they...put something in our heads?" he says. Suddenly, the back of his head felt very itchy. It had never made sense before, why Hammer Squad had been so willing to fire on Haspin. He couldn't remember his thought process from that moment. Every time he thought to hard on it, he kept coming back to a phrase that had been drilled into he and his brothers on Kamino: Good soldiers follow orders. "Good soldiers follow orders," he repeats quietly, but aloud. "I haven't ever felt anything weird in my head before. Certainly never dreamed about it. I'm not even sure what to do about it. It's not like we know a doctor or medtech that we trust enough to go rooting around in our skulls."
Rick Fisto 26/06/2020 21:35
"Maybe...do you think Shorlu might know something? Or maybe he could help us find out. I wouldn't even know where to start,"
RisenZed 26/06/2020 21:39
"I think that he's the type of guy that if, on the off-chance he doesn't know something, he knows a guy that does," Zed says with a chuckle. He motions towards the hovel. "C'mon, let's go tell the others and plan our next move."
Rick Fisto 26/06/2020 21:43
Test follows Zed back in.
RisenZed 26/06/2020 21:55
Zed busies himself with picking up the discarded take-out containers that never quite seemed to make it to the trash. He shoots a surreptitious glance at Kite, trying to get a read on how his brother was feeling. But, as always, the T-visor was a unfeeling visage of intimidation. After finishing up cleaning, he sits on one of the free stools and looks at the group. "So, we got Barin back," Zed says, motioning to the balosar. "We've completed our mission for Prello. We don't even mention the star when we get to her. Obviously, she'll be disappointed, but happy that you're alive, Barin. After that, we need to talk about Ryder and the job Adorhi got us at Point Nadir." He pauses, waiting to see if anyone had anything to add before he got to the thing about the chips. That was going to be a big deal, and he wanted to get everything else out of the way first.
hugehuman 26/06/2020 22:08

RisenZed 28/06/2020 08:20
"Before we go," Zed says, extending a hand in a hold-up gesture. "Hammer Squad, Test told me something and the rest of you need to know." He takes a deep breath, and looks at Testy. "Test?"
Rick Fisto 29/06/2020 01:41
Test tells them of his dream.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 29/06/2020 03:01
Kite is unsettled while hearing Test describe his dream and how the control chips were the reason they followed through on order 66. Test is not handling the stress well, between order 66 and the Star taking control of him. He is grasping at straws to find ways to deflect the guilt Kite removes his helmet and says in a sympathetic tone "Vod, the vision was probably the Star's influence. You & Adorhi know better most how much that kriffing thing can impact your life. Hell after it was destroyed, I heard a voice in my head say some bantha podoo about a true war. It's just the Star using it's last legs to stir up conflict. We all made a choice to do what we did. Like it or not."
RisenZed 29/06/2020 03:04
"Kite," Zed says. "I know you don't trust the Force. You have good reason to. But think about it: we trusted Haspin. He was our friend. And we killed him without a second thought. Why would we do that?"
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 29/06/2020 03:27
Kite almost flinches and looks rattled. He didn't think Zed would buy into this craziness. "We followed orders as we had been trained our whole lives to do. They had orders for every contingency, hell order 65 was to remove the Chancellor. Which if I had been in position to carry out the order I would have done so, because it was my duty and my choice. If the jedi were smart they would have issued that order vs going for a halfcocked assassination. We didn't get many choices in our lives, we were bred for war and forced to become soldiers, but we aren't droids. Every choice after joining the GAR was ours to make." He looks around the room and makes eye contact with each of the clones and says in more apologetic tone "I know I'm the odd clone out on this, I've tried and failed at being respectful of this. But we did what we did because believed it to be a lawful order." Kite sighs and adds "It won't hurt to check, we can use some of our funds to have a medcenter scan our brain, and finally put this to rest once and for all" (edited)
RisenZed 29/06/2020 03:47
Zed knew this would be difficult. Kite was a good soldier. A good man, but he believed in what he could see. "I've regretted doing it ever since that day, and I can't put my finger on why I relayed the order. I've regretted it ever since. It...it keeps me up at night to this day." He pauses, taking a deep breath to steady himself. "I know you don't want to believe it," he says. "Neither do I. The thought of them controlling us...it's revolting. I'm not a droid. I think when I get orders. I consider them. But I don't remember stopping to consider it when 66 came in. I just followed the order. That....it just doesn't feel right, and if Test's vision is true, then...well...thanks for being willing to check."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 29/06/2020 05:41
Kite don's his helmet again, placing the unreadable Mandalorian helm between him and the Squad. Internally he was distraught, near praying that Test was wrong. If they could be controlled they were no better than the droids they fought for so many years. He stands slinging his rifle over his shoulder and says "Lets solve the mess in front of us first, and get Barin to Prello. But we will check into this, and if this wild bantha chase somehow proves true. You have my word, we will make both the Kaminoeans and the Empire pay. We are not kriffing Clankas, to be programmed."
RisenZed 29/06/2020 05:48
"If it is true," Zed says, rising to head for Prello's, "They'll never know what hit them."
Rick Fisto 29/06/2020 06:15
Test was so much more comfortable with Kite now again wearing his helmet. He couldn't bring himself to look Kite in the eye, which only deepened his shame. As they headed out for Prello's he took up his normal point position, leading the way, if not the squad. They were all on heightened alert because of the increased imperial presence, and, just in case they were expected, he led them around to approach Prello's from an unexpected direction. As they approached, Test pulled up short, a ways back in a low trafficked area and motioned for Kite to sneak up and get at least a little height to check for signs of ambush.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 29/06/2020 15:48

Stormchaser 29/06/2020 16:28
The streets of Mos Eisley are unusually quiet. Perhaps it's just the heat today... or more likely the unwanted Imperial presence in the city. For those used to the usual hubbub of the desert city, the quiet is almost oppressive. The sight that awaits the group at Prello's townhouse is equally unpleasant - Imperial stormtrooper stand guard on either side of the front door.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 29/06/2020 16:34

hugehuman 29/06/2020 16:49

RisenZed 29/06/2020 16:51

Stormchaser 29/06/2020 17:23
Lurking in the shade beneath a porch across the street, a dust-covered 3PO droid steps out into the sun. The sunlight betrays its once shining plating. "Master Test," he says quietly. It is C-4RL's voice!

RisenZed 29/06/2020 19:22

They hadn't spoken, merely shown their identification and sent Hammer's mission screeching to a halt. And they report directly to Vader, he remembers. We are ani'a osik'la. Completely. Screwed. Stormchaser 29/06/2020 19:48

hugehuman 29/06/2020 20:02

Stormchaser 29/06/2020 20:03

RisenZed 29/06/2020 20:11

When Kite rejoins the group, they head through the nearly-deserted streets to the spice-infested cantina. The suns and the silence are both oppressive as they trudge through the sandy speeder lanes. (edited)
Stormchaser 29/06/2020 20:27
One of many seedy cantinas sprinkled liberally throughout Mos Eisley, the Woodoo Dunes is a run-down venue in the east of the city. Its clientele includes lower-class day labourers from the docking bays, as well as street hooligans and small-time spice dealers. The cantina features little in the way of security and its missing front window has been replaced by a sheet of sand-worn alloy plating. The furniture has been cobbled together from several different sources and even the bar looks to be made from thin sheets of scrap metal that have been painted with industrial-quality starship paint. The occupants consist of a few workers scattered around the bar, four gang members huddled around a table and a single Twi'lek sitting in one of the three booths. "That's him," Barin confirms. The Twi'lek's face is a bit too ashen and a bit too thin to seem wholly healthy. His yellow eyes are dilated slightly and he licks his lips nervously. He's dressed in fine robes that haven't seen a washing in some time and he drums his overly long fingernails on the booth tabletop habitually.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 29/06/2020 20:31
Kite scopes out the room and looks at Barin "Barin are you willing to introduce us? Also It may be best if we approach him with a smaller group, we don't want to spook him. Maybe have Adorhi & Shorlu go, since they are both known to be associates of Prello" (edited)
RisenZed 29/06/2020 20:39

RisenZed 29/06/2020 20:47

hugehuman 29/06/2020 20:58

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 01/07/2020 03:20
Kite nods and seeing that his companions are heading that way decides to wait at the bar until they finish their business before approaching
toddmoonbounce 01/07/2020 05:15
Adorhi was still processing the sight of Prello's residence swarmed by Troopers. They both generally kept to themselves and turned a blind eye towards each others efforts. But this was different, very different. Her heart ached at the thought of Prello being in trouble. Talking to C-4RL might have help ease her concern but things had moved so fast and before she could he was gone and her and her new companions were on the move as well. The distraction holding strong, it took the second time of hearing Barin's segue into talking with Cel for her to snap out of it. "Oh...yes, sorry...," the Togruta said with a slight shake of her head. "Cel, always a pleasure," Adorhi said dryly turning to the Twi'lek, quickly getting back to the sarcastic front she so often leaned into. She definitely had a thing for Twi'leks, the other variety at least, but Cel was enough on his own to do damage for his whole species. Sure she was essentially a thief herself, but a lot of what Cel dealt in was much more vile. The toll that spice had on a person was something she would never wish on anyone. Adorhi did her best to swallow her pride though and tried to continue in a more pleasant manner. Whatever it took to make sure Prello was safe she was willing to do.
Stormchaser 01/07/2020 20:43
"Adorhi," Cel replies slowly. "I thought you two were off-world," he adds, glancing at Barin.
toddmoonbounce 01/07/2020 20:46
"We were, yes. But now we're back." Adorhi replies fighting back impatience. "Where's Prello?"
Stormchaser 01/07/2020 21:24
Cel glances about at the cantina's other occupants, before nodding conspiratorially to Adorhi. "Follow me," he tells the two thieves, leading them out a back door besides the bar. On the other side is a short set of steps down into small sandy yard, walled in on all sides by the surrounding buildings. Aside from a table, chairs and a skip for waste, it seems pretty empty. Cel glances about again, before heading to a blank portion of wall to the left of the door that they just came out of. The Twi'lek crouches and flicks a hidden switch, opening a hidden door to a new flight of stairs that leads down underground. He gestures to Adorhi to go ahead.
toddmoonbounce 01/07/2020 21:55
Feeling out with her montrals, Adorhi cautiously steps forward at the direction of the Twi'lek.
hugehuman 01/07/2020 22:22
Right behind Barin, Shorlu steps inside as well.
Stormchaser 01/07/2020 22:39
Underground the air is unusually cool and as Adorhi, Barin and Shorlu go deeper they can hear the distant sound of flowing water and classical violin. At the top of the stairs, the door closes behind them with a gentle hiss and a thump. The downward passage ahead is dark, but the bottom is illuminated by a small pool of light that opens up into a more spacious lobby when the stairs end. The lobby is decorated with potted tropical plants and a small wooden coffee table flanked by sofas in the middle of the room. A pair of Gamorreans stand guard by one of the doors on the far side of the room, but they wave the trio through. On the far side, Prello the Hutt lounges in an audience chamber atop a pile of silk cushions. She reaches out towards her guests when she sees them. "Adorhi! Barin! You have returned to me!" She declares.
hugehuman 01/07/2020 23:15
Shorlu gives a little wave to Prello as he reveals himself from behind the two taller sentients. "Not like I had anythin' to do with it. Good to see ya, Your Worshipfulness." He bows extravagantly, holding his trunk like a sash.
Stormchaser 02/07/2020 07:20
Prello cracks a wide slimy smile like only a Hutt can. "Of course, thank you too, Shorlu, for returning them to me. Where are your military-minded companions?" She hesitates a moment more as she peers around the trio. "Where is Rider?"
hugehuman 02/07/2020 07:37
Shorlu huffs, drawing near to her makeshift dais of pillows. "The others are keeping watch outside. As for Riderâ€”that, ma'am, is a bit of a story. And not a terribly happy one. Adorhi & I'll tell you all about it, but I was hoping you could have your happy reunion first, before we got to that." He eyes the delectable candies on the table hungrily. "You weren't gonna eat those all by your little self, were ya?" Before anyone knows it, he's plopped down in front of the table, sucking candies one by one through his fingers, savoring the taste. This leaves his trunk open for polite conversation. "So I take it when the Imps came knocking, your plan was to grab some guards, go to the Woodoo Dunes, have a nice cold pint, and wait for all this to blow over? Good plan. It's what I'd do." (edited)
Stormchaser 02/07/2020 21:23
"...yes," Prello begins slowly, slightly perturbed by the chatty Ortolan. "The Inquisitor is searching for your friend with the lightsaber. Is he in Mos Eisley?"
hugehuman 02/07/2020 21:43
"Well, yeah," Shorlu began, coming down from his sugar rush. It'd been so long since he'd had candy, especially some this good. He weighed his options, choosing his words with care. He doesn't want to sell Test out, but he doesn't want to lie to the Hutt he desperately needs help from. "He came back with us, but he's laying low. Hid the lightsaber. He hasn't been recognized yet, but we're taking precautions. Why uh... do you ask?" (edited)
Stormchaser 02/07/2020 22:04
"I prefer my operatives remain unmolested, of course," Prello answers reproachfully. "He should not take the threat of the Inquisitor lightly... but let us speak of happier things. Barin, darling, come here. Are you unharmed?" Barin moves closer to Prello and she fusses over him for a few moments, clearly happy to have the Balosar returned to her.
hugehuman 03/07/2020 06:03
Even though it's a Hutt he's talking too, Shorlu can't help but feel a little ashamed at her response, especially after seeing her fawn over Barin the way she does. "Yeah, of course. Sorry for uh... well, sorry." Showing incredible restraint for an Ortolan, he fully backs off of the sweets after eating only half of the ones on display. Once the time is right, he begins explaining what happened with Adorhi, leaving the bits about finding the Star out.
toddmoonbounce 03/07/2020 15:51
She should have been overwhelmed with joy to see Prello but it just wasn't there. There was something very different about Adorhi since coming back from Port Nadir. Hearing the Hutt's words about her operatives sent a shiver down the Togruta's spine. She didn't carry the physical weapon in question like Test's but she was pretty sure the new presence that seemed to consume her would also be a target of these Inquisitors. Stepping towards the Hutt, Adorhi reaches up to hug her good friend. As tears of relief and confusion well up in her eyes, she says to Prello, muffled within the Hutts embrace "I'm so glad to be back with you." After a deep sigh and in an even quieter and more muffled voice, she says, "I'm so sorry."
Stormchaser 03/07/2020 21:58
Prello looks at Adorhi with concern as she holds her in her arms. "Why, whatever for, little one? You have both returned to me. You did as you promised." (edited)
toddmoonbounce 03/07/2020 22:16

Stormchaser 03/07/2020 22:18

toddmoonbounce 03/07/2020 22:22
"I'm not sure, not really sure at all." Pulling back from Prello, Adorhi's expression tightens up a bit with a bit more of a serious tone, "What are you doing in hiding? Are you leaving Tatooine?"
Stormchaser 03/07/2020 22:27
A cunning smirk spreads across the Hutt's face when Adorhi asks this question. "Yes. The Empire has endangered my operation here. I will travel across land to the far side of the planet and leave from the opposite side to the Cumulus to escape notice. Tell me, Adorhi, what's Zietta's standing currently like on Point Nadir?"
toddmoonbounce 03/07/2020 22:38
Adorhi relays what she knows and looks to Shorlu for any details she may have been forgetting.
hugehuman 04/07/2020 01:33
Shorlu nods and explains what they learned about the power structure on Point Nadir. "So, this is where what happened with Rider comes in. I went looking for him, and found himâ€”in a fight club. Some gangster by the name of McCarthyâ€”real piece of workâ€”claimed he owed him 14 grand, and he was gonna keep him in the ring till he got it." "Now Flynn never told me about this personally, and I haven't met this McCarthy till today. But with his usual carefree attitude, I don't find it hard to believe." Shorlu, quite sober and sincere, bows his head to Prello. "Ma'am, I don't presume to ask you for money you can't spare, 'specially in what's become a trying time. But I gotta ask if there's any kind of help you can send our way. When last I saw him, Flynn was getting the tar beat outta him. He won't last long. Blastin' our way in and bustin' him out is an option, but as you can understand, Point Nadir is a hot zone for us now. Sable Dawn is out to get us, and they own a third of it. We gotta pick our battles carefully. And McCarthy, though I hate to say it, could even be useful to us, if we can sweep this mess under the rug. He's entrenched on that rock. We could get him to do us a favor or two." He lowers his head a little more, looking at the floor now. "And I wouldn't want druk to go downwards and for Flynn to wind up dead anyway, 'cause we mounted a premature rescue plan."
01:35
Finally, he lifts his head and awaits her response, his keen, beady eyes trained on her.
Drake | Emperor 04/07/2020 07:33

Stormchaser 04/07/2020 18:42
"Eventually," Prello tells Kite with a nod, "but Mos Eisley is no longer a safe harbour. I intend to escape notice by travelling across land by sandcrawler, until sufficiently far from the Cumulus's position to take off safely. It will not be an easy trip. I could use a capable squad of recon commandos."
RisenZed 04/07/2020 18:57
"We might be able to help with that," Zed says. "Any idea what they're requiring for off-world travel from the spaceport? Seems like security is pretty tight."
Stormchaser 04/07/2020 19:05
"The Cumulus has assumed control of outgoing air traffic," Prello explains. "Only one heading is permitted and all launches must be preapproved. They have customs officers checking for licenses and contraband and anything that falls out of line is impounded and fined." (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 05/07/2020 02:14

Stormchaser 05/07/2020 10:41

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 05/07/2020 15:25
Kite is bewildered Prello can't be serious, there is no way the Hutt can believe she can topple the imperials. Stormchaser 05/07/2020 15:36

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 05/07/2020 16:10
Kite nods Between the ISD in orbit and Test's story about the control chips, I've been fixated on the empire to the point of distraction. Of course she would be talking about point Nadir. Prello isn't foolish enough to go up against the Empire. As soon as we have time, we need to confirm that Tests vision was a bunch of bantha Poddoo. I have to put this behind me He then clears his throat and says "Of course, apologies the ISD in orbit has imperials on my mind" He then realizes Prello has them in a bit of bind, she has proven herself to be a loyal to her operatives. But Kite isn't sure if she considers the squad part of her so called family. She knows that we are deserters and that Test is the one the imperials are looking for. She could easily sell us out to make life easier for herself. He then realizes she is toying with him, but he isn't sure to what end. He stands up a bit straighter and breaks the situation down "Hammer is loyal but we aren't foolish. I respect that you are willing to put your resources to bear to protect your people, that is a level of honor that is not typically present in the Hutt Kajidics. But your cousin has a stronger position in your clan and more resources to bring to bear. You need us because we are highly capable soldiers, that won't sell you out to your family for a payday. Finding soldiers for hire of our caliber that you can trust is no easy feat. This would be a mutually beneficial partnership, and I would hate for you think less of us for accepting a low ball offer. So what is controlling Point Nadir worth to you?" (edited)
Stormchaser 05/07/2020 21:59
Prello laughs lightly at Kite's negotiating gumption. "That's why I want you boys on retainer. This isn't a simple lump sum. Your equipment is clearly in need of upgrades, which I will provide a budget for. Room and board is covered by my organisation. As for yourselves... shall we say two thousand credits each, monthly? Speaking of which, I believe payment is due for the return of my beloved Barin..." The Hutt presses a hidden button and a secret compartment opens in the top of the coffee table where Shorlu is sat with the Turkish delight. Inside is a terminal for loading credit chips. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 05/07/2020 22:04

RisenZed 05/07/2020 22:09
Zed sees Kite's nod and says, "We've got a few other jobs in the hopper, and we're paying rent on a ship from another party on Point Nadir. How long would this retainer last?" He looks to Adorhi. "Did your contact give you any time frame on that Lucrehulk job?"
toddmoonbounce 06/07/2020 16:55

Stormchaser 06/07/2020 21:55

hugehuman 06/07/2020 23:14

Rick Fisto 07/07/2020 15:14
Test follows Shorlu's lead.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 07/07/2020 15:28
Kite steps in line behind Tests, his mind is already going through the gear he wants to pick up. Going up against Sable's force users and potentially the inquisitors seems like it may be more of a common occurrence going forward. He needed some new tricks to help over come the force ability gap, especially if they start using lightsabers
toddmoonbounce 07/07/2020 16:17
"I was searching for information. Anything to get us closer to finding Barin, and as fast as possible. We did a small escort job for him on the rock and then he offered a bit more lucrative second, which is apparently a key motivator to the rest of the group." Adorhi motions to the others collecting their pay. Adorhi had come around to the clones and ortolan quite a bit but a few days wasn't going to erase years of past experience or feelings. She was extremely annoyed at Kite's jump to reimbursement. Everything is just a payout to them, she thought to herself. If not for the strong arm twisting, there's a good chance he would have still turned the Fell Star over to Prello simply to earn an extra tip. Could she be certain that if it came down to completing the job or saving her that they'd pick correctly? Correctly for her, that is? Catching herself in a daze, Adorhi gives a slight shake of her head to try and clear her thoughts. Trust won't happen overnight, she reminded herself. Turning to Shorlu, she says, "He gave us two weeks for the Lucrehulk job." (edited)
hugehuman 07/07/2020 17:14
"Two weeks. Must be their favorite measurement of time on that rock," Shorlu muses, recalling the imposed time limit for Rider. "Well, we'll definitely have to handle that on the way back, then. If we're getting gear while we're here, we can take that into account. Prello, what'd you have in mind for our pilot friend?"
RisenZed 07/07/2020 17:17
Zed was the last to collect his payment. He nodded as Adorhi answered his question and mentally tallied up the things they needed to do. Rescue Rider, hit the Sable HQ on Point Nadir, salvage the Lucrehulk, and now possibly get Prello off Tatooine and oust her cousin from power on Point Nadir. We're busy people. (edited)
Stormchaser 07/07/2020 20:47

Stormchaser 14/07/2020 13:06
"Of course, my dear," Prello replies, placing an arm over Adorhi's shoulder and slithering away in the opposite direction to the departing clones. "What's on your mind?"
toddmoonbounce 14/07/2020 16:43

"Something about me is different, Prello. I think the Star woke it up." She had yet used the term the Force. She was well aware of what it was, but it seemed such a farfetched idea that she would ever have such power herself, regardless of how small. "I'm worried that I have now become a liability. To you, to the others. I'm lost, Prello. I don't want to lose those that I love again but sticking around might do more harm." Adorhi trails off amidst a flurry of sobs as she continues to internally struggle with where her next path will take her.
Stormchaser 14/07/2020 21:26
Prello sighs and sits with Adorhi in her nest of silk cushions and drapes as the tale is told. "Little one..." she murmurs, reaching out to caress a montral. Her big eyes are full of empathy. "Do not fear. If what you say is true, then you have been given a gift. This is not something to cast aside. Think of all the ways that this could empower you to help your new friends. Be careful, yes, but this is something to explored and treasured, not locked away inside. Beware only the Empire. Act in secret and do not draw their eye. Forge your path together with us."

Stormchaser 17/07/2020 22:11
The coordinates to Kricket's workshop lead to a sandwich shop built out of the same abode material as much of the rest of the town. A bent corrugated iron sign declares it to be The Knuckle Sandwich. There are a few patrons inside enjoying what look like very loaded and juicy sandwiches served by verpine staff.
RisenZed 17/07/2020 22:20
Do Verpine even have knuckles? Zed wonders as they approach the stand. The smell of the meats and accoutrements of the sandwiches remind him just how hungry he actually is. But the stormtroopers they had spied patrolling the streets on the way to this sandwich shop and the looming presence of a Star Destroyer in orbit reminded him that this was decidedly not the time for a snack. Approaching one of the Verpine staff, he gestures to the sandwiches and says, "I've been told the sandwiches aren't the only thing that's fully loaded. Can I talk to Kricket, please?"
Stormchaser 17/07/2020 22:25
One of the Verpine looks at another and they exchange a series of clicks in their insectoid language, then the first nods and leads Zed and his friends downstairs to a black metal door. There's a knock, followed by more clicking from the other side and then the door opens to reveal an older looking Verpine wearing a welding mask and working on an armoured exoskeleton that hangs from a frame. The entire room is a maze of rickety metal shelves laden with tech and equipment. "Ah, yes, Prello's associates. I am Kricket. Come in, come in. I've been expecting you." Kricket waves towards a shelf behind him loaded with items that the group have requested from their benefactor. "You also have some special requests, yes?"
Rick Fisto 17/07/2020 22:29
"Yeah, I was hopin' you might have tools we could use that might be hard to find these days. We got a job that might run us across some old Jedi weaponry, and it'd be great if we could get some tools to strip those down nicely."
hugehuman 18/07/2020 00:32

The best thing about there being numerous Hutts on Tattooine is that they often hired Mandalorians, at least enough to keep the bar in business. The place had a strict no buy'ce (helmet) policy, and is one of the few places Kite feels comfortable in without wearing his full kit .
