"Might be too late on that count," Zed says. "I say we try to exit out the back, and maybe hit the rooftops. Any other bright ideas?"
Stormchaser 01/08/2020 17:12
A sharp metallic tapping noise announces the arrival of a small human boy knocking on the back door.
hugehuman 01/08/2020 17:23
"That might be our best bet," muses Shorlu. Having given the apartment a once over with Kite, he pulls up his britches, but stops as hears a tap at the door. He looks to the others and jerks his head, signaling he'll check it out. He cracks the door at first, then opens it a little wider when he sees it's only a boy. "Hey, kid. Veets is out. Whaddya need?"
Stormchaser 01/08/2020 17:26
"Who're you?" The kid asks Shorlu with a frown. "Are you with the clones?"
hugehuman 01/08/2020 17:31
"Name's Shorlu Podobo. But that's Mr. Podobo to you. And yeah, I'm with them." He opens the door up wide so the kid can see Zed and company. "You guys know this kid?" (edited)
RisenZed 01/08/2020 17:33
Zed leans against the doorframe. "Hey, Brook," he says. "Any idea where Veets is?"
Stormchaser 01/08/2020 17:35
"Where've you been?" Brook asks, glancing about to see if anyone else is watching. "Imps came looking for you - dragged Veets off, because he wouldn't tell them what they wanted to know. Do you really have a lightsaber?!"
hugehuman 01/08/2020 17:38
Shorlu groans, and ushers the kid inside, shutting the door behind him. (edited)
17:40
"Really a local celebrity now, eh Test? Hoo, boy."
RisenZed 01/08/2020 17:45
Zed swallows. This was bad. Veets wasn't the type to suffer fools, but who knew if he could stand up to "enhanced interrogation" techniques that quickly became commonplace after the Empire took over. Not that Zed was only worried about himself and his brothers. He was worried for Veets. He didn't know anything about where they went, where they had come from, or much of anything about their daily life. He wouldn't be useful to them. And those that didn't end up being useful to Imperial interrogators often ended up dead. He looks at Shorlu, then turns back to Brook. "Alright, a couple things. We're clearing out. If the Imps come looking for us -- if they talk to you, you tell them the truth. Tell them exactly what you know. Don't try to hide anything. Tell your parents the same thing. We're leaving." "Do you have any idea where they took Veets?" Zed asks. Please don't say the Star Destroyer, please don't say the Star Destroyer.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 01/08/2020 17:48
Kite audibly groans, and adds "How long ago was Veets taken" Leaving unsaid that most beings lives don't last long when in imperial interrogation especially when an Inquisitor was present
Stormchaser 01/08/2020 17:52
Brook nods emphatically in response to Zed's instructions. "Yesterday. They took him to some old townhouse over on the west side."
hugehuman 01/08/2020 18:00
Shorlu pats his holster. "Alrighty then. Sounds like we're paying them a visit." He looks around. "What? If I didn't help you guys out with your pal, that'd make me a big blue hypocrite, right?"
RisenZed 01/08/2020 18:02
"Kid didn't need to know that," Zed says, sighing. He looks back at Brook. "Alright. Don't mention that last part unless they pry. Shouldn't matter in the long run anyway. We've got a saying: 'good soldiers follow orders.' Can you follow that order, soldier?"
Stormchaser 01/08/2020 18:25
Brook's nodding intensifies and he meets Zed's gaze as he repeats the mantra. "Good soldiers follow orders."
RisenZed 01/08/2020 18:27
Zed gives Brook a half-salute and opens the door. "Head on home then. Through the alley only. Don't let anyone see you coming out of here." He peeks out the door to make sure the coast is clear.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 01/08/2020 18:32

Stormchaser 01/08/2020 18:40

hugehuman 01/08/2020 18:42

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 01/08/2020 19:34

Rick Fisto 01/08/2020 19:54
Test bends down to pick up Mishy, luring her over with some dried meat from a ration pack. He always saved the little packets of dried mynock for her when he found those in a ration pack. They were in numbers 7 and 18. Although his own favorite packs were 2, 5, and 16, he always got a smile on his face when he opened a 7 or an 18, knowing Mishy would be getting a treat. "Time to go, Mishy. We're going to get you off this horrid world soon. And you are going to get a huge ship to roam around. Going to be much nicer than this little hovel." (edited)
RisenZed 01/08/2020 20:09
"Let's rest here and let Gauss get his tech up to specs," Zed says, moving back to his position at the door. "I'll keep watch."
Drake | Emperor 01/08/2020 20:33
"Sounds good to me." Gauss says before backing into the building, shutting and locking the door behind him. He then heads off to his apartment to check on Silver, his MSE-6 mouse droid. He finds it still bumping into random pieces of furniture and some tools here and there scattered on the floor. "Seems you have gotten yourself into a little bit of trouble Silver." he laughs at the droid, it giving a quiet beep of regret. "We bought a new droid who should be able to fix you up sometime, so you can stop running into stuff." he adds with a chuckle, before picking up his tools and sitting down at the workbench. "Now... lets get this thing upgraded." he says before taking out the wristpad upgrade materials and detaching his own wristpad from his arm. He begins to integrate amplifiers to improve explosive and ionic potency of the various devices and energy the wristpad projects. This takes him a full two hours to complete the modifications. "This should pack quite a punch now!" he exclaims to himself.
Rick Fisto 01/08/2020 20:48
Test bops their new droid on the nose as he strokes Mishy's back. Pointing at the sword propped in the corner and the plastic baggie full of parts resting on the floor next to it he asks, "can you do something with that?" (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 02/08/2020 02:56
Kite sits at Veets table and and brings out his new tracker droid. He connects a cable to the droid and his wrist pad. And begins to see a series of diagnostics pop up on his helmet's HUD. He then begins to use his new TDI program to sync the droid with his armor's operating system. After an hour the droid floats up and Kite can see the droids optics through his helm. He dubs the probe M.K and has it hover over him as he uses the last hour to install the new silencer to his Sniper Rifle. He finishes and slings the rifle over his shoulder and installs his new wrist launcher into his armor loading a plasma missile into it. And says to the squad "I'm 100% and combat ready" He looks at the power belt he got from Gauss and says "Thanks brother I think I will be able to put this to good use"
Rick Fisto 02/08/2020 03:09

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 02/08/2020 03:25
Hearing Test Kite takes off his helmet and sets aside his tools. Looking Test in the eye, he gives a small smile and says "Test we are Vodes, I know you have my back, you never have to apologize to me brother. Let's put all that force poddoo behind us." He extends his hand to Test
Rick Fisto 02/08/2020 03:38
Test grips Kite's hand and smiles, relief broiling off him like fog in the dune sea.
RisenZed 02/08/2020 18:36
Zed changes into Gauss' old armor as he keeps watch. Less bulky than his Katarn armor, still in his duffle, it was also far less recognizable. He resumes his post, singing softly to himself -- not nearly loud enough for anyone outside to hear, but probably loud enough that his brothers could. Kandosii sa ka'rta, Vode an. Coruscanta a'den mhi, Vode an. Bal kote, darasuum kote, Jorso'ran kando a tome. He sees Kite and Test shake hands. He didn't think for a second that the problems between them were over -- not with Test's new closeness to the Force. He hoped that Kite would accept it if Zed was right, and Test could use the Force in the same way Haspin could, but he was also too aware of his brothers' feelings on the matter to hold out too much hope. But Zed did hope with all his being that the Force was talking to Testy. He continued to sing to himself. (edited)
toddmoonbounce 02/08/2020 22:29
Finding a quiet area to herself, Adorhi works with her new techblades. Connecting to them as if they were a physical extension of her own hands. Learning their weight and balance. She had made her way around the hilt of a weapon like this before. Daesha was quite the blade dancer and they often sparred together. Adorhi thought back to those lessons, willing to give almost anything to have her back to show her in person. Adorhi shook away her thoughts before they turned further down a sad path and continued concentrating on the blades. As she did, something else seemed to come forward, some other...guidance. Feeling much more confident about her new additions, she turns to the others to see if they're ready to finish their errands. "So, instead of a cart that one of you bucketheads is going to have to lug around, what about one that can walk?" (edited)

Stormchaser 05/08/2020 11:33
Stormtroopers patrol the streets of Mos Eisley sporadically, occasionally stopping civilians for apparently random checks. With the eye of an experienced investigator, Shorlu is quick to pick out the pattern. Those selected out are all tanned and dark-haired - not dissimilar to his clone companions. (edited)
Stormchaser 05/08/2020 20:36
Most of the clones can move subtly enough amongst their allies to evade notice, but Test seems to very closely match the description that the Imperial ground forces have been given and before long draws the eye of one of the stormtrooper squad patrols...
hugehuman 05/08/2020 22:07
Shorlu slips along with the group, with himself, and most of the group keeping under the radar. But it looks like Test isn't quite able to keep as quiet as they are, and some stormtroopers seem intent upon stopping him, no doubt noting his appearance. Thinking on his feet, Shorlu edges over towards a couple of aliens loitering in an alcove, pretending to be stopping for a smoke himself. Picking up a pebble, he aims carefully, and flicks it at one of the stormtroopers approaching Test. The pebble arcs through the air, and ricochets off of the trooper's helmet with a satisfying donk!. Quickly, he darts around the corner, leaving the stormtroopers to believe the stone was thrown by one of the vagrants.
Stormchaser 05/08/2020 22:18
"You'll pay for that!" One of the stormtroopers announces angrily. "Stop in the name of the Emperor!" The squad moves in to arrest the vagrants and many of them scatter only to be grabbed by white-armoured hands. Some fight back, but are immediately beaten down with the stocks the stormtroopers' weapons. (edited)
Rick Fisto 05/08/2020 22:34
Test's heart starts beating as the troopers seem to take a notice of him, but as he looks away nonchalantly, he sees them all of a sudden move off across the street towards a group of vagrants. Initially relieved, Test turns to smile at Shorlu to find him missing. Looking around and not seeing Shorlu, Test now sees the troopers manhandling the vagrants and beating them with rifle butts. They are brutal and seemingly without any provocation. With the squad focusing on the vagrants now, and their backs to Test, he takes a step towards them, his hand going to his back where his new sword rests. (edited)

hugehuman 05/08/2020 22:46

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 05/08/2020 23:00

hugehuman 05/08/2020 23:37

So why can't I stop thinking about it? He almost felt like someone should be there just to be disappointed in him, and be his moral compass. Just not Adorhi or the clones. He missed Phu'ri, plain and simple. (edited)
RisenZed 05/08/2020 23:38

Stormchaser 06/08/2020 14:07
In the ensuing commotion, the clones have little trouble slipping past the patrol unnoticed. A short time later they arrive on the edge of town, where Kricket told them them they would find Houdini. Houdini's junkyard is a corrugated iron corral on the outskirts of Mos Eisley full of scrap, broken tech and slowly oxidising vehicles. A lone Jawa sits in an improvised metal lean-to with a shotgun across its lap. (edited)
hugehuman 06/08/2020 16:07

hugehuman 06/08/2020 18:06

Stormchaser 06/08/2020 21:52
"Kikikikiki," the Jawa chitters, tossing its shotgun to one side where it clatters against a pile of scrap and snaps in two, apparently made of only cheap plastic. RisenZed 07/08/2020 16:36
"We're here to buy," Zed says. "We're looking for a loader droid, or something of the sort."
Stormchaser 07/08/2020 16:59
"Mambay," the Jawa replies cheerfully. "Houdini cuawa da huat." Houdini guides his customers amongst piles of scrap until they come upon a battered old hauling unit. The designation ZX-11 is printed on the brass plating in faded white lettering. The Jawa extends his arms towards the droid as though to say there! (edited)
Bob | The Builder 07/08/2020 17:22
The jawa pulls a step ladder from a nearby pile of junk, clamoring up to stand eye to eye with the droids large, single ocular unit, he mumbles and coos in Jawaese to himself as he sweeps handfuls of dust and flaking paint off of the droids plating, revealing countless multicolored pieces of the droids plating that have been replaced over the years, the droid appears to be an old model of pincer hauling droid, common in the republic during the clone wars and easily recognizable. However the chaotic paint job of red, brown and blue armored plates seems distinctly different from what you know of pincer droids, and the plates of armor seem eerily familiar to the clones. The droids printed designation is written in white scratched paint over a large blue armored plate on his shoulder, Z_X-11, clearly missing some letters that have worn away over time. With the dust coating lifted by the jawa's hands, something else becomes visible, the insignia of the CIS has been painted over with this series of letters and numbers, with the blue armored plate giving the clones flashing images of droid gunships, and the rounded, armored plates of his body reminiscent of AAT armoring, as if the droid was constructed of scavenged parts from a battlefield of the clone wars. (edited)
17:25
Finally the Jawa sighs with relief, and flicks a switch on the back of the droids case, causing him to jolt to life, his massive legs shake at the joints as the droid raises itself to stand on it's own, releasing a cloud of dust from its moving parts and causing many supports to fall from where they had kept his torso and arms upright, the droids single, yellow eye darting around the room, taking in all he can of this strange group and his unfamiliar surroundings, the droid lets out a series of beeps and whistles (edited)
17:26
(In binary) Begining Restart Protocols: initiating self diagnostic
17:29
The droids circuits whirring inside his case, sparks flying from his joints as he tests movement and functions, testing the strength of his legs and opening/closing his pincer arms, after a few seconds the sound of movement inside the case slows, and ZX-11 let's out a satisfied woop Diagnostics: complete. . Results: Negative
17:32
Armor Integrity: Poor, reccomend replacement. . Mobility systems and Servos: acceptable. . Equipped defensive countermeasures. . Offline System diagnosis: Poor. . Memory corrupted, loading from default partition. . . . FAILED #####
17:35
The droids mechanical beeps and woops are replaced with a grinding KRrrrr noise directed from the inside of the droids processing unit, the noise stops after a few seconds, before the droid defaults to binary again Defragmentation: Conplete, ready for assignment the droid happily waits for instruction, his ocular unit darting around the room, looking at each of the clones & other members of the group.
Drake | Emperor 07/08/2020 17:43
"Well, at least we know its durability." Gauss says with a chuckle, looking at the various CIS droid plating attached to the loader. "What are your primary functions, droid?" He asks the amalgamation of armor.
Bob | The Builder 07/08/2020 17:46
"Default Primary Prerogative: Hauling & Maintenance" the droids memory circuits whirr inside the case for a few seconds before he finishes replying "Secondary Prerogative: Missing. . ERROR" (edited)
17:47
"Memory Corrupted, defaulting to Factory Settings" the droids case whirs and Krrrr's as his parts click inside his case (edited)
17:53
After a few moments of the droids memory working loudly, you hear a grating chunk sound, and a small metal piece falls through ZX-11's case, pinging as it hits the concrete flooring "Factory Default Partition: Corrupted, loading from emergency backup. . ."
Drake | Emperor 07/08/2020 17:55
"That's probably not good, or at the very least something that will need correcting." Gauss remarks to the various clanging. He then turns to the jawa, "Anything you can tell us about this droid? Maybe its previous owner or how it came to be in this state. And why it seems to be missing protocols?" he asks the small junker, as the droid continues its checkup. (edited)
Bob | The Builder 07/08/2020 18:01
The Jawa shrugs, the droid clearly has sat in this junkyard for more years than the jaws has been here, just by the amount of dust and rust on the droids case compared to the other junk piles scattered about and speeders chunked for parts. The droids circuits slow and quiet down, before letting out a series of boops and whistles, Emergency protocol: engaged. . Diagnostic: Complete. . Suggestion. . . Requires Immediate Maintenance, return to factory of origin on Corelia. . (edited)
18:03
The Jawa fiddles with his vocorder again, before the automated voice replies, This droid was here when I opened my shop, I had to disable it and its defenses, the first time I turned it on it tried to roast me. (edited)
hugehuman 07/08/2020 18:15
"Well, it sure ain't programmed for etiquette and protocol." Shorlu says, studying ZX's plating. With his careful eye, he estimates it's been through several generations of war.
Bob | The Builder 07/08/2020 18:18
Houdini types a few more keys into his vocorder, "As for its owner, who can say, droid's memory unit is glitched, and his partition was overwritten with code fit for a wardroid, don't let him fool ya, he's dangerous and has destroyed quite a few of my PIT droids while trying to work on him, but you look like a bunch that can take care of yourselves, and with the right programming and some fresh parts, this big boy can be exactly the skull cracker you're looking for." (edited)
18:23
The jawa types more into the vocoder, "But I'm looking to get this thing out of my yard, so I'd be willing to let you take it for real cheap, he just isn't worth the hassle to keep him from breaking all my other merchandise. So if you want him to become your problem, name your price and maybe we can strike a deal." (edited)
Rick Fisto 07/08/2020 19:45
"Huh." Test says skeptically, giving the droid an experimental kick in the shin. (edited)
Bob | The Builder 07/08/2020 19:54
The droid jolts with a quick step back, his whirring operational sounds increase in volume into a loud Erring sound of hard disks scratching away, as his ocular light changes from his default yellow to a hostile red light, leaving a pinpoint red dot visible in the center of Test's forehead, the droids normal binary beeping is replaced with something that sounds more akin to rapid alert sirens ALERT: HOSTILE ACTION DETECTED. . Surrender; or you will become =IMMOLATED The droid raises his right pincer forward, opening up his clanp-like manipulator, revealing a nozzle protruding from the "palm" of his grabbing appendage, lit by a small pilot light, the only exposed part of an internal flamethrower built into the arm of the loader droid
Drake | Emperor 07/08/2020 20:04
Gauss laughs at Test and the droid, "Looks like you angered it Test, maybe don't kick the big metal, possibly flamethrower equipped, machine?" "Don't mind him droid, he just wanted to make sure you're sturdy enough to handle our..." he pauses for a second "Tasks." "Do you have a designation?" Gauss had noticed the worn letters of Z_X-11, but he thought it better to ask if it had anything else. (edited)
Bob | The Builder 07/08/2020 20:09
The droid's servos slow and his ocular focus shifts from test's skull to Gauss, THREAT= Disarmed, defense protocol disengaged his arms lower to his sides, and his headlight returns to itself it's normal hue. Factory Designation: IW-37 Loader, Model number, NOT/FOUND the droids memory unit makes loud scratching noises as he searches his memory units for the correct information.
hugehuman 07/08/2020 20:18

REASON- My programming dictates I must fight to protect my servitors, and never surrender, engaging with any/all aggressors as long as I remain functional."
Drake | Emperor 11/08/2020 05:22

Bob | The Builder 11/08/2020 05:25

05:28
The droids verbal woots and bells become harsh and jarring as he discusses elimination, his ocular light flashing red and his central processor releasing small sparks and whirring, almost as if its excited, or filled with anticipation for his combat protocols to come fully online (edited)
Drake | Emperor 11/08/2020 05:30

toddmoonbounce 13/08/2020 21:08
As everyone took their positions within Ziza's shop, preparing for the ensuing fight, something in Adorhi's mind goes to a few of her companions. A push of encouragement and guidance to keep them focused. Their relationship wasn't completely solid yet but she still wished for success and against harm, but something seemed to amplify those thoughts and feelings. Scared and confused at first, Adorhi closed her eyes and with a deep breath like Test had shown her before, she let the feeling surface and flow out to those at the front of her mind - Test, Zed, and Kite. The Togruta, doing her best to concentrate on those thoughts, grabs the handles of her new blades and takes up position in a discreet area of the shop ready for what's to come.

Stormchaser 13/08/2020 22:31
Ziza's shop is dark and cramped. The ceiling is barely more than six feet and the main entrance is flanked by shelving units that extend five feet out from the door to a 'crossroads' of sorts in the middle of the small store. Shelves extend from the walls all the way up to the counter, leaving plenty of shadowy corners to hide in.
RisenZed 13/08/2020 23:35

Drake | Emperor 14/08/2020 17:35

Normally Gauss would say her name, but they couldn't afford to compromise the indentity of more of their group. (edited)
toddmoonbounce 14/08/2020 19:02

Avoiding Gauss' electromesh initially puts her slightly off balance and the first swing of her new techblade does only enough to put a scratch in the enemies armor. As the mesh continues to do it's job and hold the Troopers steady, Adorhi strikes true with her second blade almost taking her target down. With the would-be threat momentarily dazed from her hit and the mesh, she then steps away towards the sales counter finding cover behind another shelf.
Bob | The Builder 14/08/2020 19:22

ZX recalculates his next move as he realizes his attack had no effect, and raises his other manipulator arm high above the troopers head. The stormtrooper's visor turns to see the oppressive droid standing behind him, letting out a hushed scream as ZX brings his left pincer down in a forceful chop, denting his plasteel helmet as the trooper slumps unconscious to the floor. hugehuman 15/08/2020 08:15

Popping back up, he watches the lead trooper, who threw the grenade in the first place. Bob | The Builder 21/08/2020 20:10
ZX stops in response to Gauss, turning on his heels and walking back into the room; "Acknowledged: Recieving materials" The droid's chest plate makes a faint click sound, as it lowers open like a small hidden door, revealing a small cubby in the center, with exposed wires and turning gears visible from exposed internal parts all around the secret storage compartment. ZX reaches down, removing the utility belts off two of the troopers, placing them and their contents safely within the mess of wires and other parts in his chest cavity, while he places the unworn armor of a single trooper in the central chest cubby, closing the secret chamber with a hiss of hydraulic pressure.
20:11
As the hydraulics pull the armored chest plate back over the exposed internals of the droid, you hear the faint click again as the plate is secured in place.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 21/08/2020 20:14
As they go Kite passes off his pack with his Mandalorian armor to Gauss and says "Can't bring it with me, keep it safe for me vode" he then checks his riffle and prepares to head out.
Rick Fisto 21/08/2020 21:32
Test quickly drops his sword off with the droid and, retrieving his saber from Zed, stows his saber in his armor.
Bob | The Builder 21/08/2020 21:37
ZX takes the weapon from test gently with both of his pincers, examining its structure briefly. He keeps the blade held firm within his clamps for a moment as he scans the object before placing the weapon to rest on his back, suspended by a magnetic vibroblade sheath. (edited)
Stormchaser 21/08/2020 22:24
The streets are deathly quiet as Kite, Test and Zed step outside Ziza's shop. The commotion of combat has clearly sent any onlookers in the immediate area running to hide - unusual for Mos Eisley. However, the whine of ion engines overhead and the distant thrum of repulsors can be heard on the move. Imperial forces are inbound on this position.
Stormchaser 24/08/2020 15:57
Striding through the streets, the trio of clones appear to be nothing more than another patrol of stormtroopers. They are left unmolested as they arc around towards Prello's townhouse. The numbers of troops on the ground do appear to be increasing and several squads can be seen hurrying of in the direction of Ziza's store. (edited)
hugehuman 24/08/2020 16:07
"Alright. More than time for us to split. Let's go." Shorlu leads the way through the store's back door, looking for a place to hide outside before proceeding stealthily.
Stormchaser 24/08/2020 19:09
Landspeeders are common on the wider roads through town. Kite, Test and Zed find that they have plenty of choice when it comes to the selection of vehicles that could potentially be commandeered. The X-34 is the most widespread model of speeder by far. (edited)
RisenZed 24/08/2020 19:25
Zed steps out into the road in front of an oncoming X-34 and holds out his left palm, his right still gripping his blaster cannon. As the vehicle comes to a halt, he walks around to the driver's side and leans down into the window. "In the name of the Empire, we're commandeering this vehicle. Let me see some identification."
Stormchaser 24/08/2020 22:43
The occupants are what look a pair of white clad moisture farmers. Barely adults. They gulp with fearful eyes and hastily hand over identification cards without saying a word. (edited)
RisenZed 24/08/2020 22:46
Zed sees the fear on their faces and feels sick to his stomach. The voice in the back of his head pipes up again. Quite the hero you are. He scans their IDs quickly and then hands them back. "You can pick up your vehicle at impound lot 3," he says, motioning for them to get out of the speeder.
Stormchaser 25/08/2020 10:52
The driver nods hastily and two farmers vacate the vehicle, hurrying away from the three troopers as fast as they can. Meanwhile, the other team successfully slips out the back of Ziza's shop without being spotted. However, the rumbling of heavy-duty repulsors betrays the approach of an ITT pulling up in front of the building. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 25/08/2020 14:59

hugehuman 29/08/2020 17:50

Bob | The Builder 30/08/2020 00:21
ZX slides forward in his wheeled infiltration mode, hydraulics squeak as he raises his frame just high enough to look over a stack of boxes that the metal monster and Shorlu are using for cover. His Ocular unit sweeps the alley calculating the path of the patrols and the most efficient routes for non-detection, after a brief pause the eye swivels over to face the rest of the group as he replies to the Ortolan; (edited)
00:25
" My custom hardware and firmware attributes me a wide variety of features that are atypical for my base model, not only am I Programmed: for -Infiltration, -Assault, and other tactical procedures akin to a wardroid or bounty assassin model. My programming also allows me to do anything to achieve my designated tasks. My updated Code: dictates I cannot surrender, be captured, or undergo maintenance by any means other than by my owners designation, my unique modifications are highly illegal and cannot be discovered by Imperial authorities." Zex returns his gaze to the alley, watching the troopers pass by in a seemingly random snaking pattern through the streets. What seems like random movements to others becomes processed through the droids database, formulating a complex map of the surrounding patrols to find an opening for the group to slip through. (edited)
RisenZed 01/09/2020 14:10
Zed listens to Adorhi and nods. "Copy that," he says, and then returns to Kite and Test. "Sounds like the cellars are our best bet. Let's go."

Stormchaser 03/09/2020 22:05
As the clones head for the stairwell, to Test it is like walking into the heart of the storm. The cyclone of force energy grows ever stronger and it seems bizarre how everyone around him can be so unphased. The other stormtroopers seem to pay the trio no heed as they descend to the lower level, which opens up into a network of storage rooms, just as Adorhi described. Up ahead, two more stormtroopers stand guard in front of one of the vaults.

The stormtroopers nod in confirmation and one taps at the access panel to open the vault. The heavy metal door swings upon with a soft hiss of hydraulics, revealing a binder-clad Zabrak sitting in the chamber on the far side - Veets. The chamber seems strangely still to Test, until he realises that he is still perceiving the world through the Force. It swirls around them in constant motion... except here. The eye of the storm.
Rick Fisto 10/09/2020 03:02

RisenZed 10/09/2020 11:29

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 10/09/2020 15:12

Stormchaser 10/09/2020 21:03
As soon as Test's lips begin to move Veets is rising and moving towards then, the binder cuffs falling from his wrists with a clatter. As though on cue, the stormtroopers bring their own rifles to bear.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 11/09/2020 17:58
Seeing the Troopers level their rifles and not Veets slip out of his cuffs. Kite silently curses before falling into his combat rhythm. Quickly tapping into his datapad he initiates his target lock program on his HUD. Leveling his rifle at the trooper closest to him he prepares to shoot but hesitates. The face of the trooper whose armor he wears flashes in front of his eyes. His face, the face of his brothers. His finger twitches near the trigger, but he can't pull it. He moves his hand and flicks the rifle to stun and aims again. Sending a string of blue rings into the mans chest knocking him out. He moves down the hallway and says into his headcomm. "Fall back, if Adorhi's right with a bit of explosives we can blow our way out of here. We aren't going to make it out the other way."
Rick Fisto 14/09/2020 15:06
After slamming his hand on the vault close mechanism, Test tosses a grenade into the closing vault and backs up, placing the standing trooper between himself and the blast. The grenade explodes behind the closing door.
RisenZed 14/09/2020 15:50
Zed turns to the other trooper and at point-blank range, fires two stun bolts into his gut. The trooper topples without a cry. Zed didn't even have time to feel sorry for the man who likely wore his own face. He just turned and moved away with Kite. He shouts at Test. "C'mon!"
Stormchaser 16/09/2020 11:09
The grenade detonates with an ear-splitting CRACK as Kite and Zed gun down the two guards outside the vault. Through the gap in the closing door, Test sees shrapnel flying through the air towards Veets, only to stop short and fall to the ground. The scorched Iridonian strides towards the door and for a moment his eyes meet Test's through the helmet before the door closes. A second later there's a loud clunk and the door shakes as something hits it hard from the other side. A point in the middle of the heavy durasteel block begins to slowly glow a dull orange. As Kite looks on, he hears a woman's voice speak again in his mind "Plans are fragile things, and life often dashes expectations to the ground." (edited)
toddmoonbounce 16/09/2020 17:03
At the sound of a loud bang, Adorhi whips around to her companions. "That certainly doesn't sound good," the Togruta exclaims to the others. "We should never have come here with all these other bucketheads swarming around..." she then muttered mostly to herself, once again reminded why she preferred to work alone. "Gauss, anything you can do to get a read on the others? If there's any chance to avoid running into a firefight I'd like to take it."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 16/09/2020 18:00

hugehuman 19/09/2020 08:00
After reaching the building, Shorlu watches ZX crossâ€”again, quite subtlyâ€”and then Gauss. When Gauss races across, though, he notices a small object drop from a pouch on his side. Probably nothing. No big deal. In that instant, he flashes back to only minutes earlier, when one of Gauss's gadgets instantly flooded a whole room with electromesh. Who knows what that one could do if left unattended. Big deal... Big deal! Quickly, he darts out, snatches up the doodad, and rolls back over before any troopers check down their street. Safe enough in the doorway to this residence for now, he hands the thing back to Gauss, huffing and puffing slightly. "Didn't want... whatever this is, to go off and attract attention. If I were you I'd uh, strap it down extra secure." With that small crisis averted, he sidles up beside Adorhi and presses an ear to the door, using his keen hearing to listen for anyone moving around or talking in this domicile.
Drake | Emperor 19/09/2020 08:14
"Thanks for that." Gauss replies, reattaching the electromesh canister to his belt.
Stormchaser 19/09/2020 20:52

hugehuman 20/09/2020 17:30

toddmoonbounce 21/09/2020 22:37
With a quick glance at the ground before the door, Adorhi hopes for some sign of unwanted occupants. Unfortunately in her hurry, she covered any semblance of footprints with her own. Keep it moving, 'dor', she thinks to herself while quietly checking the door. Locked. Pulling out her tools, Adorhi goes to work on the door latch. With a satisfying click, the door unlocks and she slowly pushes it open. She turns back to Shorlu, giving hand signals to go quietly and to keep his eyes peeled. She turns back to the room trying to find the quickest route to the underground level. (edited)
hugehuman 21/09/2020 23:06
Shorlu nods, and steps inside carefully, having the other two enter as well before he closes the door behind them.
Stormchaser 23/09/2020 11:51
Inside the door, Adorhi, Gauss, Shorlu and ZX find themselves in the vestibule of a relatively well-to-do home. The houses in this part of Mos Eisley belong to the city's wealthier residents and this is reflected in the decor. Ponchos and other outer-wear suitable for life on a desert planet hang on what looks like a hat-stand near the front door. A low rack of sandy boots stands adjacent, along with a rough matt upon which is written: 'Home is where the sand isn't.' The far side of the vestibule opens up into an atrium not dissimilar to Prello's own home. Adorhi realises that if the layout is comparable, then she already knows how best to reach the cellar.
toddmoonbounce 25/09/2020 05:41
Seeing a familiar layout, Adorhi silently points out to the others her target route. Passing over the floormat, the phrase causes an eyeroll but behind the expression, the words hit hard. Specifically home. Everything was moving so fast recently that she hadn't really had a chance to think about it but now it was a punch to the gut. Longing to go back to Shili. Longing to see her family again. Shrugging away her distracting thoughts, Adorhi very quietly makes her way towards the cellar.
Stormchaser 25/09/2020 19:48
Shorlu can still hear activity from the upper floor, but the occupants do not seem to be making their way downstairs. Either they haven't noticed the intrusion, or they're too scared to confront the invaders, or perhaps they're simply hiding from the Empire. Whatever the answer, with Adorhi leading the way, they soon arrive in the cellar and make for the wall adjacent to Prello's town house. Meanwhile, on the far side there's a screeching of metal shearing and a thunderous crash from back the way Kite, Test and Zed came. (edited)
RisenZed 25/09/2020 19:51
Zed whirls and aims his weapon back the way they came. He clicks on the comms. "Adorhi," he says, tension and a bit of fear rising in his voice. "Now would be a good time..."
toddmoonbounce 25/09/2020 21:06
"Bomb Squad has arrived, be a dear and stand back. I'd prefer not to blow apart one of you few bucketheads I actually tolerate," Adorhi quips back to Zed. She then quickly feels out through her montrals for an open spot on the other side of the wall and calls forward Gauss to do his thing.
Rick Fisto 25/09/2020 21:27
"She must have thought that was me," Test says with a grin, barely contained by his helmet. (edited)
Drake | Emperor 25/09/2020 21:28
Gauss runs over to the point Adorhi designated, breaching charge in hand. He taps a few buttons on the timer box, linking it to his detonator, before setting it against the wall, trying to avoid any load bearing points. "Charge set, take some cover and cover those ears especially you Shorlu," remarking at the ortolan's large ears, he says to the group before ducking behind a box. When he is satisfied everyone is safe, he exclaims "Fire in the hole!" only loud enough to carry in the room. Pressing the button on the detonator with a satisfying click, which is immediately followed by a kraboom as the charge blows a ten foot round hole into the wall. As soon as the major debris stops falling, Gauss is up with his blaster pointed at the passage, at the ready to assist his brothers' retreat.
RisenZed 25/09/2020 21:31
Test's joke does nothing to penetrate Zed's armor of fear-induced concentration. What the hell is this inquisitor? He is about to bark at Test to focus up, when the wall a few meters back from them explodes, sending chunks of sandstone flying across the room. "Fall back," he yells, moving toward the hole. Seeing Gauss there with his blaster pointed back into Prello's townhouse, Zed says, "Not fighting, just running. Go!"
hugehuman 25/09/2020 21:34
Shorlu gives a half-salute and gets behind whatever cover he can in the dank cellar. When the charge goes off, he covers his head, and pops back up, blaster raised, only to hear a clone's voiceâ€”Zed's voiceâ€”from a stormtrooper inside. "Right, nice to see you too. C'mon!" As they start to move, he realizes something. "What about your friend, Veets?"
Rick Fisto 25/09/2020 21:53
He had felt panic before. He had felt helpless before. He had felt loss before. But never before had Test felt such a cold, immense fear that this inquisitor made him feel. Never before had he felt so small in the face of the power that this inquisitor wielded. Never before had he felt such a senseless loss as that of his grumpy, simple friend Veets. And his quick deflection to humor fell flat in his own ears. If they made it out of here today, it certainly wouldn't be by their own skill. Focusing a dead-eye stare on Shorlu, hidden behind the Storm Trooper helmet that somehow took his stare and magnified it a hundredfold with it's thin, black transparisteel visor, itself a grotesque and permanent parody of his own stare, Test replies, "he isn't coming." (edited)
Drake | Emperor 25/09/2020 22:42
"Well someone is," Gauss yells at Test, "so get moving so I can cover our escape!" grabbing a canister from his belt, and slapping it into his wristpad. He taps at his wristpad, setting it to spray the doorway with electromesh to entrap anyone who tries to follow them. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 26/09/2020 15:58
Kite dashes through the destroyed wall trying to put distance between himself and the voice. He yells to Gauss "Good call Vode, did you bring a ride out of here? We have a speeder stashed but it's not big enough for all of us" (edited)
Stormchaser 26/09/2020 19:29
The loud crash from behind the retreating clones dies with a dull creak and a cloud of dust billows out across Prello's cellar. Those looking back see a dim red glow illuminate its depths and then Veets steps out of the sandy haze. He is still irrefutably Veets. Tattoos, horns and all. Right down to the sour look on his face. However, something within the Zabrak has changed beyond recognition. That and the vermillion-bladed lightsaber in his hand. He fixes the the hole through the wall in his gaze - and then Gauss fills the breach with a dense weave of electromesh. (edited)
Stormchaser 29/09/2020 11:28
Beating a rapid retreat in the face of Veets' advance, the clones and their allies make a beeline for the stairwell back up to the ground floor. However, the sounds of hammering on the door and boots on the ground quickly indicate that this is unlikely to be their way out. This house's cellar seems to have primarily been used for storage, with a few doors leading other rooms on the lower level. If Adorhi isn't mistaken, then one of them should lead to a parking garage.
toddmoonbounce 01/10/2020 03:07
Hearing the new obstacle in the way of their escape, Adorhi pulls the group back towards one of the other doors that should lead to a parking garage.
Stormchaser 01/10/2020 13:20
A small keypad besides to the doors opens them with a soft swoosh to reveal a duracrete underground garage. Two sleek-looking white landspeeders and a green airspeeder are parked against one wall with a large door on the far side. One of the landspeeders is a sporty two-seater model, while the other is a five-seater saloon. The airspeeder has room for a pilot, a co-pilot and six passengers seated opposite one another on benches in the back.
RisenZed 01/10/2020 15:46
Zed points at the airspeeder. "Adorhi, get it hotwired. Quickly." He rushes to the passenger side of the airspeeder and braces his rifle against the hood, aiming it back the way they had just came. (edited)
Rick Fisto 01/10/2020 18:38
Test pulls his saber out, guarding their retreat in front of the speeder, ready to leap into action at a moment's notice.
toddmoonbounce 01/10/2020 18:41
Rushing up to the door of the airspeeder, Adorhi goes to work getting the thing unlocked. With the helpful hands and eyes of Kite, she quickly releases the locking mechanism and moves to the cockpit to begin working on ignition. Once more with the help of Kite, the task is little more than routine and the vehicle comes to life with a steady hum of its repulsorlifts. "Appreciate the help, Kite," Adorhi says in acknowledgement to the clone with a pat on his shoulder. Stepping back from the controls and with a brush of her hands signifying the successful task, she then turns to the Ortolan, " 'Lu, you're up! Get us in the air." (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 02/10/2020 17:25
Kite nods gently slapping Adorhi on the back, as he runs into the speeder picking the seat furthest in the back. He flips around in the seat so he can get line of sight on the door they came out, bracing the rifle as he peers through the scope. "We gotta move I don't know how long Gauss' mesh will hold the kriffin dar'jetii" (edited)
hugehuman 02/10/2020 19:57
Shorlu scurries to the speeder. He'd been more used to catching crooks on stolen speeders back in the day, much less hijacking one himself. But he couldn't argue against it saving their hides. "Yes ma'am!" He hops on the speeder controls. "Pile in, 'less you wanna switch sides!"
19:59
Once everyone is aboard, he lifts off, making for the garage exit.
Stormchaser 07/10/2020 22:12
The low thrum and soft hiss of condensed plasma shearing through electromesh can be heard from further back in the cellar as Adorhi and Kite work, accompanied by the dull thump of stormtrooper boots on the ground. The airspeeder hums to life under the pair's careful hands, and Shorlu quickly familiarises himself with the vehicles controls. Only one obstacle remains - the garage door.
RisenZed 08/10/2020 03:22
ZX lets out a burst of comm static from his vocoder. "Entry door type Besh-79, authorization keyset 87524-Aurek-12. Access: granted. Door set to: open." The garage door rolls up into its containment unit, leaving the way clear for the airspeeder.
Stormchaser 08/10/2020 03:42
The speeder takes to their air with a shudder and lurches forwards as Shorlu guns the engine. Across the room, Veets steps into the doorway, a cadre of stormtroopers right behind him. The Zabrak is just in time to make eye contact with Test through the transparisteel window as they shoot out into the sky.
Stormchaser 08/10/2020 06:13
The air seems relatively free of traffic - for the moment. However, Imperial forces can be seen crawling all over the city. It's likely only a matter of time before some kind of AA weaponry or snubfighters are brought to bear.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 10/10/2020 16:56
Seeing the Zabrak emerge, Kite's finger tenses on the trigger. He almost shoots but sees the focus in the dar'jetii eyes and thinks better of it. The force user would have some trick that he could employ. He taps into his wrist pad marking Veet, flagging his biometric pattern into this HUD. Hoping that if they have the misfortune of running into him again, they will at least have a heads up this time. "We need to move, the Destroyer is going to mobilize it's fighters. Looking over to Shorlu & Gauss he says "You two think we can fly our way out of this? Worst comes to worst we could go to ground with the Hutt"
hugehuman 10/10/2020 20:08

"As long as Gauss can keep up, we're aces when we hit atmo." The little Ortolan exudes incredible confidence from behind the controls of the speeder.
Drake | Emperor 13/10/2020 05:39

Stormchaser 13/10/2020 21:50

Rick Fisto 13/10/2020 22:11

Stormchaser 15/10/2020 21:14
The airspeeder arcs through the skies of Mos Eisley and its engines begin to keen softly as Shorlu pushes them to their limit. The craft draws close to the roof of the spaceport and the distant whine of ion engines can be heard. Far overhead, several H shaped-silhouettes darken the sky. The forces on the ground meet the approaching vehicle with another barrage of blaster fire, buffeting the speeder about and the sound of shearing metal can be heard from the rear end. (edited)
RisenZed 15/10/2020 21:30

In his haste, he can only estimate the trajectory is right, leaving the rest to chance.
Stormchaser 21/10/2020 16:13
The roof of the spaceport is constructed of the same adobe material as most buildings in Mos Eisley. It's bumpy and uneven and speckled periodically with large circular openings into the hangars below.

Stormchaser 22/10/2020 23:25

A shower of blaster fire follows in their wake, but everybody is already too far from the edge to be in danger. Slaloming between hangar bay, Test leads his brothers and their new friends unerringly towards that of The Messenger, until it finally stands before them. Quick as ever, Adorhi hits the ground running. The droning whine of ion engines overhead tells everyone that they have only moments to get in the air.

hugehuman 22/10/2020 23:50

We need a plan and to toss that Jetii'kad the first chance we get before it rains any more trouble upon us" (edited)
Rick Fisto 25/11/2020 16:52

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 25/11/2020 17:10

RisenZed 25/11/2020 18:33
Zed releases a breath he hadn't realized that he was holding. The adrenaline fades, and when he climbs down the ladder to the deck of the ship, he feels like exactly what he is -- a tired old man. He recovers as best he can when Kite mentions Veets. "I didn't know that the Force could do that," he says, his voice shaking slightly. "That looked just like Veets." He puts his hand on Kite's shoulder and looks into his brother's eyes. "We will get out of this. Together." He pauses, takes a deep breath, and looks at Gauss. "We need to sweep the ship for tracking devices. I don't want the Empire showing up while we're looting that seppie trash. I'll start the sweep inside, you scan the hull if you. Adorhi, Shorlu, I'd appreciate your help as well." He stops for a moment, realizing that his nerves have sent his mind back in time about seven years. He mentally shrugs. Too late to turn back now. "Kite and Test, handle what you broke, and then help with the sweep of the ship. We need to keep our eyes open for stowaways and beacons."
Drake | Emperor 26/11/2020 03:10
"Copy that Zed. Also, you can have this back." Gauss hands him his detonator back. "I'll get on that scan right away." he replies back as he heads towards the bridge to access the sensors console.
Drake | Emperor 27/11/2020 03:37
After a thorough scan, the ship's scanners detect nothing foreign attached to the hull. Gauss checks a bit longer before being satisfied, as least as much as the computers could tell him. He raises Zed on the ship comms, "Zed, scanners found nothing, however we should check the outer hull as soon as we land, just to be sure." Gauss then heads off to an empty room, takes off his gear, and starts making an inventory of it. "Kriffing hell... I forgot to grab my armor from The Mad Line... I really hope Zex is alright and I can get it back." he says aloud to himself as he takes his wristpad off, grabbing the AccuTronics modification from his pack to begin work on installing it. He spends the better part of an hour fiddling with the device, distracting his mind from his loss for a bit, before getting it fully installed and functional. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 28/11/2020 18:59
Kite goes to the cabin and strips off his stormtrooper gear replacing it with his Mandalorian armor. Feeling at home once his black & gold second skin was in place. Attaching the helmet to his belt, he stores the trooper gear and goes to find Test. Once he finds the clone he asks sincerely "How you feeling Vode? You seemed a little off during the infiltration"
Rick Fisto 28/11/2020 19:43
"I was feeling off, Kite. I...I know you don't like Jedi or the force, but...well, I could feel it there. Like we were in a storm of darkness. Even if I didn't want to use the force...I...I think the force might want to use me. And I don't want it to come between us."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 29/11/2020 18:07
Test's words hit Kite like a stampede of banthas. They were clones this shouldn't be possible. The science of force users plays like a competing loop through his mind against the impossible events he and his brothers have experienced with the Star. Unconsciously taking a step back and clenching his fist, Kite tries to speak in a soothing tone but it comes across stiff and increasingly manic the longer he talks "Test this is just the after effects of the Star. Hell I've been hearing voices, since we broke the blasted thing. We just need some time to work it out of our systems. " Kite begins fiddling with the helmet on his belt, clearly restraining himself from putting it on. " Kriff if it comes to it we can go home and kidnap one of those long necked Kaminii and get them to use their big brains for good for once. We can fix this Vode." Kite sounding split between hopeful and desperate as he finishes speaking. (edited)
Rick Fisto 30/11/2020 00:44

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 30/11/2020 17:30
Kite shakes his head, deciding to grab some tools vs reigniting the chip debate. "What ever it is vode we will fix it. Now lets get this fixed up."
toddmoonbounce 30/11/2020 19:03
"Shorlu..." Adorhi calls out before the Ortolan makes his escape to the galley, "thank you for helping me out there. I suppose the rush and excitement is part of the draw to flying around in these winged coffins, huh?" She finishes with a chuckle, but then turns more serious. "I'm not sure your intentions once we get Rider back, but if you have any thought on sticking around with us I'd be interested in sitting beside you up here and learning a thing or two. If you're willing to teach a stubborn massiff some new tricks that is." Adorhi then turns to face forward in her seat, staring at the pulsing waves of hyperspace. A seemingly rare moment without distraction giving her an opportunity to think on the past few days events. (edited)
hugehuman 30/11/2020 20:18
An ear perks up as Shorlu stops to hear Adorhi out. He hadn't given what he would do after all this very much thought; even assuming the likely scenario that Rider was alive, he'd definitely need some time off. And the Katarn's Bane was history. Things would never be the same. But having something to do rather than go back to cantina-diving felt... nice. He tries to hide just how happy the offer made him. "Well, fine, if you're gonna twist my trunk. But you better know I have a high price. I'm in it for the snacksâ€”I expect to be well fed!" His trunk waggles with a chuckle as he leaves the cockpit. (edited)
Rick Fisto 30/11/2020 22:20
As Kite and Test work, cutting patches of sheet metal and welding them in place over melted sections of door, Test continually finds himself making fewer mistakes as he works, even occasionally pointing out a problem to Kite a few steps down the line that he would normally have expected Kite to have to remind him about. It's almost as if his thoughts are being guided along the exactly correct path, requiring fewer branchings of thought. It was like playing a game of holo chess where every set of moves you start to evaluate happens to be the correct one on the very first try. Perhaps it's just the rhythm of the work. The flash of the plasma torch. The beat of the hammer. The whirring of the hydro spanner. I'm just in the zone.
Rick Fisto 01/12/2020 15:46
At the end of their work, Test finds himself left with using that same, large cabin again. The others had claimed their cabins while Kite and Test had worked, and Kite didn't want this cabin, even though it was the largest on the ship. Given the memories, he understood But now he sat alone in the middle of the empty room. As he meditated on the bed, he stared at the closed hatch. At the ugly scar on it that he and Kite had tried to patch over and cover. It worked. But the patch was fooling no one. Something had torn a gash in that door, and that little patch made it look prettier, but it almost drew attention to itself, being bigger than the original mark. Haspin, how do you repair something so that it's new again?
Stormchaser 01/12/2020 16:00
None of us know how to fix ourselves, Test, the disembodied voice of an old Togruta floats through the clone's mind, at least not entirely. Not well enough.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 02/12/2020 04:32
Kite finishes the repairs with Test in near silence, unnerved by the clones theory especially after the events of the day. Nodding to his brother as he gathers his tools, Kite quickly retreats back to his cabin. Leaving before Test could reignite their discussion. Agitated Kite paces the room, each time he pauses or closes his eyes another scene plays through his head. First he sees not Veets with his red saber effortlessly cutting through the door and pursuing the clones relentlessly. His eyes close again and he sees himself huddled in the back of an escape pod as a blue blade slowly burns through the door molten metal dripping on the floor. Frustrated he drops himself into his chair looking for ways to keep himself busy. SHe begins removing each piece of his armor, methodically inspecting and cleaning it as he goes. This armor was his most prized possession but each time he lifts a piece he sees a saber cutting through it like paper. Frustrated he dons the armor and storms off looking for Zed. Finding his brother he sits and hesitates for a second before asking "Hey vode, you still have that armor mech kit?" his brother always had been skilled at repairing and modifying their gear, and he was going to need that talent if he was going to craft something that could withstand a strike from a jetii'kad. Seeing his brother nod he says"You got a minute to run me through the basics ?"
RisenZed 02/12/2020 15:57
Zed nods. "They didn't teach you any armoring on Mandalore?" he says with a chuckle. "Yeah, I can show you some things." Zed runs Kite through a few of the standard practices of armory over the next few days.
Stormchaser 02/12/2020 20:59
Four days later the Messenger's hyperdrive shudders and whines and in the cockpit the swirling blue of hyperspace condenses into starlight that shrinks back to points. These coordinates are in open space and there's nothing of note within visual range.
RisenZed 02/12/2020 21:05
Zed looks out at the empty black through the transparasteel viewport in the cockpit. "Correct me if I'm wrong, but there's supposed to be a big kriffing Lucrehulk here, no?" he says to Shorlu and the cockpit's other occupants.
hugehuman 02/12/2020 21:22
"Things tend to drift around in space. How old did ya those coords were?" Shorlu flicks on the scanners and looks for a signal of any kind.
toddmoonbounce 02/12/2020 21:28
Adorhi, sitting in her self-claimed co-pilots seat, pretends her best to analyze the coordinate data from Alastair about their quarry's location. "This is the spot, but it ain't there." (edited)
Drake | Emperor 02/12/2020 21:28
"Give me a second," Gauss says as he sits at the scranner station and begins to scan for massive hunks of metal in the area, aiding Shorlu. (edited)
Rick Fisto 02/12/2020 21:36
Test closes his eyes and feels for any sign of another presence in the area.
hugehuman 02/12/2020 21:39
"Gauss, you seeing this?" He glances back at the clone's sensor station behind him. "I noticed some kind of a weird signal when you boosted the scans." (edited)
Stormchaser 02/12/2020 21:39
Test feels the familiar presence of his friends around him and beyond that... a great void empty of life as far as he can touch in every direction. For the first time, he feels just how vast and empty and dead deep space really is.
Drake | Emperor 03/12/2020 00:47
Gauss messes with the scanner frequencies until he begins to see signs of a debris trail far off in front of them. Among the debris field, several energy signatures blink and fade. Gauss studies them carefully... "These... look like TIE Fighters! Let me refine it better though. They shouldn't be here... yet..." The ominous remark falling silent on his voice as he concentrates on the blips. "Definitely not Imperial however, signatures don't match, too sporadic." "Zed get to the turret and be ready for anything" Gauss yells out to his brother. He then looks to Shorlu, "Got any ideas on how to handle this? They don't seem to have noticed us yet." he says as he begins to kill off non-essential systems to lower their own signature, (edited)
RisenZed 03/12/2020 00:54
"Copy that," Zed says. He sprints to the gunwell and climbs up the ladder. He settles into the seat and swivels the gun around to point forward. "In position," he says over comms.
Rick Fisto 03/12/2020 01:23
Test pulls up the Messenger's defensive menus and is disappointed with it's capabilities. Well, at least the thing has shields. He checks the shield harmonics and prepares to stabilize the shields against incoming fire.
hugehuman 03/12/2020 01:54
"Well," Shorlus trails, looking out of the viewport. "This is a salvage job. I bet they're competition. Never met a polite scavenger. Frankly, with our performance against those real TIEs, I like our odds against a few stolen ones right here. Only question would be whether they've got friends." He strokes his trunk. "But I wouldn't wanna just creep up and blast 'em outta the sky without at least exchanging words. I say we get to within comms range and open a hailing frequency, say hello. What happens next is up to them."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 03/12/2020 02:06
For a second Kite is torn between setting up his slicers gear or jumping into the double cannons. But a quick look at the ships antiquated communication gear, sends him running to the guns. Hearing Gauss and Shorlu "Anything else on the scanners? Unless the Ties have been heavily modified and fitted with a hyperdrive there should be a carrier ship nearby. We should find the big ship before we announce ourselves"
Drake | Emperor 03/12/2020 02:44
"Nothing else, just a debris trail that goes a long ways off. Might be our hulk at the end of it, and their home ship as well." Gauss tells Kite, still checking the scanners for anything else. "I only detected them because of their own comm systems, so if we do engage, make it hard and fast." (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 03/12/2020 14:43
Hearing Gauss mention the comms systems has him turn back to the communications chair. Quickly integrating his slicers kit into the system, he begins furiously typing into the computer trying to break through the pirates encryption. It takes a few seconds but he is able to get in, he then dryly says "We've got a bit of good news and some bad news. They haven't spotted us yet but their after the Starworm. Working for someone named Geelo." (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 04/12/2020 14:34
Tapping into the terminal Kite quickly routes their communication channel into the ships speakers "I can keep us linked into their com channel. It may be worth it for us to hang back out of their range and see if they can find the ship for us. May also give us a clue into who Geelo is and if they have any other reinforcements"
Drake | Emperor 04/12/2020 18:05
"Cut the power to anything we don't need to trail them, shields, weapons, anything. The lower we can get our power signature, the better chances we have. Assuming we don't want to engage them at all." Gauss asks the group, still watching the scanner for any abnormalities.
Rick Fisto 04/12/2020 18:18
Well at least this thing had shields...
Stormchaser 04/12/2020 20:14
A few moments later the fighters conclude their report in and proceed to follow the debris trail in search of the Starworm.
Drake | Emperor 06/12/2020 05:24
Gauss notices the blips moving off. "Shorlu, they are moving, we should keep them at this distance. Use the debris to mask us if you can." he says to the ortolan before going back to monitoring the scanner.
hugehuman 06/12/2020 07:05
Shorlu flexes his fingers. "Alright, worth a shot." He maneuvers the Messenger from cover to cover along the trail, trying to keep them out of sight.
toddmoonbounce 07/12/2020 02:38
"I think this is the part where I make some snarky comment about being the stealthy one of the group....well, at least now that Barin is gone. Right, Kite?" Adorhi's comments came out lightheartedly but were likely a cover up of her anxiousness and excitement towards the uncertain situation. The trust towards her companions was building but her muscle memory still flexed when thrown into a potentially dangerous situation she wasn't solely in control of. "Just let me know where you can use an extra set of eyes, 'lu," the togruta then offers while dialing in her focus. (edited)
Stormchaser 08/12/2020 19:13
At first it seems like the TIEs are too concentrated on their search to notice the Messenger, but after a scanning the debris trail for a while longer they abruptly turn, making a beeline for the freighter.
RisenZed 08/12/2020 19:18
As the targets pop up on Zed's scanner, he says, "Power up the ship and tell them to stand down or get blasted!"
Rick Fisto 08/12/2020 19:42
Test boots the shields back up, and prepares the ship to mitigate incoming damage.
hugehuman 08/12/2020 20:37
"Dank ferrik, I hate when I'm right." Shorlu looks to Gauss, on the comms station. "Open up a hailing frequency, and put it on speaker!"
Drake | Emperor 08/12/2020 21:36
"Copy." Gauss replies back as he opens up communications.
hugehuman 08/12/2020 22:32
Shorlu clears his throat, and flicks on a microphone next to him. "Messenger here, to unidentified fighters. Gotta be honest with you fellas, our guns are still hot from the last few TIEs we shot down. So why don't you ease off those attack vectors and let's talk?"
Stormchaser 09/12/2020 10:09
At first there is only silence, but then the TIEs slow their approach and the channel crackles to life. "Who you think you messin' with, slimo," a nasal voice replies in heavily accented basic. "You's got no claim on this salvage." (edited)
hugehuman 09/12/2020 11:13
Shorlu visibly relaxes slightly as the TIEs slow down. As they begin posturing over comms, he gives Adorhi a leading shrug, clearly saying, I'm just the rickshaw droid here, what do I know. He leans back in the pilot's chair, a little miffed about still not knowing the finer details of this odd job.
toddmoonbounce 09/12/2020 17:56
Adorhi gives a shrug back to the ortolan and then calls out to the rest of the crew, "Boys, this is...or was, your area of expertise during the war, yes? Any thoughts on our side of the argument here in regards to the quarry?"
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 10/12/2020 02:23
Kite shrugs his shoulders as he runs towards the gun emplacement. "We were backed by the Republic then, people usually stood down or caught a blaster bolt. "
Drake | Emperor 10/12/2020 02:33
"We also rarely dealt with the scum of the galaxy. Since we are, were, special operations clones, we were sent to deal with the CIS when normal clones could not." Gauss adds. "And like Kite said, rarely do droids negotiate." (edited)
Rick Fisto 10/12/2020 05:06
Struck by sudden intuition, Test keys on the comms, and asks "Are there not enough droids on that heap for both of us? I'm pretty sure filling our hold won't even make a dent in that thing." (edited)
Stormchaser 10/12/2020 20:31
The channel goes quiet for a moment, before flaring back to life as one of the pilots answers. "Alright Messenger, stay out of our way," Test is advised before the channel cuts out and both TIEs veer off to continue following the debris trail. (edited)
RisenZed 11/12/2020 21:35
Zed's shoulders relax as the report comes in. "Nicely handled, Test," he says over comms.
Rick Fisto 11/12/2020 21:35

RisenZed 11/12/2020 21:40
"You've got your moments," Zed says with a chuckle. "Stay frosty everyone. They could just be waiting for backup. I'm pretty sure Sienar's contract with the empire is exclusive, which means that these people are cunning enough to get ahold of TIE fighters. Don't underestimate them."
Stormchaser 11/12/2020 21:52
The wreckage of the Starworm is drifting towards the nearest star system, surrounded by a 'cloud' of debris: the shattered husks of starfighters, a few battle droids and pieces of batlteship. The ship is slowly spinning, which will make lining up with one of the two airlocks in the aft section of the derelict with that of the Messenger a serious challenge. Additionally, any ship within the field of wreckage is at risk of being pelted by chunks of debris. Once the cruiser's coordinates have been determined, the two TIE junkers peel off, heading away into space.
Drake | Emperor 11/12/2020 22:55
"I'll keep a keen eye on the scanner while we approach sir." Gauss answers to Zed.
hugehuman 14/12/2020 20:47
Shorlu begins weaving the freighterâ€”which handled like a drunken banthaâ€”around the debris between it and the Starworm, making for the airlocks.
Stormchaser 14/12/2020 21:17
As the Messenger enters the debris field, it is continually pelted by chunks of wreckage - some large enough to cause problems. The first couple of large chunks Shorlu evades with ease, but then a huge piece of shredded bulkhead collides with the port bow of the freighter. There's a violent crash, but fortunately the deflector shield holds. Another large piece bounces off the belly of the ship before it comes around into position adjacent to the aft of the derelict.
Rick Fisto 14/12/2020 21:50
Test, sitting watching his nav-screen readout of all of the debris suddenly thinks to change the sensitivity on the scanners, and a few more blips appear on the screen. "Trunks, we got two new blips at 43 mark 10 and 51 mark 13. Ice. The initial sweep missed them because of their density."
hugehuman 14/12/2020 21:59
Shorlu remains focused as he brings the Messenger ever closer, sure of their shields' ability to hold. As they finally get near enough to dock with the airlock, he holds off for a moment as he hears Test's warning, letting the huge ice chunks fly by. "Good call there. Gauss, you can see the outer cams from there, right? Double check my angle." With the other clone's alignment check, he settles into the airlock, and a soft rumble is felt as the docking procedure completes.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 15/12/2020 15:30
Feeling the Messenger latch onto the airlock Kite boots up the sensors checking to see if hull is still pressurized. The sensors take a moment but report back that there is no oxygen on the other side of the barrier. With a grunt he stands and walks to the vac suits and tersely says "No air on the other side boys, better suit up.' As he begins to put the vacsuit over his armor he grumbles almost to himself "and hope that the droids are deactivated, or that they don't have frags, or that they don't have knifes. Today is going to be a long kriffin day." Slinging his ion rifle on the opposite shoulder of his sniper rifle. He leans against the door waiting for the rest to leave. (edited)
RisenZed 15/12/2020 20:48
Zed dons his vacsuit over his armor like Kite. "Remember when out kit came with this stuff included?" he asks, grumbling to himself. After dressing, he heads to the rear airlock and activates his comm with a chin-toggle. "Let's keep it tight. Droids might still be online." He slaps the panel to open the interior airlock, then enters.
hugehuman 15/12/2020 21:31
Shorlu heads for a cabin to use as a changing room, closing the door behind him. From just beyond it, one can hear an assortment of muffled noises.
