21:34
As they line up at the airlock, he pipes up through comms. "Anyone wanna clue me in as to what we're looking for here, anyway?"
Stormchaser 17/12/2020 20:54
The Messenger's airlock opens with a hiss, revealing the Starworm's own exterior. The cruiser is without power and a manual override will obviously be necessary. The lever is accessible via a small, recessed panel adjacent to the airlock door, but is extremely stiff and will take some strength to turn. Given the cramped space, only one person will be able to get at it at a time.
Rick Fisto 17/12/2020 21:05
At a look from Gauss, Test steps up to the handle and wraps both hands around it, trying to use his weight as leverage to move the stiff lever.
Stormchaser 17/12/2020 21:17
With a resounding creak and the scrape of metal on metal the airlock slowly slides open, revealing the darkness beyond.
Stormchaser 17/12/2020 21:29
The interior of the ship is an eerie sight. The power is out - including the artificial gravity - and a thin glaze of frost shows that what little atmosphere might have remained has long since frozen. In the light of the squad's glowrods, frayed cables hang loosely from the ceilings and walls looking like jungle vines. Wreckage is scattered everywhere, with large piles near the doors and airlocks. Amid the debris, parts of battle droids, starfighter parts, assorted cargo containers and pieces of the ship's superstructure can be be made out. Here and there, small bits of wreckage float aimlessly; otherwise, nothing is moving.
toddmoonbounce 17/12/2020 21:44
"I'll take a quick look ahead." Adorhi says walking past Test while still wrestling with the fit of the vac suit. She takes a step into the massive floating structure hoping to get sight and feel on anything beyond their glowrods. Out here in the dead and empty cold of space, she found herself quick to reach out to the force that only recently blessed her with its presence. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 17/12/2020 22:17
Commanding the droid to hover over his shoulder, Kite executes a code on his wrist pad that transposes the droids optics over his helmet's HUD. Illuminating the darkness, but giving it a greenish tinge. Unslinging his ion rifle he takes up a covering position behind Adorhi as she walks ahead.
Drake | Emperor 17/12/2020 22:27
Gauss unslings his own ion carbine, following close behind Kite with the glowrod attached to his utility vest illuminating the immediate area. "Careful of any droid chassis, they might still be operational, they might merely been in maintenance mode after all these years." he says over comms, keeping a watchful eye for movement from a droid's servos.
RisenZed 17/12/2020 22:29
Zed takes up the rear, covering the group's six as they enter the Lucrehulk. "Just like old times," he says.
Rick Fisto 17/12/2020 23:12
Test refrains from igniting his saber, afraid the apparent--if false-- appearance of a Jedi may trigger automated battle routines in the droids. (edited)
Stormchaser 18/12/2020 16:57
From the darkness, little points of light appear - and begin moving. Battle droids - some with pieces missing - begin climbing over the debris, working their way towards the intruders. Apparently this derelict is not entirely powerless.
Rick Fisto 19/12/2020 23:18
Test sees the lights in the darkness and suddenly he's back in the past. He stalks past Haspin...no, Adorhi...unlimbering his vibroclaymore and puts his back up against the unmoving hulk of the vulture droid, readying to launch himself at any droid that makes a move against hammer squad.
hugehuman 19/12/2020 23:22
Stepping onto the derelict, Shorlu gets his comms working with the suit, about to ask a question. Before he can even start running his trunk, he hears the sound of metal on metal, as their attackers come to life. Scrutinizing their foes calls to mind all the old weaknesses he'd learned of the mass-produced B1 units during the Clone Wars, now exaggerated given their obvious state of disrepair. With practiced skill, he draws his pistol and fires, sending the droid nearest to Test and Adorhi to the floor.
RisenZed 20/12/2020 16:54
Zed moves up beside Test and fires a bolt at the nearest clanker, but a loose deck plate slides and throws off his aim. He's able to keep his feet, but the shot goes wide.
Drake | Emperor 20/12/2020 20:40
Gauss falls in after Zed, taking cover behind a nearby upturned crate. He aims his wristpad towards the remaining battle droid in sight, firing off and Ion Blast. However the blast veers off, dispersing into the wall as the droid dodges the attack as it lumbers up. "Kriff... they are not moving how I am used to, going to have to make a few adjestments." he thinks to himself as he shouts to his brother"Test, watch out for that vulture, it might still be functioning!"
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 20/12/2020 20:49
Seeing the droids start clambering about Kite kneels and levels his Ion rifle at the B1 in the corner. lifting the rifle up and peering through the scopes he lines up with what he thinks is a good shot pulls the trigger and sees the ion bolt fly way off the mark. Cursing himself he realizes that he forgot to account for the lack of gravity.
toddmoonbounce 20/12/2020 21:05
With a sarcastic remark about Kite's aim on her tongue, Adhori lines up her pistol and takes a shot at the same droid her clone companion struggled to hit. Missing her first shot as well, she swallows the comment and puts her focus on a second attempt, this time tagging the droid as intended.
Stormchaser 20/12/2020 21:09
There's a grinding of metal on metal as a doorway on the far side of the hangar scrapes open and two B1 battle droids and a B2 super battle droid stumble through, opening fire on the clones. Another appears behind Zed, who is hit twice in the crossfire, while the the B2 pins down Adorhi and Test under a barrage of blaster fire.
Rick Fisto 20/12/2020 23:44
Test rolls around Zed when the group of droids comes out flanking the squad. Rushing at the closest, he swings his sword in a waist high arc, cutting cleanly through the first one.
hugehuman 21/12/2020 19:05
As Test cleaves through one of the battle droids across the room, Shorlu fixes his gaze on the other B1 next to him. But instead of simply pointing the blaster in its direction and shooting, he starts running through a litany of mental calculations. He finds the right angle with the right probability to ricochet a shot from, attempting to flush the blaster from his last shots at the other B1 and shoot the new one in one movement. At first, all goes as plannedâ€”until a piece of wreckage, disturbed by the activity, falls from the ceiling, deflecting the bolt at the last second. Then his blaster backfires, growing hot. "Kriff me!" mutters the Ortolan, as he backsteps while juggling the pistol, left open to a response from the B1.
RisenZed 21/12/2020 21:59
"Gotta fall back," Zed says, blasting a droid to scrap. He wheels around Test, staying low, and takes cover in the airlock.
Drake | Emperor 22/12/2020 18:03
Seeing the group of three battle droids, led by a super battle droid, Gauss ferviously taps at his wristpad. "Super battle droid, take 'em down!" he calls out to his brothers. After a few frantic seconds he points the device towards the group but by that time Test had already cut one down. He focuses his attack on the super battle droid and the B1 beside him. Pressing a button on his wrist, three rays of ion energy erupt from it, two steaking towards the super, vaporizing it, while the other whizzes past the B1, dissipating against the wall. Ducking behind cover, he hurls a kolto pack at Zed's feet, where it disperses a green mist around the clone, healing his wounds.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 22/12/2020 18:05
After seeing his last shot completely miss it's mark Kite engages his HUD's target protocol. Taking aim once again he takes a shot at the B1 but the bolt goes wide once agian.
toddmoonbounce 22/12/2020 18:26
Adorhi realized it might not be the best idea to be grouped up like sitting womp rats just waiting to be taken out. With a quick slide over the crate in front of her and some light feet around other debris scattered about the 'hulk's floor, she moves up to one of the isolated B1 droids in the corner of the room. "Congrats on being my new toy's first," the Togruta says to the droid as it slumps to the ground from a swift slash of one of her new techblades. Adorhi then takes off towards Test, stopping up against him back-to-back. With clenching grasps on her blades she calls out to the clone in preparation of her next move. "Get in close if you can and I'll use the distraction to strike 'em where it counts."
Stormchaser 22/12/2020 21:37
In the vacuum of the depressurised hangar, there's no tell-tale hiss to warn of the doors sliding open on opposite sides of room, but Adorhi quickly spots the super battle droid and its smaller comrade approaching from the cargo bay. She can barely open her mouth to sound a warning before another flurry of blaster fire erupts on all sides. Besides her, Test is hit four times in quick succession. Impossibly fast, he moves his vibroblade to deflect the shots, but the clone's vacsuit is badly burned. It won't hold up for long under such punishment. Another couple of shots fly at Gauss and then the big B2 unloads its wrist blaster at Test and Adorhi, both of whom leap aside to evade the rapid first blast.
RisenZed 22/12/2020 22:48
Zed focuses and takes a few quick breaths. Just like the old days, he repeated in his head. Then he swung out into the airlock and opened fire on a B1. He blasts the legs out from under it, sending the torso and head of the droid spinning into an intercept course with the same space of bulkhead about to be occupied by a sizeable chunk of droid starfighter. With the crunch of metal on metal, the B1's vocoder goes silent.
Rick Fisto 22/12/2020 22:53
Test rushes on when he sees another B2 droid gunning at him. Reaching it quickly, Test makes a large dent in it's housing with his sword, but the droid continues its assault.
hugehuman 22/12/2020 23:05
Darting forward after resetting his blaster, the vac-suited Shorlu fires another brief volley of shots at another battle droid, sending it spiraling away, deactivated.
Drake | Emperor 22/12/2020 23:06
Gauss hops around the crate, heading straight towards Adorhi. As he runs past the deactivated vulture droid, he taps at his wristpad, firing off another ion blast at the droids surrounding Test. It hits the B1, causing his servos to go haywire in the zero gravity as it shuts down completely. The blast aimed at the super battle droid however strikes a floating piece of metal, which had been upturned in the fight.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 22/12/2020 23:13
Seeing the B2 next to Test Kite tries to help his brother, aiming his ion rifle yet again at the droid. Unforuntatly a piece of spinning debris intercepts the shot saving the battle droid.
hugehuman 22/12/2020 23:24
After downing the other B1, Shorlu watches the battle play out some more, innumerable potential plans and maneuvers unfolding in his experienced little blue head. When he sees Kite lift his rifle to fire, he quickly fires two more shotsâ€”one at the piece of debris about to block Kite's shot, sending it out of the way, and another at the B2, staggering it for the ion ray to finish the job.
toddmoonbounce 23/12/2020 02:12
With her initial targets taken out, Adorhi switches focus to the last remaining droid. Darting through more of the floating debris, she slides up next to the walking circuit board swinging and connecting with her techblades to bring it down. "I much preferred doing clean up after these things than facing them head on," Adorhi reflects while regrouping with the others.
hugehuman 23/12/2020 02:19
"Yeah... hey, on that note, what in the kriff are we lookin' for here?" Shorlu's voice comes crackling over comms, whereas his pudgy spacesuit only barely conveys his impatience. "I didn't exactly get the details of this job."
toddmoonbounce 23/12/2020 02:28
"Some sort of droid processor," Adorhi recalls from the short briefing by Alastair. Turning to the clones, hoping for clarification she continues, "Gauss, any help for the uninitiated of us on what exactly the quarry is?"
Drake | Emperor 23/12/2020 04:27
"Did he give you any more information than that? We just destroyed a few droid processors, doubt he wants them from these clankas." Gauss says as he pushes one of the floating droid chassis away.
toddmoonbounce 23/12/2020 04:57
Adorhi grabs the datapad with the mission details and hands it over to her Clone counterpart.
Drake | Emperor 23/12/2020 23:12
Gauss takes the datapad from Adorhi and after a bit of reading he looks towards the group. "Looks like he wants the processor located in the hangar bay. It was used to coordinate nearby vultures in and out of it. I doubt he wants to use it to make flying through Point Nadir easier." Gauss says with a worried chuckle. Doing jobs for black market thugs was not something a clone commando was bred to do. The thought of what someone could do with a CIS droid processor scared him a bit. "During the war I could have led us straight to it, however I do remember it is somewhere around here." He pauses as he thinks, "I'll start checking the rear of the hangar." Gauss says before walking past Adorhi, handing her back the datapad, to check the back wall of the hangar for the processor. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 23/12/2020 23:13
Shrugging Kite looks at Gauss and tacturnly says "We took the job, not our business what he ends up doing with it." Following along behind Gauss he adds " Though it is worth passing the intel on to the Hutt"
Stormchaser 27/12/2020 10:39
With the battle droids dispatched, Test begins checking through the crates in the cargo bay for those that might potentially contain valuable salvage. Although many are punctured or spilled, he does find three that appear intact and begins to ferry them back towards the airlock. Meanwhile, Gauss discards two crates, before asking Kite to help him access the manifest of a third that is still sealed. After successfully connecting his wristpad to the container's dataport, it becomes apparent that the box contains around 800 credits worth of technical components. In one of the rear most corners of the hangar bay, a tall metallic cylinder covered in antenna and readouts draws Adorhi's attention as she searches for the team's objective. Could this be what they are looking for? (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 28/12/2020 15:57
Kite gathers the supplies and begins to bring them back to the airlock door. Keeping KT hovering in the middle of the room. Clicking his head comm he says "We need to get moving, those ugly squints will be back soon. And probably with bigger fire power we need to ghost before that happens."
toddmoonbounce 30/12/2020 21:40
With confident eyes on what they came to acquire, Adorhi kneels down in front of the equipment's casing, security kit in hand, to open it up and give access to the others for extraction. After a short moment, the satisfying click of a picked lock signals her success. "All yours, Gauss," she says while stepping back after completing her part of the task.
Stormchaser 30/12/2020 21:49
The protective outer shell swings open stiffly, revealing a sophisticated and complex piece of computer hardware - obviously the team's objective. It's still connected to the hardlines of the powered-down network, but disconnecting it is a trivial piece of work that just takes a few minutes.
Rick Fisto 31/12/2020 14:32
Once the three crates are on board, Test sees his friends still at work on the controller and decides to grab some droid parts scattered across the floor. Surveying the wreckage for the best pieces, his eyes come to rest on a large vulture droid in the middle of the room that looks to be completely fine. Huh. Must have run out of power. He goes over and begins to slowly push the huge droid ship into their hold. This oughta be worth a lot.
hugehuman 31/12/2020 15:50
Noticing Test cart the vulture droid away, Shorlu shrugs, almost to himself. He looks to the others. "I'm with Kite on this one. If you guys can take it from here, I'll go prep the ship for detachment."
Stormchaser 01/01/2021 00:05
As the airlock repressurises and Shorlu enters the cargo bay, the Ortolan catches an unexpected flicker of motion in his peripheral vision. However, when he takes off the oversized helmet, there is nothing there.
hugehuman 01/01/2021 00:50
Shorlu turns the helmet around in his hands, thinking momentarily that what he saw was just a stubborn stain on the grotty thing's visorâ€”but that couldn't have been the case. He mutters to himself as he takes off the rest of the suit. "If it's that stoopa lil' pit droid activating himself..." Checking first to make sure his comlink was easily accessible, he gets out his blaster and takes a few tentative steps further inside, raising a large ear to listen carefully for anything out of sorts, as he couldn't trust his eyes.
Stormchaser 01/01/2021 22:18
The cargo bay seems silent, but for the low creaking of the docking clamps against the derelict's weakened bulkheads.
hugehuman 01/01/2021 22:30
After a few tense moments, Shorlu eases his stance, letting out a small whistle. The kinds of droids we saw aren't programmed for subtlety... and how could something slip past us? Might be getting paranoid. He shakes his head and heads straight for the cockpit, keeping his blaster out until he gets there.
Stormchaser 03/01/2021 23:33
Under the Messenger's artificial gravity, the vulture droid rapidly grows extremely heavy and almost impossible to move. As Test wrestles with the huge old droid he feels a draught of cold air brush across the back of his neck.
Rick Fisto 04/01/2021 00:32
Test quickly looks around, on high alert, his mind racing through the potential threats known to be on lukrehulks. Keep cool Test. Probably just an air leak. Yeah, right.
RisenZed 04/01/2021 22:02
Zed inspects a crate, finding that some sort of shrapnel has blown several holes in it, rendering the contents either useless or scattered across the room. Moving onto another crate, he finds it sealed. "Kite, give me a hand with this!" he says over comms. (edited)
Stormchaser 04/01/2021 22:11
As Kite approaches Zed, he notices something strange in the light of his glowstick. His brother has two shadows.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 04/01/2021 23:05
Hearing his brother call, Kite jogs over to the crate. As he is reaching for his kit he looks at Zed and sees that his brother has picked up another shadow. Leaving his kit stowed he clicks on his head comm to the crew and says "We've got company, play it safe for now but Zed you have something shadowing you. Zed our best play is to have Adorhi use her montrils and walk casually around the cargo hold so we know how many of these kriffers there are." (edited)
RisenZed 04/01/2021 23:08
Zed's spine stiffens and his combat senses go into high alert. "Adorhi," he says over comms. "You getting any read from whatever's on me?"
Stormchaser 04/01/2021 23:15
Adorhi's vibrational senses tingle in the truest sense of the word when she receives Zed's message. It's strange. If there were anything nearby, then she should be able to immediately sense it and yet there's nothi-... or is there? Maybe it's her montrals. Maybe it's the Force. Maybe it's both. Whatever it is, when she concentrates she can feel something permeating the darkness around them. It's a sensation akin to static to her tremorsense. Like patches of rainstorm falling here and there across the vacuum of the shipwreck. (edited)
toddmoonbounce 04/01/2021 23:30
"I've got a bad feeling about this," Adorhi replies to Zed's inquiry. "There's definitely something here, but I don't know what."
Rick Fisto 04/01/2021 23:33
Having assumed they were dealing with cloaked droids, Test had waited patiently for Adorhi to confirm his suspicions. Her montrails, like Haspin's would have been able to feel them. But apparently not. Were they dealing with something else? Something involving the force? He now reaches out with his feelings through the force, just as he had done at the compound with the...not-Veets.
Drake | Emperor 05/01/2021 00:18

Stormchaser 05/01/2021 23:51

Rick Fisto 06/01/2021 00:05

Stormchaser 17/01/2021 00:42

RisenZed 17/01/2021 04:36

"You're right about there not being enough intel. But this looks like one last sick Seppie experiment. We never won the war. We never got to finish that fight. Even if it is a bunch of Neimoidians back there, trapped and in pain, the Seps were still experimenting on their own people. It's not right. If we leave, they win one last victory." He sighs. "But the war is over. I'm not in charge anymore. This isn't an order...it's an invitation. I want you with us. But if you can't reconcile this, I understand. Stay back with the ship. We'll try to stay in contact. If you don't hear from us in a reasonable timeframe, take the processor back and fulfill the contract."

RisenZed 23/01/2021 17:07
Zed had spent the last few weeks desperately trying to hold his crew together. Keeping his temper and trying to be the middle man. But in this one moment, he snaps. Is it because there's no money involved this time, ori'ramikad? I'll pay you if it makes you feel better, so you can get something out of it. But I thought there might just be an spark of good in that beskaryc kar'ta of yours."
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 23/01/2021 17:19
Kite unconsciously snaps to attention as Zed chastises him. Zed rarely lost his temper, and Kite struggles to comprehend why some imprisoned Seps who had done everything they could to kill him and his brothers would warrant such emotion. Kite flinches beneath his helm, when Zed mentions credits. He took credits from outsiders, only so they knew the worth of a Mandalorian Commando. He would never take anything from aliit, the only reason he was willing to help here was that his vodes cared. And he would never leave them to fight alone. In the end Kite says his voice near droid like "Their Seps, they made their choice. Make yours." and goes back to tinkering with his rifle
RisenZed 23/01/2021 17:32

I'm not sure if the Neimoidians are still alive, or if these creatures are the Neimoidians, or if they've just attracted these things. But there are othe reasons for going further in. Weapons, good salvage, things that might help us secure Point Nadir." He turns away, leaving the apology unspoken.
Rick Fisto 23/01/2021 18:43

RisenZed 23/01/2021 18:44

Drake | Emperor 23/01/2021 19:02
Gauss stop fidgeting with his wristpad to follow his brothers deeper in to the remains lucrehulk. "We should find a terminal, if it somehow still has power, maybe we can get a floor plan. If there is a machine that is hurting these creatures, it must be pulling an immense amount of power, so I can't imagine this derelict is completely without it." he pauses in thought for a moment. "Unless Test... you have another method of locating the Neimoidians?." Gauss asks of his brother who to him, is looking more and more like that of the Jedi. During the war, none of the clone troopers understood the methods and hunches of their appointed generals. However when a Jedi showed determination in something that did not seem logical to that of the clones, they followed their orders. To many times had Haspin led Hammer Squad to victory, or at least success, through the use of this unseen "Force" he spoke about on a daily basis. Gauss eventually, without realizing it much, came to trust and rely on those who "had a feeling" using the strange power. Besides, he was still curious as to what the CIS was up to years ago. (edited)
Rick Fisto 23/01/2021 21:00
"No kriffin' idea. You're up, vode."
Drake | Emperor 23/01/2021 21:06
"Terminal it is." Gauss laughs back, "Ok, maybe not so much". (edited)
Stormchaser 23/01/2021 22:22
Gauss recalls spotting a terminal through one of the doors on the far side of the hangar, but when the squad arrives the interface appears to be without power. This area appears to be the fire control bay for a quad laser cannon that is still attacked to the bulkhead. A total of four consoles line the walls with rubble at the far end of the room. (edited)
Drake | Emperor 25/01/2021 10:25
"If we had a power droid, we might have been able to access these. But we're going to have to move on." Gauss tells the group as he checks the terminal.
Stormchaser 25/01/2021 11:20
Three doors lead off to the left of the fire control deck. Two access now empty droid bays, while the third leads into the cargo bay that Test previously searched the forward section of. In the rear of the cargo bay are two additional crates, as well as another control panel next to a matching door on the far side of the room.
Stormchaser 31/01/2021 01:00
The door on the far side of the cargo bay can be dragged open with a little force, and opens up in to a corridor running perpendicular to the doorway. Five additional doorways line its length. Two on the near side and three on the other. Those on the near side are open and obviously lead into more droid bays. Those opposite are closed and marked as storage rooms.
Drake | Emperor 31/01/2021 23:11
Gauss proceeds to carefully check the two open doorways, finding no presence of any droids. "No droids here, must have been activated long before we came. Or recently, I'm hoping for the former." he says over the comms as he continues down the hall.
hugehuman 01/02/2021 21:36
Back on the Messenger, Shorlu drums his fingers on the console next to him in the pilot's chair, his padded fingers making a plip plip plip plop sound, rather than the tapping one might expect from most other species. I dunno why people hate getting stuck with the ship. This is fine. Hell, I could put on some holotunesâ€” He clicks his snout in annoyance. Kark. Those were on the Bane. Or check out that funny little holovid I picked up on Nar Shaddaa... Loveliest Lekku of the Galaxy, Volume #34... He curls his trunk in anguish. Nope. Bane. It's space dust now. Not even any good food on this rig. And meanwhile, sounds like they're about to go solve the mystery of a haunted wreck from the Clone Wars... yeah. That's not interesting at all. He sighs. "Kark it." he announces to the empty cockpit. "I'm goin'." He storms off to find the pit droid he and Kite bought from Kricket. (edited)
1
Rick Fisto 02/02/2021 21:28
Test cycles through his memory, trying to recall the op he started planning with Haspin just before the war ended. Hammer squad was going to infiltrate one of these droid ships in order to extricate a high-value target, but it turned out that the target was on a different ship, and another team ended up handling the issue. As point man, Test spent the most time going over floor plans while other members of the team quickly prepared for other roles. Parts were starting to come back to him, but this derelict was in such bad shape, he wasn't sure if his general knowledge would be good enough if entire sections might be missing or blocked. "Come on brothers. I think it's this way."
Rick Fisto 03/02/2021 23:10
Test goes up the the door he believes leads in the right direction, and tries forcing it open.
Stormchaser 04/02/2021 19:48
Test heads for the door farthest to the right, shoving at the wedged durasteel plating with a heave. The walls whine and creak and then Zed comes to give his brother a hand and the door abruptly gives way, sliding aside to reveal the room beyond. The chamber is roughly ten by fifteen feet, with a cargo crate stacked against the left wall. Rubble is piled against the far side where the vacuum has pulled it up against another door.
RisenZed 04/02/2021 22:19
Zed slaps Test on the shoulder, the sound only transmitting through the fabric of their environment suits. "Door too heavy for you, old man?" He laughs, trying to dispel the last few minutes of tension.
Rick Fisto 04/02/2021 22:23
Shaking his head as his brother slips back into their old routine, bantering over their minutes-long difference in age. "Yeah, I think I might throw out my hip. You think maybe you could bring your youthful exuberance over here and give me a hand?"
RisenZed 04/02/2021 22:24
"Yeah, save your hip," Zed says. "I don't want Kite and Gauss to have to rig you up a hover-chair."
Rick Fisto 04/02/2021 22:25
"If they do, I'll let you drive it once you're old enough to get your learner's permit."
RisenZed 04/02/2021 22:29
"Can't wait," Zed says as the door slides open. "Let's clear that door."
Stormchaser 05/02/2021 23:17
Bit by bit, the rubble is tossed aside until the door can be accessed. It's stiff like the last one, but open a crack and it looks like there might be some kind of light blinking on the far side.
Rick Fisto 06/02/2021 00:33
"Okay, kid. Let's see what you got," Test says to Zed as he puts his shoulder to the door edge.
RisenZed 06/02/2021 00:36
"Right behind you, old man," Zed says, bracing against the door next to Test. (edited)
Stormchaser 07/02/2021 00:38
The door is stiff, but no match for the brothers' combined strength and the durasteel plating slides aside, revealing a room that must have remained sealed until now. In the centre stands a tall pillar covered in lights and readouts, and arrayed around the pillar like spokes are eight pods of some kind. They look like they're designed to hold a humanoid occupant. (edited)
hugehuman 07/02/2021 02:45
Shorlu places the disc-topped metal frame of the pit droid in the cockpit, and flicks its photoreceptor to get it activated. "Alright, listen up, I gotta simple task for you. You monitor this stationâ€”right here," he slaps the top of the sensor station to make his point. "You see any weird transmissions, or more ships approaching, call one of the preregistered frequencies on this and let us know." He hands the droid his comlink. Starting to leave, he turns back, pointing a finger at it. "One more thing. No flying the ship, got it? Keep the engine running though, I'll be back." The Ortolan rushes out and gets his enviro-suit back on before hurrying back through the airlock.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 07/02/2021 04:45
Kite shifts his HUD view to his tracker droid's visuals and sends the M.K through the door. Focusing it's visuals on the pods and examining any likely areas to set a trap.
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 07/02/2021 14:25
Shifting back to his helmet view, Kite holds his hand up and gives the rooms is clear signal. Walking into the room he opens a comm channel "Gauss let's check the readout's by the pods, hopefully these are the hut'uunla. We'll open their pods bang out and hope the other freaks let us go." (edited)
RisenZed 07/02/2021 20:44
Zed carefully moves across the room to one of the pods. He wipes the condensation from the small window on the pod's front panel to reveal a Neimoidian, it's eyes closed. "It's them," Zed says. "Anyone know what this thing does?"
Drake | Emperor 07/02/2021 23:17
"On it! Gauss quickly heads over to one of the readouts and begins to go over the information. After spends a few minutes scanning the system he comes to a conclusion, "Seems like these are highly sophisticated cyro pods. It's scanning their brains for... something... I have no idea what it could be however." he stands before the console, hand to the chin of his suit. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 10/02/2021 18:48

Rick Fisto 10/02/2021 20:48

Drake | Emperor 12/02/2021 04:48

It can't scan for possible foreign objects, Test...sorry... he says with a sigh, knowing his brother has been distressed about the possibility of them, and maybe the rest of the clone armor, being controlled by some machine inside their heads.
RisenZed 12/02/2021 04:51

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 12/02/2021 05:08
Finally something sensible, repeatedly rings through Kite's head as he moves towards Gauss. He wasn't sure how this would sit with his Vode, and wanted to spare him any pain he could. Gruffly saying "Move aside, I'll do it."
Drake | Emperor 14/02/2021 00:03
"Alright..." Gauss points out how to deactivate the system to Kite before stepping aside. He knew how passionate his brother was about these kinds of things, and figured it was better that way. (edited)
Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 14/02/2021 01:28
Kite watches Gauss instructions intently and after seeing the all clear from Zed begins the shutdown sequence
Stormchaser 14/02/2021 09:53
One by one, the lights on the tower blink out and the system vents a brief stream of water vapour that immediately crystallises and freezes in the vacuum. The illumination of the Neimodians' pods fades and a small maintenance panel in the side of the column slides upwards, revealing access to a single translucent crystal at its heart.
Rick Fisto 14/02/2021 17:18
Test reaches out to grab the crystal and immediately stops himself. "We may need that. Gauss, can you get it without touching it? I don't want a repeat of the fell star. And can you download a schematic of this system or take as many holo recordings as you can in case we need to rebuild this? I hope we are doing the right thing, but....you never know." (edited)
Stormchaser 17/02/2021 14:26
The crystal is suspended in its chamber by several wires that connect it to the workings of the machine.
Rick Fisto 17/02/2021 15:46
Test realizes he's wearing a vac-suit, so his concern is, hopefully, misplaced. Just put it in a metal box ASAP, Test. He raises his hand and reaches out to the crystal with the force.
toddmoonbounce 17/02/2021 15:52
Seeing Test raise his arm at the crystal, Adorhi reflexively sends her thoughts towards the clone in guidance while another wrestles in her own mind. Please, no repeats of the Star...but it was worth it, no?
Drake | Emperor 17/02/2021 16:15
Gauss looks at Test, giving a shrug in his suit. He goes through his tools for something to grab onto the crystal with, but doesn't come up with much. "The suit will probably be enough to protect us, if we're worried about that...but it's the same as the fell star... I doubt much can stop it..." He answers to his brother as Test raises his hand, and the crystal starts to shake. "Orr...you can do that." (edited)
Stormchaser 17/02/2021 23:42
The crystal begins to shake and vibrate and first one wire and then another snaps off of the surface abruptly as the connections fracture. Finally, the last of them tear free and the crystal flies out into Test's gloved hand. Glancing across the room, he spots a similar apparition to before drifting near one of the pods. A 'sound' like somebody breathing out reaches the clone's mind and the spectre dissolves into nothingness.
RisenZed 17/02/2021 23:56
"Was that...was that it?" Zed asks, his breath a bit shaky. "Is that what they needed?"
Rick Fisto 18/02/2021 00:05

Drake | Emperor 18/02/2021 13:38

Tegan J Gaming (Aeryn/DJM) 20/02/2021 18:34

Stormchaser 20/02/2021 21:23
Zed and Test gather up a total of six additional crates, for a total of ten salvaged. According to the manifests, the contents are likely worth something to the tune of ten thousand credits overall. Gauss's scans are inconclusive, but concerning. While it's entirely possible that the wreck could remain stable for quite some time, there are also definite indications of severely compromised structural integrity. It's entirely possible that the hulk could start to fall apart without warning at any moment. Back on the Starworm, Kite doesn't find any further life signs.
Drake | Emperor 20/02/2021 21:30
His scans coming up short, Gauss grabs the set of mechanical tools found in the cargo bay. He heads back out onto the Starworm to begin work on dismantling the large laser cannon they came across earlier. The creaks and groans of the massive ship slowly become more frequent as he works. "That can't be good" he thinks to himself while applying his hydrospanner to the various bolts holding the cannon together. "Hey, we may want to move faster. Sounds like this part of the hulk isn't going to stay together much longer." Gauss says over the comms to his companions. (edited)
Stormchaser 21/02/2021 16:55
As if to emphasise Gauss's point, the Messenger shakes abruptly as one of the larger pieces of drifting debris rebounds off of its deflector shield.

hugehuman 21/02/2021 17:40

RisenZed 24/02/2021 21:52

Stormchaser 26/02/2021 23:36

RisenZed 27/02/2021 00:58

RisenZed 27/02/2021 02:04

hugehuman 27/02/2021 02:35
Kite finishes his calculations early and sends them into hyperspace, Shorlu blinks, then looks over at Adorhi, and they share a knowing gaze. "'Aaaand so I saaay farewell, my space-bound angel," he begins to sing the well-known spacer's shanty, hopping out of his chair and offering a hand to dance.
